Constance souhaite augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et pourvoir favorablement à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Constance is a 45-year-old divorcee who lives in Adidogomé. Constance lives alone and actively works to improve herself. In order to earn an income, Constance sells cooking pots and plastic products which she displays in her district. Constance gets her supplies three times a month and is requesting this loan so that she can order cooking pots. Constance would like to increase her profit margins and to be able to successfully meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 21 cooking pots.

loans.name: Benkadi N°Ii Group

texts.fr: Mamou,  est celle qui a la main sur le bélier sur photo, elle est emboucheuse ovines, âgée de38 ans, il  habite au Mali, mariée et mère  de 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 14 ans dont 2 scolarisés., son mari est cultivateur. Elle exerce ce métier il y a 5 ans de cela, il s’approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux  marchés de sa localité. Elle sollicite  au près du RMCR un prêt   accroitre ses activités ovines, le prêt servira à  subvenir aux charges familiale soins sanitaire, habillement et aidé son mari. Après les ventes elle peut réaliser un bénéfice de 25000FCFA.  Elle rêve d’être un grand emboucher dans la zone et utile pour la communauté.
texts.en:
Mamou, the woman holding the ram in the picture, practices sheep-fattening. She is 38 years old, lives in Mali, is married and the mother of 4 children aged between 3 and 14, two of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer. She has been practicing sheep-fattening for 5 years and buys and sells her animals at the local markets.

She is requesting a loan from RMCR in order to expand her sheep-fattening activities. The loan will enable her to take care of her family's health and clothing expenses and to support her husband. She can make a potential profit of 25 000 francs after selling her livestock. She dreams of owning a large-scale sheep-fattening operation in her locality and of being useful to the community.

loans.use: to buy livestock for later resale.

loans.name: Felina

texts.es: FELINA: Es una mujer amable, pertenece a la etnia miskita de la comunidad de Krukira, se localiza a dos horas del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar. Desde hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de marisco de manera ambulante, generando sus ingresos propios con lo cual aporta económicamente en el hogar. Solicita financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y establecer una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda de tambo y madera, e incrementar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
Felina is a friendly woman who belongs to the Miskito ethnic group of the Krukira community, which is located two hours from the town of Puerto Cabezas. She is 36, married, and has 5 school-aged children. She has worked as a travelling saleswoman selling seafood for 14 years. This permits her to make her own living so she can bring in money for the home.

Felina is asking for a loan so she can diversify her products and establish a small grocery store in her wooden stilt house, thus increasing her earnings. Her dream is to be a successful shopkeeper.

loans.use: to set up a small grocery store in her wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru: Ее зовут Мавлюда. Ей 25 лет. Она мать одиночка. Мавлюда вместе с сыном живут в маленьком районе Сарбанд. Здесь же она работает. Мавлюда год назад начала работать, чтобы прокормить своего ребенка и себя. Мавлюда арендовала торговую точку на базаре и сейчас занимается продажей платков. Мавлюда любит свою работу, она каждый день общается с новым людьми и помогает им делать выбор. Мавлюда просит ей помочь расширить деятельность, Она привезет больше товара и привлечет внимание клиентов. Мавлюда надеется на поддержку и уверена, что ее ждет удача.
texts.en:
This is Mavlyuda. She is 25 years old. She is a single mother. Mavlyuda lives with her son in the small district of Sarband. She also works here. 

Mavlyuda started working about one year ago, in order to support her child and herself. Mavlyuda rented a retail store at a bazaar and now sells shawls. Mavlyuda loves her job. Every day she socialises with new people and helps them with choosing. 

Mavlyuda requests help with expanding her business. She will import more goods and attract the attention of more clients. Mavlyuda hopes for support, and believes that success awaits her.

loans.use: to buy more shawls and expand her business.

loans.name: Kulnara

texts.ru: Кулнара, 51 год, в разводе, мать 3 детей, живет Кулнара с дочерью и внучкой. У нее высшее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она уже 15 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Кулнары, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: корова, 40 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,20 ГА земли, где она выращивает фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход Кулнары составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Поэтому Кулнара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для закупки скота для увеличения поголовья. Кулнара намерена и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота и развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Kulnara is 51 years old, divorced, and has three children. Kulnara lives with her daughter and granddaughter. She has higher education. She has worked in field and animal husbandry for 15 years in order to provide income for her family. 

Thanks to Kulnara's persistence, purposefulness and hardworkingness, today she has a cow and forty sheep. She also has a 1.20 hectare plot of land, where she cultivates beans and clover. 

Kulnara's monthly income is about 16,000 som (KGS). These means are not sufficient for a respectable life or for supporting her family. Thus, Kulnara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock in order to increase their headcount. Kulnara intends to further increase the livestock headcount and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Cayetano está integrado con 23 mujeres, cada una de ellas se puso como meta crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona, y a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza por conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Roxana, quien vende postres que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, ya que sus postres son muy ricos siempre tiene muy buena venta, y con los medios que tiene ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Roxana pide este préstamo para poder comprar azúcar, harina, levaduras, huevos, y otros insumos para poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace, también está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is made up of 23 women. Each one of them has set of goal to grow, not only economically but also as a person, and through this poverty elimination program to know the life situation of each one.

One of the members is Roxana who sells desserts that she herself makes and later sells on foot. Since her desserts are very tasty, she always has very good sales and, through the means that she has, she helps her family and her loved ones.

Roxana is requesting this loan to be able to buy sugar, flour, yeast, eggs and other ingredients to be able to keep delighting her customers with the delicacies that she makes. Also, she is very thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to keep improving so she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, yeast, eggs and other ingredients to make desserts.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Librada de la Ciudad de Itá  está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariela quien vende comidas, ella misma desde temprano en la mañana se levanta a hacerlas y después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Mariela comenta que por medio de su trabajo tiene los ingresos necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, verduras, condimentos y otros, para poder seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas. Cada una de las integrantes está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una de ellas
texts.en:
The Santa Librada group from the city of Ita is in its tenth cycle of the women's committee program where all work and are doing the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Mariela who sells food. She herself wakes up early in the morning to make (the food) and later sells on foot. Mariela tells us that through her work she earns the income necessary to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other items to be able to keep making her dishes. Each one of the members is putting forth her best effort to be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other products to make food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and yarns for her new business.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Améyo est une femme divorcée qui vit Avédji avec ses trois enfants. Améyo travaille  activement pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Améyo vend des produits d’alimentations générales et des légumes dans son quartier afin d’avoir son bénéfice. Améyo achète ses provisions deux fois par mois sur un marché local. Améyo demande ce crédit pour commander des paniers de légumes, de poissons et de tomates afin de maximiser ainsi son revenu pour permettre l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en: Améyo is a divorcee who lives in Avédji with her 3 children. Améyo is actively working to ensure her children's development. In order to reach her goals, Améyo earns a living selling groceries and vegetables in her district. Améyo gets her supplies twice a month at the local market. Améyo is requesting this loan so that she can order baskets of vegetables, fish, and tomatoes, so that she can maximise her income and enable her children's development.

loans.use: to buy 6 baskets of vegetables, 6 baskets of fish and 4 baskets of tomatoes.

loans.name: Ocampo Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ocampo Poty está en su ciclo número 3º  Del programa de comité de mujeres, las integrantes se unieron y pusieron como meta dar lo mejor de sí para poder superar su situación de pobreza, todo esto también a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María es la presidenta de este grupo, es una mujer muy entusiasta que lucha por ser el ejemplo no solo para su familia, sino también para sus compañeras del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas de todo tipo, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas y otros.
Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The Ocampo Poty group is in its third cycle of the women's committee program. The members united and set a goal of giving the best of themselves to be able to overcome poverty, all of this through the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Maria who is the president of this group. She is a very enthusiastic woman who works hard to be an example not only for her family but also for her group colleagues. She is dedicated to selling drinks and requests this loan to be able to buy drinks of all types like beers, wines, sodas and others.

They are all thankful for the opportunity that they are receiving to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy various drinks to sell like beers, wine, sodas and others.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Lucia Poty de la Ciudad de Itá  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que también forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Karen, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas, que lo hace de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada que lucha para poder crecer y mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas frescas para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The group named Santa Lucia Poty of the city of Ita is in its first cycle of the women's committee program. It is a new group that also is part of the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Karen who is dedicated to selling fresh fruit on foot. She is a very hard working woman who sacrifices and works hard to be able to grow and improve.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fresh fruit so she can keep selling as she has been. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Gabriela Susana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Gabriela, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 2 años de edad. El marido  administra un centro de diversión.
Doña Gabriela es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos para ayudarle a su marido con los con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos por catalogo y  productos Avon (perfumes, cremas, bisutería, etc.),  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale casi todos los días en las mañanas ya que a esa hora su mamá le cuida a su pequeña y se le hace más fácil salir, también vende en su casa donde sus clientes llegan cuando necesitan algún producto, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 3 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar lo suyo.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, perfumes,cremas, bisuterías, y todo lo que ella vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su pequeña que es su vida.
texts.en: Twenty-three year old Gabriela lives in this place.  She is in a common-law relationship, and has a two year old daughter.  Her husband manages an entertainment center.  Gabriela is a housewife and, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, she is engaged in a business selling shoes by catalog, and Avon products such as perfume, creams, and costume jewelry.  She sells door-to-door, and goes out almost every morning because this is when her mother can take care of her child, and this makes it easier to go out.  She also sells from home where her customers come when they need products.  She leaves the merchandise on credit and collects payment every eight days.  She has been engaged in this business for over three years, which allows her to earn her share.  This loan is for the purchase of shoes, perfume, costume jewelry, and everything she sells.  Her dream is to give the best to her child, who is her life.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, perfume, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is aged 38, married to Alice, and he supports three children. He has been a poultry farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him 5,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more poultry for egg production for sale to clients, so that he can meet their demands for egg supply.

He plans to use the profits gained to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, and to educate his children and provide them with better medication. His hope is to improve his living standards and expand his agricultural sector through purchasing a hatchery for hatching more chicks for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry for egg production for sale to clients.

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.ru: Этому мужчине 42 года. Его зовут Кахрамон. Кахрамон живет в маленьком городке Конибодом. Его жена и сын живут и работают заграницей. Он на Родине занимается животноводством и починкой старых мопедов. Он покупает старых и сломанных мопедов, и легковых машин, ремонтирует их и продает. Так он зарабатывает на жизнь. Кахрамон прости ему помочь купить одного теленка, чтобы обеспечиться молоком и в будущем расширить свою животноводческую деятельность. Кахрамон верит, что его услышат и поддержат.
texts.en:
This is Kahramon. He is 42 years old. Kahramon lives in the small city Konibodom. His wife and son live and work overseas. He is engaged in animal husbandry and repairs old mopeds in Tajikistan. He buys old and broken mopeds and automobiles, repairs them, and resells them for a living. 

Kahramon requests for help with buying one calf to provide milk, and in the future expand his animal husbandry business. Kahramon believes that his request will be heard and he will be supported.

loans.use: to buy one calf.

loans.name: Suurmakan

texts.ru: Суурмакан, 54 года, замужем. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Суурмакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 20 овец, лошадь, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,27 ГА, на котором выращивает арбузы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 27,600 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Суурмакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота племенных пород для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Суурмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, также мечтает накопить на помощь в постройке дома для сына.
texts.en:
Suurmakan is 54 years old and married. She has secondary education. She is engaged in animal and field husbandry in order to provide supplementary income for her family, having started 15 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 20,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to Suurmakan's persistent hard work, today on her farm thereare six cows, twenty sheep, and a horse. There is also a land plot of 1.27 hectares, on which she cultivates watermelons. The monthly income is about 27,600 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Suurmakan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to buy purebred livestock to increase her livestock headcount. Suurmakan plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further increase of the number of livestock. She also dreams of saving to help build a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy purebred livestock for increasing the headcount of livestock.

loans.name: Bibijon

texts.ru: Бибичон 49 летняя жительница городка Конибодом. Бичичон замужем и живет вместе с сыном, невесткой и внуком. Она продвигает торговую деятельность вот уже 5 лет. Бибичон месяц не работала по семейным обстоятельствам и сейчас хочет выйти на работу, так как от ее бизнес приносить большую часть дохода в семейный бюджет. Бибичон просит ей помочь приобрести и привезти новый сезонный товар детской одежды. Тогда она сможет выйти на работу и не потерять деятельность.
texts.en:
Bibijon is 49 years old and lives in Konibodom city. Bibijon is married and lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and grandson. She has been pushing on with her retail business for five years. 

Bibijon did not work for a month due to family circumstances, and now she wants to resume work, as the income from her work forms a large part of the family budget. Bibijon requests for help with purchasing and importing the latest seasons of children's clothes. Then she will be able to resume work and not lose business.

loans.use: to purchase and import children's clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
One lighted candle can illuminate a room. A person who is a blessing to others is like a candle that brings light and warmth to the house. Mila is a blessing to others because she has the capacity to give employment to five workers in her candle making shop located in Prosperidad, Agusan Del Sur, the capital town of the province. She’s been in this candle making business for twenty three years now. She continuously appreciates the importance of candles, such as emergency lighting in case of electric interruption, as decorative items, or fragrances. Because of these uses, candles are saleable throughout the year.

Mila would like to enhance her business further so as to secure the salaries of her workers, to ensure that her children will finish their college degree, and to acquire a 4x4 vehicle in the near future. As a step towards realizing these dreams, she would like to borrow 50,000 PHP in additional capital to procure raw materials for candle making. It will surely increase her production, sales, and profit. 

Mila is married to Elmer, a businessman who is always supportive of her and her business. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to procure raw materials for candle making.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз молодая и начинающая предпринимательница славного городка Конибодом. Ей всего 21 год. Она замужем. Дилафруз дома предоставляет услуги швеи. Этим она зарабатывала себе на карманные расходы. Теперь Дилафруз решили начать новую деятельность в сфере торговли продуктов питания. Она нашла помещение, поставила полки для продуктов ей остается только приобрести первый товар продуктов питания. Дилафруз надеется, что ей помогут начать свой первый бизнес. Дилафруз надеется, что ее ждет удача, и бизнес будет процветать.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a young and budding entrepreneur from the pleasant city Konibodom. She is only 21 years old. She is married. Dilafruz provides tailoring services from home. She earns pocket money from this. 

Now Dilafruz has decided to start a new business in the field of retailing food products. She has found premises, installed shelves for the goods, and all that remains is for her to obtain the first food products for sale. Dilafruz hopes that she will be helped with starting her first business. Dilafruz hopes that success awaits her, and the business will flourish.

loans.use: to open a grocery shop and buy groceries.

loans.name: Rozigul

texts.ru: Розигул доброжелательная и трудолюбивая женщина 47 лет. Она замужем. Розигул живет вместе со своей семьёй  в городе Душанбе, она  работает в информационном агентстве Мардуми. Всё что она зарабатывает, расходуется на содержание семьи. У неё нет возможности накопить денег для других более перспективных целей. Розигул должна оплачивать за обучение дочери. Но у неё не хватает денежных средств на другие потребности, для  этого она  обратился в ООО МДО Арванд за получением кредита с целью оплаты учебы её дочери. Она очень благодарна ООО МДО "Арванд" за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Rozigul is a friendly and hardworking 47 year old woman. She is married. Rozigul lives with her family in Dushanbe city. She works in Mardumi news agency. All that she earns is spent on supporting her family. She is unable to save money for other more long-term goals. 

Rozigul has to pay for her daughter's education. However she does not have the financial resources for other demands, and thus she has applied to MDO Arvand to receive a loan for paying for her daughter's studies. She is very thankful to MDO Arvand for the support and confidence.

loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Unise

texts.en:
Unise is married with five children and is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She supports her family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Unise took an educational loan for her daughter, Lynrose, who is 15 years old and the youngest of four children in the family. She is studying for her Bachelor of Secondary Education and is currently in the 1st year of this 4 year course. Unise is borrowing 10,000 PHP to pay Lynrose's tuition fees for the first semester of the 2015-2016 school year.

When she graduates, Lynrose plans to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Hafetha

texts.en:
Hafetha is 58 years old and lives in Salt. She is conservative woman and asked her son, Odai, to take her place in the photo. She has a dream, which is to see her children successful and special.

Her son, Odai, is majoring in accounting and working hard to complete his education and find work with a good salary. Now, Odai is working in a private company while going to school to help his parents with the household expenses.

Lately, Hafetha has been facing financial problems and cannot help Odai to cover his semester fees for school. Therefore, she applied for an education loan to help him to pay his university fees and complete his education.

loans.use: to cover her son's school semester fees.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert operates a bar and a transport business. He is 42 years old and a single parent with 6 children. He works very hard to achieve his dream of educating his children and looking after them very well. 

Robert is requesting credit to buy another car to expand his transport business. He is faced with the challenge of market competition and high fuel prices.

loans.use: to buy another car for his transport business.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a single man living in a sector in Jordan called Ramtha. He is studying to get his bachelor's degree in mining engineering, and he is now in his third year. 

The income that comes from his father’s job is income for his family, which consists of five members. Recently his father has faced some problems that led Abdalla to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. 

Abdalla`s future plan is to work in the same field.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 40 years old and lives with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Sajida's adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life; he owns a crockery shop. 

Sajida is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. Her husband requires additional capital to buy utensils and crockery for his shop. He would use the Kiva loan to purchase more utensils and crockery so as to offer more variety to his clients. 

Sajida hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and crockery for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is lucky that her residence in Talisay City, Cebu is located in front of a national high school. It’s productive for her “sari-sari” (variety) store business, water distribution service, and barbeque stall. She runs the variety store and barbeque stall together with two paid helpers, while her husband, Robert, operates the water distribution service. 

But this is a lean season for their businesses. School vacation is not favorable for them. Yet the couple keeps on and prepares themselves to recover some losses when the school opens again. Last June, classes already started and the demand for their business increased. Maribel wants to meet this growing demand and she plans to buy cases of soft drinks, other beverages, snack items and ingredients for barbeque. She will also buy additional water containers so her husband can supply more households in their community. A 25,000 PHP loan will be of great help to boost her income and savings. She is working toward owning a water refilling station in the near future. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks, other beverages, snack items and ingredients for barbeque.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta has owned her variety store for three years. She is happily married and blessed with three children. She also grows rice crops, which she has done for more than 30 years. Benedicta would like to buy inventory for her store, such as detergent and bath soap, candies, soft drinks, and charcoal, but she doesn't have enough capital. She is seeking a loan of 50,000 PHP. Benedicta hopes for approval of her requested loan to keep her variety store progressive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as detergent and bath soap, candies, soft drinks and charcoal for her variety store

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Caacupé está integrado por 20 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que están poniendo todo lo mejor de sí para poder ir superando s situación de pobreza por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Mirta es una de las integrantes de este unido grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se dedica al humilde trabajo de venta de remedios naturales. Su sueño es poder seguir con su trabajo para poder ayudar a su familia con su emprendimiento. 
Mirta pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para la venta, y de esa forma continuar dando a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called Virgen de Caacupé is made up of 20 women. All of them are hardworking and fighters who are giving the best of themselves to overcome their situation of poverty through a poverty elimination program.

Mirta is one of the members of this united group. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who does the humble work of selling natural remedies.  Her dream is to continue with her work to help her family with her enterprise.

Mirta is asking for this loan to buy natural remedies to sell and in this way continue giving her customers a good variety of products. They are all thankful for the opportunity they are receiving to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado KUÑA GUAPA está en su ciclo número 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza para poder salir adelante. Ella tiene un comedor donde trabaja desde tempranas horas del día, preparando todo para servir a sus clientes, es una real luchadora que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de carnes, verduras, harina, huevos, aceite y otros productos para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena atención y agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called KUÑA GUAPA is in its 11th cycle of the Women's Committee where they all work and help each other to get ahead. One of the members is María, who is the president of this group. She is a very hardworking woman who is a fighter and she strives to get ahead. She has a restaurant where she works starting from the very early hours of the day, preparing everything to serve her customers. She is a real fighter who strives to get ahead. 

She is asking for this loan to buy meats, vegetables, flour, eggs, oil and more products to be bale to keep offering her customers good service. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, flour, eggs, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado KUÑA GUAPA 1 se formó en la ciudad de Asunción, está integrado por 15 mujeres, cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida  y las de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a vender prendas variadas de todo tipo, es una mujer muy luchadora que poco a poco ha ido creciendo y mejorando por poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su emprendimiento. Maria comenta que es difícil su trabajo pero que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jeans, camisas, pantalones, y otros. Maria está contenta ya que a través del programa podrá capacitarse e ir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called KUÑA GUAPA 1 was formed in the city of Asunción. It is made up of 15 women, each of them making her best effort to be able to grow and improve her and her family's living conditions.

One of the members is Maria, who sells all types of clothing. She is a woman who is a fighter who little by little has grown and improved to help her family through her enterprising. Maria remarks that her work is difficult but that she is giving her best effort to help her family.  

She is asking for this loan to buy jeans, shirts, pants and more. Maria is happy because through this program she will be able to be trained and grow.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, pants and more.

loans.name: Wakati

texts.en:
Wakati is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Wakati operates a grocery, a vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 



With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Benkadi N°I Group

texts.fr: Halan est membre du groupe Benkadi, mariée et mère de  6 enfants, âgés de 4 à 16 ans, elle est analphabète, réside  au Mali, âgés de 36 ans c’est elle qui tient la calebasse et le bélier en main. Elle fait l’élevage des ovins et caprins. Depuis 5 ans elle fait  cette activité, les rêves et les espoirs de Halan est d’avoir plus d’argent pour accroitre ses activités, et après ses ventes de tirer plus de bénéfice pour subvenir aux besoins familiale. Par manque de moyen financier elle fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir mener son activité. Elle s’approvisionne et vend dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Elle  gagne comme bénéfice 10 000 FCFA par mois.Le prêt l’aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille : santé, scolaire etc. Les obstacles auxquels se heurte  de  Halan est souvent la chute des prix.
texts.en:
Halan is a member of the group called Benkadi, married and the mother of six children, aged from 4 to 16 years. She is illiterate, lives in Mali, 36 years old, and she is the one who is holding the gourd bowl and feeding the ram. 

Halan raises sheep and goats. For five years she has been in this business. Her hopes and dreams are to have more money to grow her business, and, after the sales, to make more profit so as to cover her family's needs. 

Since she lacks financial means, Halan came to RMCR so that she can keep running her business. She buys animals and resells them in the weekly fairs of her region. She makes 10,000 F CFA in profit per month. The loan will help her to support her family and cover healthcare, school fees, etc. The obstacles Halan encounters are relative to falling prices.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale later on

loans.name: Manizha

texts.ru:
Манижа доброжелательная и молодая студентка, ей 23 года, она  учится в магистратуре. Она не замужем. 
Манижа живет с родителями в городе Душанбе и работает в "САНИИОСП". Всё что она зарабатывает расходует на содержание семьи. У неё нет возможности накопить денег для других целей. Манижа должна оплачивать за учебу в ВУЗ-е. Но у неё не хватает денежных средств и для этого она  обратился в ООО МДО Арванд за получением кредита с целью оплаты за учебу. Она очень благодарна ООО МДО "Арванд" за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Manizha is a kind-hearted and young student. She is 23 years old. She is studying for a master's degree. She is unmarried. Manizha lives with her parents in the city of Dushanbe and works for "SANIIOSP" [the Central Asian Research Institute of Foundations and Underground Structures]. Everything that she earns is spent on supporting her family. She is not able to save money for other purposes. Manizha must pay for tuition at her university but she does not have enough funds and so she has applied to MDO Arvand to receive a loan with the aim of paying for her tuition. She is very grateful to MDO Arvand for its support and trust.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Las Obreras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre “Las Obreras”, es un grupo nuevo, que está en su ciclo 1, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que como un medio es utilizado para poder salir de esa situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estela, quien tiene una peluquería que pudo montar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, ella es una mujer muy luchadora que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha ido mejorando cada día. Comenta que por medio de su trabajo tiene los ingresos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros, para poder seguir con su trabajo y seguir invirtiendo en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
This new group, entitled 'Las Obreras' (working-class women), is in its first lending cycle of the poverty eradication programme, which is used to lift women out of poverty.
Estela, one of the members, spared no effort and made many a sacrifice to open her own hair salon.
She never gives up and has managed to improve her situation day after day thanks to her dedication.
She says that the income derived from her business means she can help her family and her loved ones.
She asks for the loan to buy dye, cream, shampoo, conditioner, and other supplies, in order to keep her business going and properly stocked.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her hair salon.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
San Jose está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Es un grupo nuevo donde todas tienen una gran expectativa y están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Clara, quien entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que vende diversos tipos de comestibles, que prepara desde temprano todos los días, y luego sale a vender. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos, panificados y otros, para que pueda seguir con su emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
San José Group is in its first cycle of the women's committee programme, where everyone works hard and helps each other to improve their lot in life.
The members of this new group have high hopes and are currently taking a survey designed to assess their level of poverty in order to rise out of it.
Clara, one of the members, says that she sells various types of food, that she makes herself very early every day before going out to sell.
She is very hard-working and is fighting to carve out a better life for herself.
She asks for the loan to buy vegetables, meat, spices, bread, and other ingredients, in order to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por La Amistad Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que se unieron para poder trabajar y salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una de las integrantes del grupo quiere salir adelante.
Audelina es integrante de este grupo, tiene una modesta despensa que monto con mucho esfuerzo y que hoy es el sostén de su familia. Comenta que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando día con día, y a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar comestibles, bebidas, panificados, verduras, frutas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Eighteen women decided to form this group in order to be able to work and improve their lot in life so as to help their families and loved ones.
They take part in the poverty elimination programme and not one of them is not determined to carve out a better life for herself.
Audelina spared no effort to set up a small shop of her own. This business is now her family's only source of income.
Audelina says that she does the best she can to improve day after day and fulfil the objectives of the programme.
She asks for the loan to buy food, drinks, bread, vegetables, fruit, and other items, in order to keep her business going.
She is grateful for the opportunity afforded to the group.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: La Lomita Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Lomita está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Leticia quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de empanadas que hace tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella es una persona muy buena con las comidas, es por ello que le va muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus empandas para la venta, como ser carne, condimentos, harina huevos, aceites y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
La Lomita Group is in its first cycle of the women's committee programme, where everyone works hard and helps each other to improve their lot in life.
The women take part in a survey to assess their level of poverty. Three of them were found to be living in extreme hardship, below the poverty line.
Leticia, a member, spares no effort and works hard every day selling empanadas. She can thus help support her family and loved ones.
She is a fantastic cook and her sales reflect her talent.
She asks for the loan to buy the ingredients she needs to make empanadas to sell: meat, spices, flour, eggs, cooking oil, etc.
She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Primavera está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Carina a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y con su venta de sabanas, almohadas y otras prendas pudo ir saliendo adelante para poder ayudar a su familia y otros seres queridos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que poco a poco está mejorando su vida gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo.
La Sra. Carina solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar sabanas y almohadas en mayor cantidad y calidad  para que pueda vender  lo que le ayudará a tener más capital y a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group 'Primavera' (spring) is in its second cycle of the women's committee programme.
The women take part in a survey to assess their level of poverty. Three of them were found to be living in extreme hardship, below the poverty line.
Carina, a member, spares no effort and works hard every day selling bed sheets, pillows, and other such items. She can thus help support her family and loved ones.
She is a very hard-working woman who is steadily improving her life thanks to her efforts and dedication.
Carina asks for the loan to buy more and better merchandise to sell in order to increase her capital by improving her sales. She will thus be able to implement her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more and better bed sheets and pillows to sell.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Juvy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is 26 years old and lives in Southern Ghour. She is studying biology. She comes from a very simple family and their income level is very low. She had to postpone many semesters in the university due to her Inability to pay tuition. 

After waiting for a solution to the problem of the length of the postponement of study, she decided to apply for an education loan to help her cover her semester fees and complete her education.

loans.use: to help her cover her semester fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single man from Khanyounis city. He has an empty store next to his house. 

Ahmad would like to use this store and open a grocery shop. Ahmad thinks that the demand will be high and also his income.

He requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some grocery products and a refrigerator for his new grocery store.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products and a refrigerator for his new grocery store.

loans.name: Dhalia

texts.en:
Jeep-for-rent is the main business of Dhalia, 48, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. Whenever needed, her neighbors, friends and relatives hire her jeep and the services of her husband, Sim, as driver. The fee depends on the duration (per hour or per day) and the destination. Her income usually sustains her family’s daily expenditures and her children’s educational needs. But sometimes there are delayed payments by customers and this affects her everyday consumption. 

She understands that her customers have no bad intention in delaying their payments because there are times when money is really very elusive. Still she needs to keep her business running. One way to do it is to avail herself of additional capital worth PHP 18,000 that will be used for her jeep’s maintenance. She will buy spare parts, diesel and oil to make her jeep ready to be rented out at any time. She plans to expand her network to gain more customers. If God permits, she will buy additional jeeps for rent and employ some drivers someday. 

She remains faithful in her attendance at the regular meeting of her co-fellowship members at CCT where she gains patience and strength through sharing of life experiences and studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for her jeep's maintenance, buy spare parts, diesel and oil.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
A 61-year-old widow, Melinda, is a strong woman considering the trials that she has experienced in her life. She’s a survivor of Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013 together with her children. 

Melinda runs a “sari-sari” (variety) store in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental and she continues to work hard in order to maintain and improve it. However, the income derived from her store varies from time to time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. It’s a blessing that she has an alternative source of income which is “trisikad” for rent. A trisikad is a three-wheeled vehicle just like the tricycle, but it doesn’t use gasoline or diesel to run. Just the power of “sikad” or kick makes it run. Simply put, it’s a bicycle with attached compartment or section for passengers. At her age, Melinda can still help those low-educated but hardworking men in her community by hiring them as trisikad driver.

This time Melinda is the one who needs help from you. She plans to buy more stocks of grocery items and dry goods for her variety store. She will also pay for her trisikad maintenance to keep it in good condition. PHP 22,000 of supplementary capital will surely help a lot, as it will boost her income and savings. 

Melinda dreams that all her children will be successful and have a better life in the future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items and dry goods for her variety store.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Juvy is 48 years old and has one child who is in school.

Juvy has a food vending business in the Philippines. Juvy requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Juvy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay his university fees.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 20-year-old single lady, living with her family in Salt. She is in the second year of her bachelor's degree and is majoring in law.

Farah`s father is retired from the army, but his pension is not enough to meet all of the education fees of his children. Because of that she requested an education loan to cover her semester fees. This will help her graduate faster and find a job.

She hopes to find a job immediately after she graduates to help her family with their household expenses.

loans.use: To pay her university fees.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad, age 40, is a mother of six children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Irshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Irshad is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Ahed

texts.en:
Ahed is 22 years old and is studying for a degree in physical education. She lives in Irbid, and she is working really hard to get ahead and to grow.

Ahed dreams of having a good job so that she could help to pay for her daily expenses and help her family with household expenses. 

She requested a loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her education and graduate. Then she will try to find a good job to do what she wants and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To cover her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: La Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la ciudad de Itá con mujeres muy activas y luchadoras que se pusieron como meta crecer cada una en los emprendimientos que hacen, también están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una busca superar su situación de pobreza extrema.
Isabel es una de las que integra este grupo, vende prendas de todo tipo, y comenta que aunque es muy difícil su trabajo ella se esfuerza para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida sin privaciones ni necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, como jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, tanto para dama como para caballeros. Están todas contentas por la oportunidad que reciben de poder ir mejorando en sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Itá by very active, feisty women. Their goal was to make make each woman grow and succeed with their businesses. They work within the Poverty Elimination Programme, where every woman looks to overcome her situation of extreme poverty.

Isabel is a member of this group. She sells all kinds of clothing, and she says that, although her work is very difficult, she makes every effort to be able to give her loved ones a decent living free from deprivation.

Isabel is asking for this loan to be able to buy various kinds of clothes to sell, such as jeans, shirts and trousers, both for men and women. All the women in the group are happy about the opportunity they have to be able to continue improving their businesses.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, trousers and other items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 31-year-old single lady who lives with her family in a sector in Jordan called Ramtha.

Rawan belongs to a family that consists of six members and her father is sole breadwinner for them. 

She could not complete her study because of her family's financial problems, but later she realized that a degree is the only weapon in life.

Rawan will begin her education at the university. She aspires to continue her education and access a field of work that will be suitable for her. She asked for an education loan to pay for her tuition fees, and she will use this loan to pay for study materials and assessments as required by her profession.

loans.use: To cover her semester fees.

loans.name: Rafaa

texts.en:
Rafaa is a young lady of 20 years of age. She is single and lives in Ajloun. Rafaa is currently studying in university, majoring in accounting. She said that her biggest inspiration to move forward is her parents; she wants to support them financially in order to improve their quality of life.

She applied for an education loan to cover her semester fees and graduate as soon as possible to find a good job with a good salary to improve her life and her income.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 33 years old and a resident of Mutukula in the Rakai district. She is married and has three children who all attend school. She also takes care of her sister.
 
Monica deals in the business of retail shop, which she started in 2013. Her customers are people from different areas of the town and her neighbors.  
However, her challenges are lack of enough capital to expand the business and competition. 

She also is an instructor in a technical institute where she earns a salary. She works seven days of the week and 12 hours per day and started her business with the aim of supplementing her daily income.

Monica wants a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy materials such as cement and sand for construction of her residential house. Finishing the house will free her of the rent burden.

She will use her income from the shop and her salary to repay the loan. 

Monica is a hard working lady who wants to see her family prospering.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mwanzori

texts.en:
Mwanzori is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanzori operates a vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is widowed with five children. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her shop, and electricity bills. 

She operates a retail shop selling used clothes and has been in this business for five years. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She works six days a week. She also gets additional income from houses for rent. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She is aspiring to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Senghung's Group

texts.en:
Senghung is a widowed woman living in the Keo Seima district of Mondulkiri province. She has five children, four of whom are dependent on her; only one among them is in school. 

This 45-year-old farmer is a breadwinner. She struggles for a living via growing cassava as the main source of income. Senghung sometimes works as a paid worker in order to supplement her family’s income. These days, pests threaten her 10-year-old business, so she cannot earn as good of an income as before. 

Now she leads a group of three members to get a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. This will be Senghung’s second time with VisionFund, and she has paid back the first loan completely. As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and herbicide to grow her crop well and receive more output. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living conditions much better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and herbicide to grow her crop well and receive more output

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 42 years old and lives in Baqaa. She is a mother of five children.
 
Amal is a conservative woman and asked her son Yazan to take her place in the photo. 

She had been facing difficulties in her life: Her husband is working with a low income, she is working hard to live, she is doing anything to help her husband, and she never complains.

Now her son Yazan became 20 years old and he is studying accounting. She wants to see him graduate and find good work; perhaps he will remove some of the responsibility that she carried all the years, and help his father with the household expenses. 

Amal applied for an educational loan to pay the university fees for Yazan because she could not cover his fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees

loans.name: Mahmmoud

texts.en:
Mahmmoud is single and lives with his parents. He is a smart man. 

Mahmmoud is a third-year student majoring in mathematics. He reads a lot of books and usually goes to the library. His parents are proud of him because he is a clever and hardworking man. His aim is to be a high quality specialist and to work in the same field to get experience. Perhaps he will be a scientist someday.

Mahmmoud now needs your financial support because his parents do not have money to pay for his fees. Therefore, he asked for a loan to pay his education fees.

loans.use: To pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Martha Amalia

texts.es:
Martha siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Desde muy joven, inició con la venta de comida pero con el tiempo decidió optar por un negocio menos cansado, por eso decidió – hace más de 10 años- iniciar una pulpería en su casa, además de vender gas butano para generar más ingresos. 
   
No obstante, solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, aceite, salsas de tomate, sopas instantáneas, papel higiénico, gaseosas, golosinas, carnes, verduras. Esto le hará aumentar sus ganancias porque podrá ofrecer variedad  de  productos a sus clientes. El siguiente paso, que planea Martha, es convertir su pulpería en distribuidora.
texts.en:
Martha has always been a hard-working and enterprising woman.  At a young age, she began selling food but in time decided to choose a less tiring business; for that reason, she decided--more than 10 years ago--to start a small store in her house, and also to sell butane to earn more income

She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, oil, tomato sauce, instant soups, toilet paper, soft drinks, snacks, meat and vegetables.  This will help her increase profits because she can offer a variety of products to her customers.  The next step Martha is planning is to convert her store into a distribution center.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, tomato sauce, instant soups, toilet paper, soft drinks, snacks, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Rice is a staple food in the Philippines, thus it is always in demand. It is therefore wise to include it in a “sari-sari” (variety) store inventory if a vendor has enough capital. 

Julieta, of Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, is trying her best to use her capital wisely, and she combines her variety store business with rice retailing. She also helps her husband, Rodel, in fish selling. They are doing their best to sustain their everyday needs and support their children, who are studying in college. It is their dream to complete their children’s education because just like many Filipinos, they consider education as the best inheritance to bestow on their children. 

Julieta’s business is not always smooth sailing, however. Stiff competition hampers her income and squeezes her family’s everyday sustenance. Therefore, she aims to improve her business further, and she appeals for PHP 15,000 in additional capital to buy more sacks of rice and grocery items for her variety store. She will also use part of the loan to pay for assorted fish to sell in the market. 

Your kind generosity will help her a lot in strengthening her business. In due time, she plans to invest in another enterprise when her current businesses are stable. 

She is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to y more sacks of rice and grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Living in an area frequently visited by typhoons is not easy, especially if the sea serves as source of family income. The city of Bacolod in Negros Occidental has a bordering sea on one side that provides lots of benefits to the people in the community. But in November, 2013, the area was devastated by Typhoon Haiyan, a super typhoon that was famous for its ruthless wrath. Ida, her husband Felix, and their four children were lucky to survive the harsh calamity. 

Ida is a fish vendor and her husband is a fisherman. They have worked at this livelihood for 25 years and they have experienced all sorts of circumstances that affect their business, both positively and negatively. But the couple remains strong. Somehow they already know the tendencies of the sea and they are capable of adjusting. 

This rainy season, Ida knows that there are times when fish will be scarce. But there are also favorable days when fish will be abundant and cheap. She plans to seize those favorable days to buy volumes of assorted fish. She needs PHP 30,000 additional capital that will keep her business running during rainy season. The income from this will continuously supply their everyday necessities and her children’s educational expenses. Two to three years from now, her children will graduate from college and she will be relieved of huge expenses.  

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion, which she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish in volume.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Love for her only child is the driving force in Anita’s perseverance. Her daughter has special needs, and she gives her special attention and care. She still wants to bestow her a normal life despite the challenges. Thank God that her husband, Oscar, is very supportive of her and their daughter. 

Oscar is a prosthetic maker who tries his best to provide for their everyday needs. But his income depends on orders that are very irregular. Anita needs to supplement her husband’s income, so she decided to operate a variety store five years ago. Until now, it has had limited supplies because part of her capital goes to prosthetic materials needed by her husband. 

This time, she wants to improve her store, and she is requesting PHP 15,000 for additional capital. She will buy stock of dry goods and beverages to generate higher profit. She will use part of the loan to pay for prosthetic equipment. Later on, she plans to buy a sewing machine so as to maximize her talent in tailoring. 

Anita and her family reside in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, where CCT Credit Cooperative operates. She is a compliant member of the cooperative, and she meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock of dry goods and beverages for her variety store

loans.name: Johana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Todos los jóvenes estudian fuerte para obtener su licenciatura, sin embargo, al llegar al final, se encuentran con un obstáculo para terminar con esa meta y es el pago del título. Desafortunadamente, muchas personas deciden no obtener el título debido a sus altos precios. Johana, es una joven de 21 años de edad, que acaba de egresa de la carrera de Derecho, licenciatura que seleccionó debido a que le gusta defenderos legalmente a las personas y hacer valer sus derechos como ser humano, a pesar que toda la generación de su familia ha sido enfermera, ella decidió perseguir ese sueño y cumplirlo.
Johana es una de esas jóvenes que acaba de egresar, pero los altos costos de sacar su título la han detenido. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para pagar su título y así poder cumplir con el sueño de convertirse en Licenciada en Derecho y ayudar a las demás personas. Afortunadamente, cuenta con el apoyo de su padre que es docente y de su madre que es enfermera, lo que ha servido para salir adelante con sus metas. En sus próximos planes está realizar un posgrado en Derecho Penal.
texts.en:
All young people study hard to get their degree, nevertheless, at the end of their studies, they meet with an obstacle to completing this goal,and that is having to pay fees for the award of the degree.  Unfortunately, many people decide not to get a degree due to that high cost.  Johana is a 21 year old woman who has just completed a law degree, a field of work she chose because she wants to defend people legally and make her values as a person count.  Although all her contemporaries in the family have become nurses, she decided to follow and fulfill this dream. 

  Johana is one of these young people who have  just graduated, but the high costs of obtaining the degree have stopped her.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan to pay the costs of getting her degree award, thus fulfilling her dream of becoming a lawyer and helping other people.  Luckily, she relies on the help of her father, a teacher and her mother, a nurse, which has helped her advance her goals.   Her next career goal is to get a postgraduate degree in criminal law.

loans.use: to pay the fee for award of her degree

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
This is Prescila, and she would like to borrow a loan that will definitely help improve her business. 

Prescila, 37, is a resident of Novaliches, Quezon City. She is married to Gerry, who is one year younger than her. Today, they are already blessed with three kids who are all currently studying. It was a tough responsibility indeed to be parents, but the couple is really working hard to pursue their children's education. 

In fact, of 27 years in her enterprise, Prescila is always making sure that her business (sari-sari store) is always in good condition, ensuring that it is a reliable source of income. As a scheme, she would like to borrow a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using this to fill her store with an additional variety of products to sell. This will become a good opportunity for her to further establish her business since she offers commodities, which are always in good demand from the people. 

She wants to address that your help will never be wasted once you entrusted her this chance. Instead, she will be using every open door to work hard and slowly reach her dream of having a mini grocery someday. By this, she can save money — enough to send her children to college and enable them to finish their studies. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to fill her store with an additional variety of products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Okichi

texts.es:
El amor  por ayudar a los demás, fue la principal inspiración para que Rosa fundará la organización no gubernamental (ONG), “La Esperanza”, que tiene como misión ayudar a niños con deficiencia para caminar. Esto es porque su hijo menor también sufre esa enfermedad y al ver todas las limitantes a la cual se enfrentaba, decidió liquidar su pulpería y con ayuda de donaciones por parte de Invercasa y MiCrédito, pudo establecerse como ONG. 

Ella es socióloga y con ayuda de su hija ha logrado sacar a delante su ONG. Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para comprar uniformes e instalar una farmacia dentro de la locación, que le permita entregar las medicinas que le dan los patrocinadores, ya que es un servicio gratuito. Rosa, planea atraer fondeadores que estén interesados en ayudar su causa.
texts.en:
Her love for others, this was the main inspiration behind Rosa founding the nongovernmental organization "La Esperanza" (The Hope), whose mission is to help children with walking deficiencies. This mission is also due to the fact that her youngest son suffers from this health issue and seeing all the limitations that he encountered, she decided to liquidate her small shop and with the help of donations from Invercasa and MiCredito, she was able to establish the NGO. 

She is a sociologist and with her daughters help has been able to make her NGO successful. However, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase uniforms and install a pharmacy within the premises, which will allow her to distribute the medicines she receives from sponsors, as this is a free service. Rosa plans to attract donors who are interested in helping her cause.

loans.use: purchase uniforms and install a pharmacy within the premises.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Who you can see in the picture is Zenaida. She is already 55 years old now, but she's still working like a young one. In fact, as a way of living, she continues to sell various personal products. As a mere fact, she has been into this for almost nine years now. 

Life for her is, yes, tough. But it's a thing to endure. No wonder why Zenaida behaves like this. Ever since, she wanted to improve her business. And today, she finds Kiva. 

She would like you to know that she wants to borrow a loan worth PHP 10,000. She will utilize this to purchase an additional quantity of personal products like perfumes, cosmetics, toiletries and other products. If you allow her request, she would surely be more than grateful. 

As of now, the only thing that she is praying for is to have a peaceful life ahead for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional quantities of personal products like perfumes, cosmetics, toiletries and other products.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 43 years old. She is a married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchasing and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 23-year-old single man from Irbid city. He tried to find work while he was studying, but could not find a suitable job. He is a student and studies psychological counselling. He wants to complete his studies and find a good job.

His father is retired from work and his pension is not enough to cover all the family`s needs.Therefore, Odai applied for an education loan. This loan will help him pay the university instalments for this semester and some of his needed books.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Here is Gina. She didn't complete her studies. She only attained an elementary education, and though she wants to continue this, her age seems not to fit anymore. It was a hard one, most especially when she sees herself being so incapable just because she did not finish her studies. Finding a high paying job was like entering a thread into a needle for her.

However, this is not what's going to bring down Gina. Though she is already 30 years old now, she's finding a way that can truly support her family still. She is living at Novaliches, Quezon City and is married to Juanito. They have four kids by now. To support her children, she busies herself in managing a small sari-sari store (a variety store in common), where she gains, though, a not-so-high profit, but certainly enough to surpass a living. 

Gina wants you to know that she wants to expand her business, but she doesn't have enough capital. She wants to provide stock of grocery items for her store in large quantities; that's why she would like to ask for a PHP 20,000 loan from you. Hoping a lot that you'd consider it, Gina plans to earn savings from the profit she will gain from the expansion. 

Your help can now be a milestone for her. She hopes that you'll support her, and she promises to boost every potential that her business has. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to provide stock of grocery items for her store in large quantities

loans.name: Mireya De Jesús

texts.es:
Mireya siempre  soñaba con tener su propio negocio, porque sabía que esto le ofrecía mejores oportunidades de vida para ella y su familia. Por ello, cuando tuvo la oportunidad de vender ropa  no  lo dudó ni un segundo. Hace más de 6 años de eso y hoy se siente bendecida porque ha logrado convertirlo en un negocio próspero y rentable, pues también aprovecha para vender artículos cosméticos y ropa usada. 

Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para comprar camisas, pantalones, shorts, camisolas, blusas, maquillaje, cremas. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer variedad de productos y aprovechará las nuevas tendencias de ropa. Con las ganancias,  Mireya planea ahorrar para comprar una vivienda.
texts.en:
Mireya always dreamed of having her own business because she knew that it would offer her the best opportunities for her and her family. 

So when the opportunity came up for Mireya to sell clothing, she grabbed it with both hands. It's now been six years since she started her business and nowadays Mireya feels blessed as the business is profitable and prospering. As well as new clothes Mireya now sells cosmetics and used clothing. 

Mireya is seeking a loan to buy shirts, pants, shorts, tops, blouses, make-up and creams. This would be a great help so that Mireya can offer a variety of products and the latest trends in clothing. Mireya plans to use her earnings to buy a new home.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shorts, tops, blouses, make-up and creams.
