loans.name: Frine De Guadalupe

texts.es: Frine de Guadalupe tiene 41 años, es  casada, tiene dos hijas y vive en Cuautla, tiene una maestría en administración de negocios. Es una mujer  que se adapta a cualquier circunstancia, adquiere conocimientos fácilmente y le gusta emprender. Por esa razón, Frine inició un negocio el año pasado de venta de bolsas y carteras para dama y caballero, su dificultad más grande ha sido reunir dinero suficiente para invertir en los productos, por eso ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 10,000 para poder comprar un volumen grande de productos y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes, gracias a este préstamo ella hará crecer su negocio. Su mayor sueño en la vida es viajar por todo el mundo para conocer nuevas culturas, ella estará muy feliz de poder hacer crecer su negocio, agradece a todas las personas que creen en ella y la ayudan para cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Frine de Guadalupe is 41 years old, married, has two daughters and lives in Cuautla.  She has a master's degree in business administration.  Frine is a woman who adapts to circumstances, acquires knowledge quickly and wants to  be enterprising. 

 For that reason, Frine began a business last year selling purses and wallets for men and women.  Her biggest problem has been to get together enough money to invest in products.  Because of that, she is asking for a loan of $650 to be able to buy a large volume of products and have more variety to offer to her customers.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to make her business grow.  Her great dream in life is to travel throughout the world to become acquainted with new cultures.  Frine will be very happy to make her business grow, and thanks those who believe in her and help her fulfill this dream.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of products and have more variety

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 39 years old and a married woman. She has been doing a business of selling fruits for many years with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Both work together to earn a reasonable amount of money to support their family. 

Sughran is a loving mother of two children. She is responsible for their food, health and clothing, and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business.

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demand consistently, which will ultimately enable her to timely cover her utility bills.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demand consistently, which will ultimately enable her to timely cover her utility bills

loans.name: Farakh

texts.en:
Farakh is 48 years old and married.

She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough money through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation. She applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mukhamedkhoja

texts.ru: Мухамедхоча добрый, веселый и нужный человек. Ему 38 лет. Она работает IT специалистом. Мухамедхоча верный муж и счастливый отец четверых детей. Мухамедхоча заботится о своих детях и об их будущем. Он просит кредит, чтобы оплатить учебу дочери. Его дочь учится на отлично, и он, как заботливый отец не позволит, чтобы она прекратила учиться из-за финансового положения семьи. Мухамедхоча принял решения и обратился за кредитом. Он верит, что его поддержат и он обеспечит своей дочери хорошее будущее.
texts.en: Mukhamedkhoja is a kind, happy and honest person.  He is 38 and works as an IT specialist.  He is also a faithful husband and the happy father of four children.  He cares for his children and their future.  He is taking a loan in order to pay for his daughter's tuition.  His daughter is an excellent student and, as a caring father, Mukhamedkhoja doesn't want her to quit her studies because of the family's financial situation.  He has therefore decided to apply for a loan.  He is confident that he will receive some support and that he will be able to provide a bright future to his daughter.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Tuychiboy

texts.ru: Туйчибой житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 28 лет, женат и отец одного ребёнка. Туйчибой скромный и трудолюбивый человек. Он занимается животноводством и одновременно ремонтирует жилые дома. Туйчибою очень нравится его деятельность. Благодаря своей упорной работе его семья живет хорошо. Туйчибой всегда заботится о своих родственниках. Он имеет хороший опыт в животноводстве. Туйчибой хорошо присматривает за скотом. Так как сейчас сезон работы, ему необходимо увеличить поголовье скота и расширить доход. У него есть собственный капитал, но ему необходимо еще средства. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом, надеясь, что ему помогут.
texts.en:
Tuychiboy lives in the J. Rumi region. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. Tuychiboy is a modest and hard-working person. He raises livestock and also does home renovations. Tuychiboy enjoys his work. Thanks to his hard work, his family has a good quality of life. Tuychiboy always takes care of his relatives.

Tuychiboy is experienced in raising livestock and does this work well. Now is the season to expand  his livestock and increase his revenues. The working capital he already has is insufficient. This is why he has applied for a loan and is hoping to get assistance.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of livestock.

loans.name: Luis Millan

texts.es: Luis tiene 46 años de edad es casado tiene 2 hijos y vive en Vincoa Guaranda provincia de Bolivar el se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos y un cerdo para engordarlos y luego venderlos para asi obtener un nuevo ingreso para el bienestrar de su familia, el desafio al que se enfrenta es la falta de oprtunidades en el trabajo y en su tiempo libre le gusta  pasar momentos agradables con su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 46 years old and married with two children. He lives in Vincoa Guaranda, Bolivar province. 

Luis makes a living as a farmer and in particular with corn crops. He is seeking this loan to buy chickens and pigs, to be able to raise and fatten them to then sell them for a profit. This will give Luis a new income to use for the well-being of his family. Luis in this way will overcome the challenge of a lack of work opportunities. 

In his free time, Luis loves to spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Shahinaz

texts.en:
Shahinaz does not work and her husband works for a low income at a private company. She is blessed with three children.

Because of the high costs of living, Shahinaz and her husband are facing financial problems. Shahinaz wants to borrow an education loan so she can send her daughter to college. This loan will pay for her daughter`s tuition fees. Her daughter is studying for a bachelor of law degree. She chose this major because she dreams of becoming a successful lawyer and making a difference in her community.

Shahinaz needs your help to see her daughter graduate one day.

loans.use: to pay her daughter`s university fees.

loans.name: Lupita

texts.es:
Con un capital de tan solo mil córdobas, Lupita inició su negocio de  venta de  ropa usada. Al comienzo, no le fue fácil porque  tuvo que vender ambulante para ganarse a los clientes, sin embargo, con esfuerzo y perseverancia, rápidamente pudo establecerse en un pequeño local.  Sin embargo, le gustaría trasladarse a una zona de comercio más activa para poder generar más ingresos.

Por ello, solicita un crédito para  comprar blusas, jeans, shorts, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, pijamas. Esto le ayudará porque podrá incrementar sus ingresos al ofrecer variedad de prendas.  De esta forma, ahorrará para trasladar su local a otra zona. También, planea  expandir su negocio y vender artículos plásticos.
texts.en:
With capital of only 1000 Nicaraguan Córdobas, Lupita started her business selling used clothing. At the start, it wasn't easy for her because she had to sell door-to-door to win clients. Nevertheless, with effort and perseverance she was able to get herself a small shop, however she would like to move to a more active commercial area to be able to generate more income.

Because of this, she is asking for a loan to buy blouses, jeans, shorts, trousers, shirts, t-shirts, pyjamas etc. This will help her as she will be able to increase her income by offering a variety of garments. This way, she can save up to move her shop to a different area. Also, she plans to expand her business and sell plastic items.

loans.use: to buy blouses, jeans, shorts, trousers, shirts, t-shirts, pyjamas etc.

loans.name: Arlet Lucia

texts.es:
Arlet es una joven que desde pequeña, todos la conocían por preocuparse por los demás. Por esta razón, para esta joven de veinte años de edad no fue difícil tomar la decisión de estudiar enfermería al igual que su madre, quienes desde siempre han ayudado a la comunidad. Ahora está en cuarto año de la carrera y se siente muy motivada por estar cumpliendo esa meta, para luego estudiar medicina.
Arlet es conocida en su universidad por ser una de las mejores alumnas, por lo que siente que debe seguir invirtiendo en sus herramientas para mejorar aún más sus estudios. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y un data show que le servirán para facilitar sus tareas universitarias y compartirla con su madre, quien también necesita dichas herramientas para desempeñarse laboralmente. En un futuro, Arlet se mira graduada de enfermería y trabajando como doctora.
texts.en:
Arlet is a young woman who, ever since she was little, has been known by everyone as someone who is concerned about other people. For this reason, it was not difficult for this young 20-year-old to take the decision to study nursing, the same as her mother, since they have always helped the community. Now she is in the fourth year of her course and she feels very motivated by the fact that she is achieving this goal so she can then study medicine.

Arlet is known at her university for being one of the best students and because of this she feels that she must continue investing in her tools so she can improve even further in her studies. This is the reason why she is asking for a loan to buy a computer and a data show projector which will be useful for making her university assignments easier. She will also share the equipment with her mother, who also needs these tools to carry out her work.

In the future, Arlet sees herself graduated as a nurse and working as a doctor.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a data show projector.

loans.name: Silvia Aurora

texts.es: Silvia tiene 20 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura y a la producción de queso, solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca para producir más y obtener mayores ingresos, vive en Vinchoa provincia de Bolivar, el desafio al que se enfrenta es la falta de trabajo fijo , en su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Silvia is 20 years old and makes a living as a farmer and cheese producer. She is seeking this loan to buy a cow to be able to increase production and increase her earnings. 

Silvia lives in Vinchoa, Bolivar. With her work as a farmer she has been able to overcome the challenge of a lack of fixed work. In her free time Silvia enjoys watching TV.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Alba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES DEL ALBA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Iran es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne de res, venta de ropa, costura y venta de ropa, venta de CDs, venta de helados, venta de papa, venta de comida, venta de frutas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Iran es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió, hace varios años, cuando se fue al exterior a trabajar como costurera.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra  telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz para posteriormente, a la elaboración, comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que brinda la institución.
En la fotografía solo aparecen nueve integrantes ya que el señor Guillermo, después del desembolso, tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Women of Alba" group will start it's second cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of Centro Focal Panamericana.  This group is made up of 10 members and is led by a board of directors where Iran is the secretary.  The members of this communal association are in charge of various types of businesses.  Among them are beef sales, clothing sales, tailoring and clothing sales, CD sales, ice cream sales, potato sales, food sales, fruit sales, and vegetables sales businesses.  

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises of which Iran is a member.  She mentions that she joined Pro Mujer by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a tailoring business and sells clothing.  She learned this business several years ago when she went out to work as a tailor.  

The loan that she will take out is to increase capital.  She will buy fabric from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz to later make into clothing sell them from her sales stand.  This kind of job allows her to generate the necessary resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has a son.

When asked if she likes Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training that the institution provides.  

There are only 9 members present in the photo, since Guillermo had to go to his sales stand after payment.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale

loans.name: Sana

texts.en: Sana is a 19-year-old married lady from a village near Nablus, Palestine. Her husband works as an employee in the municipality where he gets a very small wage. Sana and her husband also have a grocery store in the village where they sell basic products. It is a good business and provides the family with a good income. Sana would like to improve the store, so she took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her to add more grocery products to sell. Sana appears in the photo.

loans.use: to add more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN MADRE SOLTERA DE  PEQUEÑA SU MADRE FALLECIÓ Y SU PAPA LA DEJO AL CUIDADO DE SU ABUELA PARA SEGUIR TRABAJANDO Y MANTENER A ELLA Y SUS HERMANOS, DESAFORTUNADAMENTE NO RECIBIÓ CUIDADOS EN SU DENTADURA, POR LO QUE AHORA OCUPA UN TRATAMIENTO DE ORTODONCIA YA QUE SU IMAGEN NO LE AGRADA. ELLA TRABAJA COMO INTENDENTE EN UNA ESCUELA Y SUS INGRESOS NO LE ALCANZAN PARA EL TRATAMIENTO, ELLA ES EL ÚNICO SOSTÉN DE SU HIJA DEBIDO A QUE SU PAREJA NO SE HIZO RESPONSABLE.
texts.en:
She is a young single mother.  Her mother died when she was little, and her father left her in her grandmother’s care in order to continue working and supporting her and her siblings.

Unfortunately, she did not receive dental care.  Therefore, she is concerned about orthodontic treatment because she does not like her appearance.

She works as the head of maintenance at a school, and she does not earn enough for the treatment.  She is her daughter’s only support because her daughter’s father did not take responsibility.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Aziz Unnisa

texts.en: Aziz Unnisa is 44 years old, married, and a mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN SEÑOR TRABAJADOR QUE SUFRE DE UN PROBLEMA PERIODENTAL GRAVE DEBIDO A QUE NO TUVO CUIDADO CON SU SALUD DENTAL. SUS ENCÍAS SE ENCUENTRAN DEMASIADO INFLAMADAS A PUNTO DE DAÑARSE EL TEJIDO BLANDO Y HUESO QUE SOSTIENEN SUS DIENTES POR LO QUE PUEDE PERDER VARIAS PIEZAS DENTALES. LE URGE UN TRATAMIENTO, LAMENTABLEMENTE SUS INGRESOS NO SON MUCHOS Y ES EL ÚNICO SOSTÉN EN SU CASA.
texts.en:
He is a hardworking man who suffers from a severe periodontal problem because he did not have dental care.  His gums are inflamed to the point of injuring the soft tissue and bone that holds the teeth.  Because of that he may lose several teeth.  

It is urgent that he receive treatment.  Unfortunately, he does not earn much, and he is the only one who supports his household.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en: Kausar is a 45-year-old widow who has an embroidery business. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to pay the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy spools of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones. These supplies will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 32-year-old married woman. She and her husband run a business selling milk. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Shahida’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Shahida has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, which will provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, which will provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Lobar

texts.ru: Эту милую и жизнерадостную женщину с необычным именем зовут Лобар. Ей 39 лет. Она работает в микро финансовой организации. Лобар очень умная и мудрая женщина имеющая добиться своей цели. Лобар мать троих детей. Не смотря на свой тяжелый график работы, Лобар старается уделить больше внимание детям и их учебе. Лобар хочет, чтобы его дети были образованными и добились больших высот в жизни. Дочка Лобара учится и учится она на отлично. Лобар гордится своей дочерью и всячески ей помогает. Сейчас финансовое положение семьи не позволяют Лобар оплатить очередной год обучения дочки, и Лобар обратилась за кредитом, чтобы ее ребенок не была вынуждена бросить учебу.
texts.en: This lovely, cheerful woman has the unusual name of Lobar. She is 39 and works at a microfinance institution. Lobar is a smart, wise woman who can achieve her goals. She is a mother of three. In spite of her busy work schedule, Lobar tries to pay more attention to her children and their studies. She wants her children to be educated and to achieve great things in life. Her daughter studies and gets good grades and Lobar is proud of her and tries to help her in every way. Right now the family's financial situation prevents Lobar from paying for her daughter's tuition. She is requesting a loan so that her child will not be forced to give up her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Ella es una mujer de treinta y cuatro años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos, se dedica a vender productos de belleza lo que le permite poder ayudar a su esposo.
Utiliza anteojos desde hace mas de diez años debido a que padece miopía, lo que le ha resultado muy costoso ya que por lo menos dos veces al año tiene que cambiarlos por una nueva graduación. 
Ella es candidata a un tratamiento de cirugía ocular con láser y desearía someterse a esta cirugía, lamentablemente no cuenta con los recursos, debido a que los ingresos de ella y su esposo les alcanza solo para lo indispensable en una familia.
texts.en:
She is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  She sells beauty products, which allows her to be able to help her husband.

She has worn glasses for over ten years because she has myopia.  This has been very expensive for her because she has to change them for a new prescription at least two times a year.

She is a candidate for laser surgery treatment.  She would like to have the surgery.  Unfortunately, she does not have the resources because what she and her husband earn is only enough for indispensable family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has one child who goes to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has operated a restaurant at the market for some years, working seven days a week.

Jesca has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy beef, bunches of green bananas, cooking oil, and beans.

Jesca's challenges include seasonality of food. She would like to start providing outside catering services in her community. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy beef, bunches of green bananas, cooking oil, and beans.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is a 32-year-old married woman. She is the mother of one child. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. Kubra fully supports and assists her husband with his work.

Now, Kubra has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 50-year-old widowed woman. She is involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells it in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Nazeeran has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is 21 years old and lives in Ajloun. She is studying psychological science. She is a very ambitious and patient woman. 

Faten is working hard to graduate to find good work with a good salary to help her family with the household expenses and her siblings with their education. She is back to a very simple family, and their income level is very low. Faten had to apply for an educational loan to help her cover her university fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees

loans.name: Roció

texts.es: Roció tiene 42 años es casada y  tiene 4 hijos pequeños, es una mujer que ama lo que hace, está orgullosa de superarse día a día y es una apasionada por la  decoración y el diseño de interiores. Por esta razón inició un negocio hace 3 años de venta de artículos de decoración, ella atiende al cliente y lo aconseja según su gusto y su hogar, ella pretende ampliarse a un local o abrir más sucursales, por ahora su mayor dificultad es el espacio, porque ella tiene su negocio en casa y ocupa su sala para guardar los productos, ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 10,000 para poder comprar anaqueles y optimizar el espacio en su sala, también quiere comprar nuevos productos que implican un costo más alto. A Roció le gustaría aprender más sobre decoración y diseño de interiores, su mayor sueño es convertirse en una gran decoradora, ella agradece mucho a las personas que se convertirán en participes de su sueño.
texts.en:
Roció is 42 years old and married with 4 small children.  She is a women who loves what she does, and she is proud to improve every day. She is passionate about decoration and interior design,so she started a business selling decorations 3 years ago.  She looks after clients and gives them advice based on their taste and their homes.  She has plans to expand to a new location or open more branches.  For the time being, her biggest difficulty is space, because she runs her business out of her home and keeps her products in her living room.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 MXN to buy shelving and optimize the space in her living room.  She also wants to buy new products that will involve larger costs.  Roció would like to learn more about decorating and interior design.  Her biggest dream is to become a great designer.  She is grateful to the people who will participate in her dream.

loans.use: to buy shelving and optimize space, and purchase new products that involve significant costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy PVC pipes, sand, and cement, among other materials.

loans.name: Bashira

texts.en:
Bashira is a 51-year-old, married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad lives in Irbid. He's studying geography and would like to complete his degree and find a good job where he can apply all the knowledge he learned in the university.

Mohammad is a very hard worker, and he is doing all he can to become a successful professional man and be useful to society.

His father faced financial problems, so he could not help Mohammad in his tuition fees; therefore, he applied for an education loan to pay the fees of his degree and continue studying.

loans.use: To pay for his university fees

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en:
Etaf is 57 years old and lives in Baqaa. She has three children. She has a dream, which is to see her children be successful and special. She is a conservative woman and asked her son Murad to take her place in the photo.

Her son Murad is majoring in accounting and is in his third year. He chose this major because he believes that he will find a good work in a short time. He is working hard to complete his education and find a good job with a good salary. 

Lately, Etaf has faced financial problems, so she has not been able pay for her son's education fees. Therefore, she applied for an education loan to help her son Murad pay for his university fees.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university fees

loans.name: Shafiqan

texts.en:
Shafiqan deals in business selling animals such as baby goats and calves. Shafiqan’s job is to look after the cattle and sell them in the local market. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. Sometimes she also sells animals' milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

However, Shafiqan needs to earn more income for her everyday expenditures. Therefore, Shafiqan has requested 40,000 PKR to buy more cattle. This will enable her to cater to more customers, and thus provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to cater to more customers, thereby providing a better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a 20-year-old single lady from a village near the city of Hebron. She lives with her family in a simple house. Her father is a taxi driver, from which he earns a low and unstable income. The family also has a barn for raising sheep. All of them cooperate together in the work.

Haya took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for the barn. This will increase the barn productivity and also the family income.

Haya appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for the barn.

loans.name: Suma Jakaña Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA JAKAÑA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de verduras, servicio de transporte, venta de pan, tienda de barrio.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta mantas de vicuña; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace más de veinte años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Suma Jakaña will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the Panamericana regional center. It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors. Alicia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank are engaged in are varied and include selling clothing, selling vegetables, transport services, bread sales, and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Alicia is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a massive institution promotion.

Currently she has a business selling vicuña blankets and says that she learned this business from her mother more than twenty years ago. 

The loan that she will not take out is to increase capital (to buy wool at wholesale) that she will buy from wholesalers in El Alto and then, after production, will sell from her stall. This way of working allows her to earn income to support her family financially as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responds that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with three children and she owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Sofia has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, Sofia wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.es:
Hace diez años, Alba decidió hacer un cambio por su hija de un año de edad, pues sentía la responsabilidad de salir adelante con su familia, fue entonces cuando comenzó a hacer y vender bisutería. Hasta que años después tuvo a su hijo y poco después perdió a su esposo en un accidente de tránsito, lo que la hizo tener un declive que pronto la volvería más fuerte para luchar por ella y por sus dos hijos. Ahora esta mujer de 36 años de edad tiene una tienda completa, donde vende ropa, carteras, prendas. Además posee una pulpería y alquila una casa. 
Todas las tardes, su hija mayor de once años de edad, sale del colegio para ayudarle en la tienda a su madre, lo que hace que Alba se sienta muy agradecida con la vida. Tras ver cómo va mejorando su vida y la de sus hijos, no duda ni un segundo en seguir invirtiendo en su hogar. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para construir su baño, comprar lava manos, inodoro, ducha y azulejos para mejorar la calidad de vida e higiene de su familia. Su sueño es mandar a sus hijos a la universidad.
texts.en:
Ten years ago, Alba decided to make a change for her one-year-old daughter. She felt the responsibility to get her family ahead, and so she began to make and sell costume jewelry.  

Years later she had her son, and soon after, she lost her husband in a transit accident. This put her into a decline, but soon she turned it around with even more strength than before, fighting for herself and for her two children.

Now this 36-year-old woman has an entire store where she sells clothing, purses, and other garments. She also owns a small general store and rents out a house. Every afternoon her older daughter, who is now 11 years old, leaves school to help her mother in the store, which makes Alba very grateful for her life. 

After seeing how life keeps improving for herself and her children, Alba does not have a bit of doubt about continuing to invest in her home. For this reason she is requesting a loan to construct her bathroom. She will buy a sink, toilet, shower, and tiles, in order to improve her family’s hygiene and quality of life. Her dream is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a sink, toilet, shower, and tiles.

loans.name: Freddy Jose

texts.es:
El sonido de los cascos del caballo al pisar el suelo, decora las calles de una de las ciudades coloniales del país, uno de esos sonidos es el del caballo que tiene Freddy, el cual compró con el préstamo anterior para continuar con su servicio de acarreo comercial, que tiene desde hace 25 años. Con ese préstamo pudo superar el miedo de las prestaciones, además de ver el crecimiento laboral que tuvo. Por esta razón, agradece a todas las personas que le apoyaron en ese crédito, pues tuvo grandes resultados.   
Ahora, a sus 50 años de edad, ya mira su trabajo con gran fuerza, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar salvado, comida de caballo, y mejorar la calidad de su carretón para que dure más tiempo y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y de sus hijos, por lo que se siente muy motivado con esta nueva inversión.
texts.en:
The sound of horse hooves beating against the ground decorates the streets in one of the colonial cities of the country. One of these sounds is from Freddy’s horse, which he bought with the previous loan in order to continue his 25-year-old commercial carriage business.  With that loan he was able to overcome the fear of the costs, and see the growth of work that he had.  He is thankful to the people who supported him with that loan, as he had great results.

Now, at 50 years old, he looks at his work with great strength. He is requesting a new loan to buy grain and horse food, and to improve the quality of his cart to make it last longer and keep improving his quality of life. Fortunately he is able to depend on the support of his wife and children, which makes him feel very motivated with this new investment.

loans.use: to buy horse food and to improve the quality of his cart.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr: Hawa  est emboucheuse ovines, âgée de 37 ans, elle  habite au Mali, mariée et mère  de 7 enfants âgés de 2 à 16 ans dont 3 fréquentes. Elle est celle qui la main sur le mouton  sur photo, Son mari est cultivateur. Elle exerce ce métier il y a 5 ans de cela, elle s’approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux  marchés de sa localité. Elle  sollicite  au près du RMCR un prêt   accroitre ses activités ovines, le prêt servira à  subvenir aux charges familiale soins sanitaire, habillement et autres. Après les ventes elle peut réaliser un bénéfice de 20000FCFA. Son rêve d’être une grande emboucheuse dans la zone et utile pour la communauté.
texts.en:
Hawa, age 37, is married with seven children ages 2 to 16, three of whom go to school. She lives in Mali. 

Hawa fattens sheep, and her husband is a farmer. She is the member standing next to a sheep in the group photo. She has been practicing this activity for five years. She buys and sells her animals at local markets. 

Hawa is seeking a loan from RMCR to bolster her sheep fattening activity. This will help her to provide for her family’s needs in regards to healthcare, clothing, etc. Profits from the sale of her sheep can reach 20,000FCFA. 

Her goals are to become a leader in her sector, and to help her community.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en:
Baraa is 18 years old and is studying for a degree in archaeology. She lives in Mafraq with her family, and she is working really hard to get ahead and to grow.

Baraa dreams of having a good job so that she could help to pay for her daily expenses and help her family in their household expenses.

She requested this loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue her education and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, sand and cement to rebuild the channel that brings water to her home for daily use.

loans.name: Sinet's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Snoul District of Kratie Province, Sinet is 45 years old. She is married, and she has three children. She struggles for a living by growing cassava as her main source of income. This industrious woman also works for others for a fee in order to supplement the family’s income. She has been involved in her job for ten years already. This year her farm may not produce good outputs for her because it is threatened by pest and drought. 

Sinet, the leader of three-member group, decided to apply for a loan to buy pesticide and pay labor fees to increase her output and earn more income. This is the second cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and the first loan supported her work so well that she could better provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to increase the crop products and sell them at good prices in the market so that she can improve her living conditions even more.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and pay labor fees to increase her output and earn more income

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is very hardworking and lives in a rural area of Buhanda. He is married with four kids. He is a small-scale agriculturalist, practicing both crop and animal husbandry. He also deals in cattle fattening, which helps him raise money to take care of his family needs. He has requested a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to assist him in buying more cattle for trade. 

From his profits he hopes to educate his children to a higher level. He also has a side income, his milling machine. His challenge is drought, which affects them badly. He also hopes to be the leading farmer in the region. He is so appreciative of the financial boost and partnership, which will help improve his income and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cattle for trade

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan tiene 53 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa en casa propia. Juan es un pequeño comerciante que elabora artesanalmente manteles y colchas de tela con diferentes diseños, tamaños, estilos y en variedad de colores. La esposa de Juan hace todos los días tortillas en su casa de habitación las cuales vende a sus vecinos. Juan anteriormente solicito un crédito para construir un cuarto dormitorio y se encuentra muy agradecido y satisfecho por haber realizado su objetivo y debido a su grata experiencia Juan solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para continuar con las mejoras de su vivienda las cuales consiste en la construcción de una pequeña galera, que le sirva a la vez para proteger de la intemperie las telas que utiliza para realizar su labor, con el monto solicitado invertirá en la compra de: madera, lamina, arena y cemento.
texts.en:
Juan is 53 years old and lives with his wife in their own home. Juan is a trader who produces handmade cloth tablecloths and curtains in different designs, sizes, styles and in a variety of colours. 

Juan's wife makes tortillas in their home daily that she sells to their neighbours. Juan has previously sought a loan to build a bedroom, he is very thankful for this loan and was very satisfied to be able to realize his goal. Thanks to this positive experience, Juan is seeking a new loan from FUSAI in order to continue working on his home. He would now like to build a small gallery, that will serve both as a workshop and a place to safely store his work. 

Juan will use the loan to to buy wood, sheeting, sand and cement.

loans.use: to buy wood, sheeting, sand and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Rio Blanco Group

texts.es:
Las reliquias arqueológicas de las culturas Totonaca y Olmeca que han sido encontradas en la zona donde se ubica el grupo de préstamo son los antecedentes de las culturas cuyas raíces aún prevalecen. Las “Caritas Sonrientes” son algunas de las piezas más reconocidas de la historia de la ciudad. En este lugar se formó el grupo Río Blanco, actualmente el grupo esta integrado por 9 personas, cuyas actividades son:

Elizabeth e Iliana - Venta de Plata 
José, Leticia, Carlos - Venta de Materiales Para Construcción 
Beatriz M. - Venta de Cosméticos Y Bisutería
Ana - Venta de Abarrotes 
Beatriz A. - Venta de Ropa 
Maria - Venta de Comida Y Calzado

Don Carlos está casado con la señora Georgina y tienen dos hijos, el mayor de 5 años y el menor de 3. Don Carlos desempeña el oficio de taxista además de dedicarse a la venta de materiales para construcción, actividad que ha prevalecido en su familia durante muchas generaciones, sus padres y hermanos tienen la misma actividad por lo que todos invierten recursos en el negocio. La familia tiene 6 camiones de volteo que utilizan para transportar la grava, arena, arcilla o piedra de acuerdo con el pedido del cliente. Mientras don Carlos recorre las calles de la pequeña ciudad ofreciendo el servicio de taxista, su esposa se encarga de monitorear los viajes de los camiones. Con las ganancias de la actividad y el sueldo percibido como taxista, Carlos solventa los gastos familiares para ofrecer lo mejor a los suyos.
Cada uno de los préstamos otorgados le han sido de utilidad al invertirlos en el pago de placas de su camión, la concesión, su licencia, en esta ocasión invertirá el capital para dar mantenimiento al camión de volteo. “Trabajar arduamente y en equipo como nos enseñaron nuestros padres es lo que ha hecho que el negocio prevalezca”. El negocio familiar es fuente de empleo de 10 personas de la comunidad además de fungir como proveedores de los albañiles que solicitan el material para la construcción de alguna obra, viviendas de familias, principalmente. El objetivo principal de don Carlos y sus hermanos es que la actividad prevalezca durante muchas generaciones más.
Los integrantes de Rio Blanco agradecen a VisionFund México por cada uno de los préstamos que les han sido otorgados pues significan una nueva oportunidad de crecimiento.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Leticia, detrás de los integrantes del grupo se encuentra uno de los camiones de volteo, don Carlos es el único hombre que se observa en la foto.
texts.en:
The Rio Blanco credit group was formed in the area where the archeological relics of the Totonaca and Olmeca cultures have been found, symbols of the historical background of a culture whose roots are still thriving.  The "Caritas Sonrientes" ("Smiling Faces") are some of the most famous pieces in the history of the city.  Presently, this group is made up of 9 people, whose business activities are:

Elizabeth and Iliana: Silver sales 
José, Leticia, Carlos: Construction Material Sales
Beatriz M.: Cosmetics and Jewelry Sales
Ana: Grocery Sales
Beatriz A.:Clothing Sales
Maria: Food and Hosiery sales

Carlos and his wife Georgina have two children.  The oldest is 5 years old and the youngest is 3.  Carlos makes a living as a taxi driver, as well as selling construction materials.  This business has prevailed in his family for many generations.  His parents  and brothers are in the same business, and they all invest their resources into it.  The family has 6 dump trucks that they use to transport gravel, sand, clay, or stone according to the client's order.   While Carlos runs through the streets of this small city offering taxi services, his wife is in charge of monitoring the truck deliveries.  With the profits from the business and his salary as a taxi driver, Carlos takes care of the household expenses to provide the best for his family.  

Each one of the provided loans have been useful for Carlos, as they have paid for the license plates for his truck, as well as licensing and registration.  In this case, he will invest this capital in providing maintenance to the dump truck.  "Working hard in a team as our parents taught us is what has allowed our business to succeed," notes Carlos.  The family business is the source of employment for 10 people in the community as well as providing builders with building materials for their projects, mostly family homes.  The main objective of Carlos and his brothers is to make sure that their business continues for many more generations.  

The members of Rio Blanco are grateful to VisionFund México for the loans that they have provided since each on represents a new opportunity for growth.  
. 
*This photo was taken at Letecia's house.  One of the dump trucks is pictures in the photo behind the group members.  Carlos is the only man who appears in the photo.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on a dump truck

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
This is Edwina - and she’s only praying right now that you will help her make her barbecue business become bigger and bigger! 

For several years, it has been her daily routine to wake up early in the morning to start kicking off her business. She’s been with a small barbecue stall in the market place at Araneta, an area in Quezon City. It’s just a little admirable how she manages to be a full-time mother and a businesswoman simultaneously, despite her age of 64. However, it didn't matter for her as she really wants to support her husband, Danilo, in building their family condition. 

Being in this business requires a lot of effort as income is really not stable; it depends on the customer's demand. But, since Filipinos love eating street foods, including such that Edwina sells, her business has very good potential for expansion. 

But she cannot do that without you. She needs 35,000 PHP that she will spend in buying additional raw ingredients, like meat and other stuff, for her barbecue stall. 

She is hoping that you won't hesitate to help her. She is assuring you that she will not waste your trust and preserve this kind of generosity that you will give to her. 

Someday, she dreams of having a more comfortable kind of living and she hopes for more strength for her family. Also, she wishes that her business will grow as she pursues more. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients, like meat and other stuff, for her barbecue stall

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Hi, dear lenders! A wondrous day lies ahead as you meet Jose! 

This is Jose. He resides at Araneta, Quezon City Philippines with his two children and wife, Janet. Today, he is already 39 years old and is currently busy in his business. He often sells motorcycle parts and other accessories for motorcycle usage. Through this, he's been able to sustain his family. 

He's unstoppable to reach his dreams. Ever since, he has always wanted to grow his business and add more accessories to meet the customers' demand. Given the fact, he's becoming more and more persistent each and every day. This is why his family admires him for being a good father. 

But, it's not as smooth-sailing as what he expects. Though he wants to improve his business to earn enough money, he can't (primarily because of financial insufficiency). With this, he's asking a help from you. He would like to take a loan of 25,000 PHP which he will use for maintaining the business and for buying additional merchandise products for his inventory. 

Now is your time to help! He will be fully overjoyed if you grant his request.

He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise products and motorcycle accessories for his inventory

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Life may be an unending battle, but you have to endure it.

Perla is already 66 years old, and through the years, she has already experienced a lot that made her this persistent and strong.

She was an elementary graduate only. Despite that fact, her husband, Herecleo, didn't look at her as if she were the weakest. In fact, he admires her a lot in the way she values her business. Now, her husband works as a driver in their area at Araneta, Quezon City, and together they ably cover their basic expenses.

Perla regulates a house-rental business. Here, she allows those who need lodging to stay at her rooms at a given fixed cost per month. With her full-blown potential in business handling, she is confident enough to borrow a loan worth PHP 25,000, which she will use for the maintenance and beautification of her house-rental business.

She is looking forward that you will entrust her with this because her business is a very good and stable source of income profit, which ensures you that she can be accountable for what she will access.

Aside from the house-rental business that she's operating, she is simultaneously selling frozen products today, where she gets additional income.

She dreams of having enough capital to start up a sari-sari store business someday. And, she is also wishing to at least have a time for a vacation trip.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her house-rental business.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is 51 years old and lives in Baqaa. She is very adorable woman, and she is married with three children. One of her children is Shatha, who appears in the photo instead of Amira because she is conservative woman.

Shatha is a university student majoring in nursing. She is 20 years old and a single lady. Amira is dreaming of the day that will see her daughter graduated from the university and started on her career pathway.

Amira's husband has retired, but as a result they have faced financial problems and have not been able pay for their daughter's school fees. For this reason, Amira applied for an education loan to pay Shatha's university fees and buy necessary books.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter`s university fees

loans.name: Nasrin

texts.en:
Nasrin is a 44-year-old married woman. She is a mother of seven children. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchases for many years. Nasrin fully supports her husband in running their household activities.

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinc is 52 years old and married. She is a mother of three children. Her husband doesn’t work. She is an IDP (internally displaced person)and lives with family in the Bilasuvar region. Sevinc is a farmer. Sevinc works hard to support her family and improve their financial situation. She has worked in this job for 30 years. She buys seeds (fruits and vegetables) from other markets. After that, she sows her land and then sells them. 

Her biggest dream is to expand her land and  to plant more seeds but before this, she has to have some money. For this, we need Kiva lenders to support Sevinc.

loans.use: to expand her land and plant more seeds

loans.name: Mushkunaz

texts.en:
Mushkunaz is 50 years old and married. In all, she has two children. Her husband doesn’t work. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with family in the Bilasuvar region. She is a talented, honest, responsible, and professional person. Mushkunaz  is a  farmer. She has worked in this job for 29 years . She buys seeds (fruits and vegetables) from other markets. People prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because they are naturally raised and cheaper. People know that such products are always fresh and healthy; they are not grown with different pesticides and are not harmful. During long years of experience, Mushkunaz was taught how to cover customer`s demands. So, selling fruits and vegetables from houses is popular and cheaper for people than buying them in bazaars and big markets.

Her biggest dream is to expand her land and to plant more seeds. But, before this, she has to have some money. For this, we need Kiva lenders to support Mushkunaz.

loans.use: to expand land and to plant more seeds

loans.name: Asaf

texts.en:
Asaf is 31 years old and married. He is a father of two children. His wife doesn’t work. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with family in the Bilasuvar region. He is a skilled, honest, responsible, experienced person. Asaf is a dairy farmer. He started keeping dairy cows 12 years ago. Ever since, he has developed and grown his business steadily to a point where he is able to get more then 12 litres of milk every day that he sells to his customers. He started this business with an amount of capital. 

Thanks to his hard work, Asaf has been able to improve and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed him to expand his sales volume. Asaf has already borrowed loans from Agroinvest in the past. Now he needs money and wants to buy food for his cows. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy food for his cows

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es: Don Gilberto de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) desde hace 33 años, también trabaja en una finca como administrador,  comercializa sus productos de diciembre a marzo con los comerciantes que se encuentran cerca de su casa, gracias a las ventas que realiza es como ha podido salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía  para poder seguir con sus cultivos y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Gilberto, 56 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has worked as a farmer of basic grains (corn and beans) for 33 years. Also, he works at a farm as an administrator, selling their products from December to March to merchants that live in the area close to his home. Thanks to the sales that he has made, he has been able to forge ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, etc. and improve the land that is shown in the picture in order to continue with his crops and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Manos De Trabajo Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Manos de Trabajo está conformada por diez integrantes nueve mujeres y un hombre, padres  madres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de  Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región.  Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, luchadores, con ganas de superación personal, todos tiene diferentes actividades económicas, por la cual luchan para sacar adelante sus negocios y sus familias.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Silvia Elena y tiene por actividad económica la vta. de cerdos en pie, actividad que lo desempeña desde hace diez años en su casa de habitación.  La rutina de esta mujer consiste en trabajar unas ochos horas diarias, y además trabaja por encargo de sus clientes,  el  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de cerdos en pie, y alimentos de cerdos, vacunas para engorde, para ofrecerles y satisfacer la demanda del cliente, y que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Manos de trabajo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Manos de Trabajo" communal bank is made up of ten members, nine women and one man. They are responsible mothers and fathers with 20 children under their care. They are natives of Malpaisillo, a city in the north of the country. They are hard-working fighters with the desire to excel personally. All of them have different economic activities with which they strive to get their businesses and families ahead.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Silvia Elena and her business is selling live pigs. She has been in this business for 10 years from her house. This woman's routine consists of working 8 hours daily plus work on request for her clients.

The object of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase of pigs, vaccines and concentrated feed to fatten them to offer her clients and satisfy their demand. In the not so distant future she will have greater income.

These working people are grateful for the support that the lenders at Kiva provide to people of low resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy pigs, vaccines and concentrated feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is 20 years old and lives in a sector in Jordan called Wadi Mousa. Ammar is an ambitious man and an example of a nosy person; he likes to know and understand everything to help him recognize the requirements of dealing with people or to know the community’s requirements.

He is studying history, and he thinks that will help him to get more knowledge about everything. Ammar believes that his major will help him to know about the secrets of the history.

His family is facing financial difficulties; therefore, he requested an education loan to cover his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. Sari-sari (a term used for variety) stores sell different kinds of products from biscuits, candies, canned goods, noodles, products used for personal hygiene and similar goods which are involved in every individual’s daily living. This is considered one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people since it provides commodities for people. 

Given this fact, Nida was enticed to get in touch with this kind of craft. She is 59 years old and a resident of Araneta, Quezon City, Philippines. For almost 32 years, she has been operating a variety store business. She continues working with determination to pursue the needs of her family. Since her husband is deceased, she is faced with the challenge of being a single mother. However, she's making herself brave and strong for her children.

The income she gets from her business serves as a basic remedy for their daily expenditures. However, what profit they get from the business is sometimes insufficient. At times, she finds it hard to maintain supplies of various products due to financial incapability. This is why she is requesting a PHP 60,000 loan that she will utilize to buy additional products for her inventory. With more products displayed in her store, she can achieve greater income. 

In due time, she hopes to have a better life for her family. She wants to save enough money to be able to send her grandchildren to school. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise products for her inventory.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa de 37 años de edad, vive junto a una de sus hijas, quien decidió colocar una tienda para ayudar a  mejorar ingresos en el hogar

Teresa lleva cinco años en este negocio, y hasta el día de hoy la demanda de productos ha crecido

 Teresa  necesita el dinero para la compra de más productos en su tienda, ya que el consumo de los productos ha crecido, y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Teresa, sueña con ver más grande su tienda, y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Teresa is 37 years old and lives with one of her daughters. Teresa decided to open a store to improve her household's income. She has worked for five years in this business, and up to now the demand for her products has grown. Teresa needs the money to buy more products for her store, because the product consumption has grown, and in this way she can satisfy her customers' needs. Teresa dreams of seeing her store get bigger, and in this way of improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products and to expand her store.

loans.name: Luis Alex Edgardo

texts.es: Luis de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos,  el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 30 años el cual inicio con capital propio, adicional a eso también tiene una línea de trasporte, comercializa sus productos de diciembre a marzo en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, formula de sulfato, insecticidas y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, aged 47, lives in his own house with his wife and his two children. For 30 years he has made a living growing corn, beans and sorghum, which he started with his own capital. In addition to this he also has a transport line. He sells his products from December to March in the various markets which are close to his home.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, sulphate formula and insecticides and so make more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, sulphate formula and insecticides.

loans.name: Maria Angel

texts.es: Maria de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años la cual inicio con capital propio, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, leche, huevos además quiere invertir en productos de belleza y así poder tener mejores ganancias económicas.
texts.en: Maria is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She has had a small store located in her house for 10 years which she started with her own money. She has many clients especially the neighbors and with what she earns she manages to pay part of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, milk and eggs plus she wants to invest in beauty products and thus be able to obtain greater economic revenues.

loans.use: buy basic grains, milk and eggs and she also wants to invest in beauty products.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a married man. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells fish. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Alfred will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is currently handling and managing a house-rental business.

This is a very good choice of business for Helen, since most of the Filipino families today don't have their own houses and depend only on renting. Aside from this, she also gets a fixed income every month from the tenants, which enables her to ably supply the daily necessities of her family at once.

She is already 44 years old. She is married to Richard, 54, who is a taxi driver. With both their aspirations and dreams for their family, they both work hard to save enough.

With her full-blown potential in business handling, she is confident enough to borrow a loan worth PHP 50,000, which she will use for the maintenance and beautification of her house-rental business. With her five years in this industry, she assures you she will repay faithfully with all that she can.

Aside from her house-rental business, she also oversees a wholesale meat products merchandise business, which, in some time in the future, she dreams to also expand.

Today, she is really striving enough to save money for her children's education. She wants them to finish their schooling; that's why.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and beautification of her house-rental business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be capable. 

He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of meat. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. He will use the anticipated profits to pay for school fees  for his child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en:
Virginiah is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells auto spares. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of auto spares. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spares

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a widowed woman and has been blessed with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a dairy farming business, selling retail at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase medicine for the livestock and cow feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Rehema has operated a poultry selling business for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Rehema dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: A local farmer living in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Srey is 36 years old. She is a married mother of three dependent children who are in school. She grows rice on one hectare area of farmland as her main source of income. She sometimes works as a paid worker in order to supplement income. She has been in her business for 17 years and she can earn about 34,400 KHR a day. As the rice crop is being destroyed by lots of insects, it cannot produce good outputs for her to sell for a good price. Now, she is applying for a new loan, which will be her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), to buy a motorbike for daily commute and business use. Srey used her previous loan to improve her living conditions and support her children’s studies. She hopes that this new loan will enable her to expand her business, increase crop production, and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for daily commute and business use.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
A local farmer living in the Prey Chhor district of the Kampong Cham province, Ya is 43 years old and she is a married mother of five children, four of whom are dependent on her. This industrious woman is growing rice on a two-hectare area of farmland to earn income to support her living. She sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement income. Ya has been in this job for 25 years already. This year her cash crop is threatened by pests seriously. As she is lacking in capital to support her business, Ya decided to apply for a loan, which will be her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Based on her previous loan, she has improved her living condition a lot. For this time, Ya will use her loan to increase her crop productivity by buying fertilizer to enrich her crops and by buying pesticides to prevent her crops from being destroyed. She hopes that this loan will enable her to expand her business so that she will be able to earn good income to support her family’s living expenses.

loans.use: to increase her crop productivity by buying fertilizer to enrich her crops as well as by buying pesticide to prevent her crops from being destroyed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a married man who has 4 children. He describes himself as being honest. He operates a retail business selling scrap metal, which he has been involved in for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and he describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the  80,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of scrap metal. He hopes that in the future, he will open another outlet. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank and his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of scrap metal

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with 3 children. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, soap, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years, and her business is located in an area with potential for growth. 

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, milk and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, milk and other items

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 50 years old, married and has four children. 

Leonarda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Leonarda requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Leonarda has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Maria Simona

texts.es:
María de  38 años de edad, está acompañada, madre de 2 hijos, los cuales estudian, su actividad principal es la venta de productos de cosmetología y venta de ropa, al mismo tiempo de dedica al cuido de sus hijos.

María tiene  3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ya que por medio de ello aporta para los ingresos de su hogar.

El préstamo será utilizado para  los gastos estudiantiles que se presenten a sus hijos 

María sueña con ver a sus hijos egresados de una carrera universitaria, que se conviertan en personas de bien para su familia y la sociedad.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children who are in school. Her main activity is selling cosmetology products and clothes. She also takes care of her children. 

María has 3 years' of experience in this activity. Through it, she contributes to her household income.  

The loan will be used for school expenses for her children. 

María dreams of seeing her children graduate from college and become upstanding people for their families and society.

loans.use: for school expenses.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be energetic. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. Lucy has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. 

Lucy will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. 

Miriam operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regulars. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Kyani Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kyani está integrado por once personas comprometidas con el bienestar de sus familias. Decidieron solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund México para incrementar la productividad de su negocio. Los miembros son: Santa quien vende abarrotes; Hugo, bisutería; Anayeli, ropa; Emigdia, antojitos y Maribel quien maneja una estética. Por otro lado, Alicia, Alejandra, Norberto, María, Ciro y Primo venden productos naturistas.
   Doña Santa está casada con el señor Jorge y juntos forman un gran equipo de trabajo. Desde hace 20 años manejan un negocio de comida que se encuentra ubicado afuera de la iglesia municipal. El pequeño puesto se compone de dos grandes mesas en donde coloca una gran variedad de dulces y diversos platillos típicos. Todos los fines de semana se les puede encontrar en el mismo lugar para disfrutar de los deliciosos productos, siempre con la mejor atención. Por su parte, Jorge se dedica a recorrer las calles de su comunidad de lunes a viernes para vender tamales y atole. Así, mientras Santa prepara los alimentos, Jorge se encarga de venderlos a bordo de un triciclo, “el secreto del éxito está en cómo nos desempeñamos y tratamos a nuestros clientes” comentan entusiasmados. 
   Su trabajo les ha permitido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, principalmente dar estudio a sus hijos. Además, hace 3 años doña Santa decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes gracias a las ganancias obtenidas de la venta de comida: “de lunes a viernes estoy en la tienda, y los fines de semana en mi negocio de comida. Ambas labores me han permitido crecer económicamente” además agrega “doy gracias por la oportunidad de un préstamo, pues con él podremos hacer crecer nuestras actividades y tener más éxito”. En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijol, azúcar, sopa, huevos, aceite y pan, con el fin de satisfacer a todos sus clientes.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de doña Santa quien viste blusa blanca con girasoles.
texts.en:
