The Kyani Group is made up of 11 people who are committed to the wellbeing of their families.  They decided to apply for a loan from VisionFund México to increase the productivity of their businesses.  This group is made up of Santa, grocer, Hugo, jewelry salesman, Anayeli, clothing salesman, Emigdia, restauranteur, and Maribel, who runs a beauty shop.  Alicia, Alejandra, Norberto, María, Ciro and Primo sell natural products.  

Santa and her husband Jorge make a great work team.  They have managed a food business for 20 years that is located outside of the town church.  Their small store is made up of 2 big tables where they display a large variety of sweets and small traditional dishes.  You can find them in the same place every weekend to enjoy their delicious products, always with the best of service.  For his part, Jorge's job is to travel through the streets of the community from Monday to Friday to sell tamales and atole, a cornflour drink.  That way, while Santa is making food, Jorge sells it from his three-wheeler.  They comment enthusiastically that "the secret to success is good service and how we treat our customers."

Their work has allowed them to offer a better life to their family, mainly to provide their children with an education.  Moreover, Santa decided to open a grocery store 3 years ago thanks to the profits that she earned from food sales.  Santa comments, "I am in the store from Monday to Friday, and in my food business on the weekends.  Both of these jobs have allowed me to grow economically.  I am thankful for the opportunity of a loan, since it allows us to grow our businesses and be more successful."  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, soup, eggs, oil, and bread, towards the aim of satisfying all of her customers.  

*The photo was taken at Santa's store (the woman wearing a white shirt with sunflowers).

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, soup, eggs, oil, and bread.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as very optimistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells mirrors, belts, torches, shoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years, and it is located in a good area. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of torches, shoes, belts and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of torches, shoes, belts and other items

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a photography studio. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of photography materials. 

Her business goal is to have a great studio with outlets in other towns within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of photography materials

loans.name: Tayali

texts.en: Tayali is 33 years old, married, with one child and living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling domestic utensils for the last three years. He also practices farming for extra income. With his previous loan, Tayali's profits increased and he has used the proceeds to send his child to a good school. He has hopes of growing his business into wholesale with the dream of constructing a commercial house on his new plot of land. Tayali is faced with the challenge of loss of goods and damages sustained while transporting them to different markets, as well as bad debtors. Tayali wants to use the loan facility to buy more plates, glasses, cups, and many other items for him to sell.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, cups, and many other items to sell.

loans.name: Domitilar

texts.en:
Domitilar is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as being honest. 

Domitilar operates a retail business where she sells utensils. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Domitilar will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stocks of utensils. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of utensils.

loans.name: Simplisio

texts.en:
Simplisio is a 40-year-old married father of two children. Both of his children attend school. He used the previous loan to pay for farm labour. Simplisio has been farming for over 10 years and also has an electronic supplies business to boost his income. He started the businesses to support his family. His major challenge is the difficulties posed by climate change, especially the floods and price fluctuation of agriculture products.

Simplisio is requesting this loan to buy electronics for selling so he can satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy electronics for selling

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Said has operated a retail shop selling meat goat for the past year. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. With this loan he wants to purchase more goats to slaughter for sale of their meat. 

Said decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: EDITH: Es una señora amable, pertenece a la etnia Miskita, originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casada, tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de 2 décadas de ser docente de educación primaria. Desde hace 4 años habita en una vivienda de tambo y madera. Está solicitando un préstamo para reparar su casa que se encuentra en mal estado. Con el préstamo podrá comprar madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es  brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: EDITH: Is a kind woman, part of the Miskita ethnicity, originally from Bilwi City in the Puerto Cabezas district. She is married and has 6 adult children. She has over 2 decades of experience as an elementary school teacher. She has lived in a wooden house on stilts for four years. She is requesting a loan to repair her house since it is in bad condition. With this loan, she will be able to buy wood planks, nails, and cover the costs of labor. Her dream is to offer her family a home that is safer and in better condition.

loans.use: to repair her wooden home on stilts that is in bad condition.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 26 years old, and he lives with his mother, sister and brother in the Borjomi district. 

Giorgi has recently opened a cafe in Borjomi Park, which is a very well-populated place, and he already has a good number of satisfied clients. Giorgi is very hardworking and does his best to satisfy his clients.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to purchase a stock of products for his cafe.  

He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of products for his newly opened cafe

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is a widowed woman and has been blessed with eight children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. In addition, she also operates a business of selling milk . She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses in her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish to sell. 

She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to sell

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza is a 49-year-old married woman from the Gori district. She lives with her husband and two children. Luiza's husband is a driver and generates a monthly income. 

Luiza wants to start her own activity and requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan to start a trading business. She plans to purchase clothes at wholesale prices and then resell at higher prices. This will give her a chance to have a stable income and improve the living conditions for her children. 

Luiza awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is a single woman. She has three children. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are regulars. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. 

Her business goal is to own a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be competent. 

He operates a retail business where he sells trees. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are individuals. 

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more trees. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more trees

loans.name: Nason

texts.en:
Nason is a 28-year-old male, married with no children. He has been selling clothes for 3 years, working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day. He also does farming to supplement his income. 

Nason started his business to develop his family, and is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. 

Nason hopes to become a strong businessman; however, market competition and high transport costs to different markets are challenges he faces.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha deals in second-hand clothes and has been in this business for two years. She is 30 years old and married with two children who all live in Kasese, Uganda. 

Martha dreams of educating her children and expanding her business by buying the latest designs to attract more customers. She is hardworking, even though she is faced with the challenges of limited capital, unpredictable weather changes and market competition. 

She requests the money to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Lilian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilian, de 34 años de edad, estudio noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja le ayuda en el cuido del ganado y en las labores agrícolas, tiene 3 hijos de 13, 9 y 2 años de edad y en su casa también vive su hermano.

Lilian, comenzó a trabajar en el cuido de ganado y la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años de edad y fue por esta razón que no tuvo la oportunidad de continuar estudiando, ya que sus padres no tenían la solvencia económica para que siguiera estudiando; el trabajo lo aprendió con sus padres y actualmente lo sigue haciendo con su compañero de vida, se levanta todos los días a las 5:00 de la mañana para  llevar los animales al potrero, luego se dedican a trabajar en la milpa durante el resto de la mañana y  en la tarde recogen sus animales para que duerman en su corral.

Lilian, necesita el crédito para comprar 4 novillos de repasto y engordarlos para después venderlos y con las ganancias comprar lo necesario para su familia.

El sueño de Lilian, es tener más ganado y hacer crecer su negocio, para poder darle a sus 3 hijas todo lo necesario y que puedan ser profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Lilian, who is 34 years old, studied as far as ninth grade. She is in a relationship and her partner helps her with looking after the livestock and in the agricultural tasks. She has 3 children aged 13, 9 and 2 years and her brother also lives in their house. Lilian started work looking after livestock and doing agriculture when she was 10 years old and this was the reason why she did not have the opportunity to continue her education, since her parents were not financially solvent enough for her to continue studying. 

Lilian learnt the work alongside her parents and now she continues to do it with her life partner. She gets up at 5am every day to take the animals to the pasture and then they spend time working in the cornfield for the rest of the morning. In the afternoon they bring the animals back so that they spend the night in the farmyard.

Lilian needs the loan to buy 4 young grazing bulls and fatten them up to sell later on. With the profits she will buy what her family needs. Lilian's dream is to have more livestock and make her business grow, so she can give her three children everything they need and so they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy two young grazing bulls and fatten them up to sell later.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 46 years old, a resident of Zziwa in Rakai district, married with eight children; she also takes care of one grandson for whom she pays school fees.
 
Teddy grows all the days of the week and 12 hours per day; it involves a lot of work like prunning, picking and the selling bit. She started this business with the aim of supplementing her daily income and to be able to provide for her family.

Teddy wants a loan of ugx 1,200,000 to buy manure for her passion fruit garden. She hopes this will raise her output. Her customers are people from different areas in town, especially juice makers. 
  
However her challenges are inadequate capital to expand the business, pests that attack the fruit, and competition.

Teddy is a hard working and focused lady.

loans.use: To buy manure to boost her passion fruit yields

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as enterprising. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, milk, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are members of the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. 

Nancy will use the KES 40,000 loan to start offering M-Pesa services. Her business goal is to have a supermarket within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to start offering M-Pesa services

loans.name: Jutañani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JUTAÑANI” iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Petrona es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de dulces, venta de abarrotes, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Petrona es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia hace veinticinco años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente,  lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “JUTAÑANI” communal bank is starting their 9th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada branch office. It is made up of 8 members lead by a board of directors with Petrona as the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Amongst them are: the sales of vegetables, selling food, a neighborhood store, the sale of candies, grocery sales, and selling clothing.

The loan they are taking out will benefit all the micro-entrepreneurs of which Petrona is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. At present she has a business selling vegetables and she says that she started this business on her own initiative 25 years ago.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her capital (buying vegetables wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesalers of the city of El Alto and later sell in her commercial space. This method of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has 7 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She describes herself as committed. She operates a retail business where she sells kerosene. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are members of the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock and fluctuation of prices. 

Mary will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of kerosene. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kerosene

loans.name: Wagdy

texts.en:
Wagdy is married and has two children. He has an electric supplies and tools project and he previously requested two consecutive loans from TADE and successfully repaid them on due dates. 

He is requesting a 3,000 EGP loan to buy wires, cables and lamps.

loans.use: To buy wires, cables and lamps.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 29, married to a housewife and has two children. He lives with his parents in the same house and has a Falafel project. 

He is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a new gas canister, frying pans, oil and beans to attract more customers and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy a new gas canister, frying pans, oil and beans.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mwendu

texts.en:
Mwendu is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives IN a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

He has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to repay him for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Gloria Bendita

texts.en:
Gloria Bendita has been selling a variety of grocery items for seven years. She is 43 years old and married with one child. Gloria Bendita also raises cows and grows corn and rice crops within her local community. She and her husband works together to improve their way of living.

Gloria Bendita plans to purchase stock of grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, seasonings and school supplies to sell. To make her goal possible, she is seeking additional capital of PHP 25,000. She believes that the loan amount she requested will enable her to keep her variety store profitable.

loans.use: to buy stock of grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, seasonings and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Relwende 2 De Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
M. ETIENNE est responsable du groupe  RELWENDE II DE TANGHIN. Marié il est père de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé à 20 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. Il a 08 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’élevage depuis 03 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il veut s’acheter 03 moutons, 02 chèvres et 02 poules.
Monsieur compte épargner ses bénéfices pour accroitre son activité. Il ambitionne être plus tard un grand éleveur.
texts.en: Etienne is the group representative for the Relwende II De Tanghin Group. He is a married father to eight children. His eldest is 20 years old and his youngest is 12 months old. He has eight people living within his care. He has been raising livestock for three years. He gets his supplies from nearby villages. He wants to purchase three sheep, two goats and two chickens. His goal is to use the profits to grow his business. His ambition is to become a successful livestock farmer.

loans.use: to purchase three sheep, two goats and two chickens

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 44-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two children in Batumi district. 

Zurab is unemployed and wants to start a family business. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to start a new business. With the received credit, Zurab will renovate a commercial space he owns and will rent it out for different events like birthday parties and so on. From each event he will receive rent and will generate a stable income. 

Zurab awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a commercial space and rent it out for different events

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
This is 49 year-old Samah. She is married and has 4 children ages 18, 15, 11 and 13. In 2009, Samah established her provision/grocery shop business where she sells things such as soft drinks, milk, sardines and sugar. She began her business in order to take care of herself and increase her monthly earnings and profit margin. 

Her business is located in the city centre and her main customers are the public. Working 6 days a week and 6 hours a day, she earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Samah has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now she requires a new loan. Samah requires a loan in order to buy cartoons of baby food, mayonnaise, milk, sweet milk and crates of drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to pay fees for her children and to manage the home.

 In the future Samah still plans to acquire land and to educate her children up to university and to help her relatives. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as sardines, sugar and milk for her shop.

loans.name: Shehe

texts.en:
Shehe is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a butcher shop for the past 30 years, selling goat meat. He faces a major challenge of disease outbreak in his place of operation.

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter to get meat for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter to get meat for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to assist with tuition to attend school.

loans.name: Neb Laboum De Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
M. ADAMA est responsable du groupe  NEB LABOUM DE TANGHIN. Marié il père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 08 mois. 02 des enfants  vont à l’école. Il a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’agriculture et l’élevage depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 10 poules. 
Monsieur veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour s’occuper de sa famille. Il ambitionne être plus tard un grand éleveur.
texts.en: Adama is the group representative for the Neb Laboum De Tanghin Group. He is a married father to four children. His eldest is 12 years old and his youngest is eight months old. He has four people living within his care. He has been farming and raising livestock for five years. He gets his supplies from nearby villages. With this loan, he wants to purchase 10 chickens. His goal is to use the profits to meet his family's needs. His ambition is to become a successful livestock farmer.

loans.use: to purchase 10 chickens

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is 38 years old, a resident of the Kabuwoko in Rakai district, and married with 5 children all attending school. 

Emmy deals in the business of farm supplies, which he started in 2010. He is a famer who grows coffee and is a teacher who earns salary. He works 7 days of the week and 12 hours per day and started this business with the goals of expanding his daily income and to be able to look after his family.

Emmy wants a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy more  farm supply inventory to meet the increased demand. His customers are people from different areas of the villages who are farmers. However his challenges are inadequate capital to expand the business and competition.

Emmy is a hard working and focused man. He appreciates the services of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited and the flexible terms that give him time to make his repayments well.

loans.use: to buy farm supply inventory to resell.

loans.name: Saleteisa

texts.en: Saleteisa is 59 years old with two children. She runs a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Saleteisa requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2012, and she will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli is a 49-year-old mother of seven children. She operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Kalameli requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags to help her run the business. Kalameli became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Las Samaritanas 3 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator of her group, Las Samaritanas (all Samaritan women) 3. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children and her long term partner. She plans to continue enjoying sharing with her family and doing business. 

Dominga is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza. She started her business with her savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, meat, cooking oil, grains, salad, and other goods. She runs a Comedor (a little neighborhood restaurant) especially to sell lunch. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business and to provide for the needs of her family. Dominga dreams of having a successful business and living in her house. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, meat, cooking oil, grains, salad, etc

loans.name: Sela

texts.en: Sela is a 38-year-old mother of six children. She runs a business selling fish in her village and at the market to earn a living. Sela requested a loan to buy a fishing net, container, fishing gear, ice bag, torch, and a new canoe, to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2002. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, container, fishing gear, ice bag, torch, and a new canoe,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to advertise and build her website, which will display her stock online, and for supplies.‎

loans.name: Unidos Para Progresar 2 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the group coordinator for Unidos Para Progresar 2. This group is located in the city of Hato Mayor. Her home is a compound for herself, her husband, and their two children. She lives with her husband in their simple rural home.

Altagracia has successfully completed eight years of loans with Esperanza, and this is her 17th loan. She sells cacao to people who produce chocolate and other products. She would like to continue expanding her business, by increasing her inventory. This would enable her to satisfy more customers and sell a larger quantity. She will use this loan to grow more cacao trees and to purchase cacao, dry and process it. She will sell it to customers that need this product.

Altagracia says she enjoys doing business, and her most important dream is to produce enough income to provide for all of her family's needs and to buy some land to grow more cacao trees. She has been saving her profits since she started her business with her first Esperanza loan. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy cacao

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсаре из района А. Джоми 52 года. Она очень старательная и дружелюбная женщина. У Гулсары троя детей, она всегда помогает им в любых вопросах. Гулсара всегда старается, чтобы её семья не нуждалась ни в чем. У Гулсары только среднее образование, но еще с юных лет, она занималась растениеводством, а также очень хорошо могла шить  женскую одежду. У нее всегда имелся стабильный доход. Имея огромный опыт в этой сфере, у нее всегда много клиентов, которые доверяют ей и дают шить свои ткани, даже самые дорогие. Сейчас у Гулсары много заказов, однако, из-за старой швейной машинки, а также ветхого жилья она не может шить их. Она не знала, что делать и решила обратиться за кредитом. Гулсара с большой надеждой обратилась за помощь. Она верит, что благодаря Вам она сможет купить новую швейную машинку, отремонтировать свой дом и продолжит свою деятельность.
texts.en: Gulsara is 52 years old and from the A. Jomi region. She is a very diligent and friendly woman. Gulsara has three children. She always helps them in all matters. Gulsara always tries to ensure that her family needs for nothing. Gulsara only has a secondary education, but since her youth she has grown crops and has also been able to sew women's clothes very well. She has always had a stable income. Having huge experience in this field, she always has many clients who trust her and give her their cloth to sew, even the most expensive cloth. Now Gulsara has many orders, however because of her old sewing machine and her dilapidated housing she cannot sew them. She did not know what to do and has decided to apply for a loan. Gulsara has applied for help with high hopes. She believes that, thanks to you, she will be able to buy a new sewing machine, renovate her house, and continue her business.

loans.use: to renovate her home and buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Santos Arely

texts.es: Santos de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Santos se dedica a vender artículos para el hogar tales como manteles, hamacas, colchas, licuadoras, vajillas etc. las cuales distribuye de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, ya tiene mucha clientela pues vende sus productos a un buen precio y  con las ventas que realiza logra obtener buenas ganancias que le sirven para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y otras necesidades que se le puedan presentar.  Doña Santos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder comprar mas mercadería en más tamaños colores y estilos ya que últimamente ha tenido mucha demanda de sus productos y así con el monto solicitado podrá surtir de más productos su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 50 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children aged 17 and 12 years who are studying. Santos makes a living selling household items such as tablecloths, hammocks, bedspreads, crockery etc. which she sells as a street vendor near to where she lives. She already has a lot of customers since she sells her products at a good price, and with the sales she makes she is able to make a good profit which enables her to cover her household expenses and any other needs which may present themselves.

Santos is asking FUSAI for a loan so she can buy more merchandise in more sizes, colours and styles because recently she has had a lot of demand for her products. And so, with the sum she has requested, she will be able to stock her business with more products and make better profits to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, bedspreads, blenders, crockery etc. for her business.

loans.name: Roxana Beatríz

texts.es:
Roxana, de 23 años de edad, está acompañada, su pareja es mecánico, tiene una hija y viven con su suegra.

Roxana, desde hace 4 años tiene un pequeño bazar y vende flores artificiales, la necesidad la llevo a dedicarse a vender ropa de manera ambulante, pero después puso el negocio en la casa de su suegra, la elaboración de flores la aprendió gracias a una tía, además en sus tiempos libres trabaja como sastre y se tiene que levantar a las 4:30 a.m. para preparar el desayuno a su esposo y  preparar la niña para llevarla al kinder, luego regresa para atender su negocio y su suegra le ayuda en ello.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar materia prima para las flores y para comprar ropa.

Los sueños de Roxana, son mejorar su bazar y poner una zapatería, además desea que su hija estudie y también sueña con construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Roxana, 23, is married and her partner is a mechanic. They have a daughter and live with Roxana’s mother-in-law. 

For four years now, Roxana has had a small shop where she sells her artificial flowers. Necessity led her to pursue selling clothing as a street vendor but then she also established a business in her mother’s house making flowers, a skill she learned thanks to her aunt. Also, in her free time, she works as a tailor.

Roxana has to get up at 4:30 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her husband and get her daughter ready to be taken to Kindergarten. She then returns home to get to work. Her mother helps her in her business.

The loan will be invested in the materials that she needs to create flowers and to buy clothes to sell. Roxana’s dreams are to improve her shop and expand into a shoe store as well. She also wants her daughter to study and dreams of building her own home.

loans.use: to purchase materials to create artificial flowers

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina has been running a childhood development center from her backyard for the last three years. The 54-year-old says taking care of children has given her happiness and renewed her energy, especially since she does not have children of her own.

"In five years, I want to see my center grow into a primary school," she says. She is requesting a Kiva loan to build two additional rooms. This loan will buy building material and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy building material and pay for labor

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique continúa trabajando y estudiando. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para la compra de una computadora portátil. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Los estudios que realiza son a diario y trabaja diariamente también, “ya tengo mi laptop con la que realizo mis tareas, ahora necesito una impresora para imprimir mis trabajos finales…” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una impresora y muebles de estudio. Su sueño es conseguir su licenciatura y conseguir un buen trabajo. Él desea realizar la compra de una impresora multifunción y un mueble para computadora para terminar los exámenes finales de su carrera profesional. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos en 3 años que viene trabajando como seguridad y 5 años que estudia en la universidad.
Es por esos motivos que Enrique solicita un préstamo para la compra de una impresora multifunción y un mueble para computadora para terminar los exámenes finales de su carrera profesional.
texts.en: Enrique continues to work and study. He used his previous loan to buy a laptop computer, and made his payments punctually with no problems. He studies and works every day, and says "I now have my laptop which I use for my assignments, and now I need a printer to print my final work." The advantage of his activities is that the hours don't overlap; the disadvantage is that he lacks the funds to buy a printer or furniture for his studies. His dream is to obtain his degree and find a good job. He would like to buy a multifunction printer and a computer desk in order to finish the final exams for his professional career. This is his second loan, while he has been working in security for 3 years and studying at the university for 5 years. He is requesting a loan to buy a multifunction printer and a computer desk in order to finish the final exams for his professional career.

loans.use: to buy a multifunction printer and a computer desk in order to finish the final exams for his professional career.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is from the village of Partskhisi, where he lives with his wife and son. The family members are temporarily unemployed and Mikheil is the only breadwinner. He works on private orders and gets a small income from home repairs. However his generated income isn't enough to meet even the basic needs of his family, so Mikheil wants to make an additional source of income and tackle the financial difficulties.

All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Mikheil applied for credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Mikheil plans to purchase two milking cows and start dairy farming. He has experience also with this kind of activity and will make his new business profitable. The family will start producing milk products, which will be sold at the local market.

The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need. Mikheil needs support to develop his agribusiness.

loans.use: to start an agribusiness and purchase two milking cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment to help her in carpentry

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mary operates a vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kes 15,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two  crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. She has been operating a farming business for the past three years. She mentioned seasonality in her farming business. 

With the loan, Joyce wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming as her business. She decided to join Yehu to boost and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming as her business.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden’s family is originally from Ethiopia. She finished high school in Israel and began ‎training as a hair stylist. Eden worked in other salons and then decided she was ready to ‎go out on her own. First she took business management courses at her local Small ‎Business Association while she completed advanced hair styling training. A couple of ‎years ago, Eden moved her home based salon to a central location in her city. She has a ‎cosmetologist rent out space from her and she is interested in hiring an additional stylist.‎

Eden needed this loan for renovations so she could include an additional work station, ‎and she needed additional supplies.‎

Eden’s salon provides quality services and hair extensions. She knows she can expand ‎her business and wants to one day hire a team of stylists.‎

loans.use: to do renovations so she could include an additional work station and she needed additional ‎supplies.‎

loans.name: Abdiqadir Dayib

texts.en:
Abdiqadir Dayib is 29 years old; he Is married. Abdiqadir is an MA Holder and he Works as a Communications Manager; also he has worked in the NGOs sector over the last five years. He is a young business entrepreneur who solely founded a Shopping Center in Hargeisa, a unique business of retail and native items.

Abdiqadir's aim is to apply the loan to extend his mini-market to meet the ever increasing demand of customers. He will use loan to buy baby products, drinks, snacks, sweets, packets and cereals.

Abdiqadir's Shopping Center opened in April 2015 and it has been successful since that time.

He requested a loan of $2,000 from Kaaba MFI to buy more of the above mentioned products. 

Kaaba will provide the goods as a loan and Abdiqadir will then make monthly repayments. 

In the future, Abdiqadir hopes to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To buy baby products, snacks, sweets and drinks for his mini-market

loans.name: Maciano

texts.es: MACIANO: Es un señor cordial de 49 años de edad, de la etnia Miskito, originario de la comunidad de Kamla, que se localiza a 15 kilómetros del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Desde hace 8 años Habita en una vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita su primer préstamo para iniciar a construir poco  a poco su vivienda de concreto. Con su préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción: bloques, hierro, cemento, arena, zinc, clavos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda digna y segura para su familia.
texts.en: MACIANO is a friendly gentleman of 49 years of age, of Miskito ethnicity, a native of the community of Kamla, which is located 15 kilometers from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. For 8 years he has been living in a wooden stilt house. In order to improve the conditions of his home and have a more decent and safe house for his family, he is applying for his first loan to begin building his concrete house little by little. With his loan he wants to buy construction materials: blocks, iron, cement, sand, zinc, nails. His dream is to have a decent and safe house for his family.

loans.use: begin building his concrete house little by little.

loans.name: Saa Samuel

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Saa Samuel. He is single, and has 3 children aged 13, 10 and 3. In 2013, Saa Samuel established his timber business. He began his business because he chose it as his occupation. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are the public. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Saa Samuel requires a loan in order to buy different types of timber for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him and will help to add stock and maximize profit. In the future, Saa Samuel plans to finish payments for land acquired to save him from high rental. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of timber for resale.

loans.name: Bumu Development Group Nakasero Market

texts.en:
Ruth is a repeat client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. She is a married woman with four children.

She is a businesswoman selling fruits especially mangoes, oranges, pineapples, watermelons and peas depending on the season in the city outskirts. In a bid to increase her working capital  and expand the business, Ruth has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. This will help her to buy stock of pineapples and watermelons to supply to her customers. This will help her meet her customers' demands and also increase her sales and income However, she is faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital.

 Ruth is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to her since she is now able to fund her business. The group appreciates the partnership and is committed to paying well to maintain the relationship.

loans.use: to boost business by  buying more stock of fruits

loans.name: Valasi

texts.en:
Valasi, age 37, grows and sells taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She and her husband have two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Valasi has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She has requested a loan in order to buy taro seedlings and banana seedlings, as well as a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, and gloves. These investments will help to improve her business. 

She will use her expected profit to expand her business so that she can better provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy taro seedlings, banana seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, and gloves

loans.name: Sinuanua

texts.en:
Sinuanua, age 61, earns an income by growing and selling taro and bananas in her village. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She and her husband have six children. 

Sinuanua requested a loan in order to buy taro seedlings and banana seedlings, as well as a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and gloves. These purchases will allow her to run the business more efficiently. 

She intends to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy taro seedlings and banana seedlings, as well as a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and gloves

loans.name: Manucher

texts.ru:
Манучехр молодой парень 1986 года рождения. Он   женат.  Он очень трудолюбивый парень, любит семью и старается для семейного благополучия. Манучехр учится на заочном отделении в Национальном университете г.Душанбе.  Также он работает стажером с МДО Имон Интернешнл. Его жену зовут Махина. Она швея. 
 Манучехр обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом, когда узнал что есть возможность получить кредит на оплату образования. Манучехр  желает получить кредит для оплаты своего обучения. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Manucher is a young man who was born in 1986. He is married. He is a very hard-working guy, loves his family and strives for his family's well-being. Manucher is a distance-learning student of the Dushanbe National University. He also works as an intern for MDO [Microcredit Deposit Organization] IMON International. His wife is called Makhina. She is a seamstress. Manucher applied to MDO Arvand for a loan when he learned that it is possible to receive a loan to pay for tuition. Manucher wants to take a loan to pay for his tuition. He very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Kijiwe Pesa Group

texts.en:
Sesilia, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children. Three are still in school and one is still small. She has been running two projects, a genge (grocery store) and selling tap water for eight years now. She works from 5 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sesilia's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business and has paid back all her loans successfully.   She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay her loan, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her genge stock  and fill her water tanks then sells it using taps to many local customers. She dreams of expanding her business.

Sesilia will share this loan with her loan group, Kijiwe Pesa, which has six people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her genge (grocery store) stock and fill her water tanks.

loans.name: Fine

texts.en:
Fine, age 63, sells bananas and taro in her community to earn her living. She joined SPBD this year, and she requested a loan in order to buy banana seedlings and taro seedlings, as well as a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, and gloves. These purchases will assist her in running the business. 

She and her husband have seven children.

She hopes to reinvest her profits into expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy banana seedlings and taro seedlings, as well as a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, and gloves

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима, 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 сыновей. У нее высшее образование, работает учителем в местной школе, в качестве дохода для своей семьи также много лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Салима благодаря своему упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию, на сегодняшний день имеет 4 коровы, 55 овец, 2 лошади. На 0,80 Га собственной и 1,50 Га арендованной земли выращивает ячмень и клевер. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки бычков для увеличения поголовья. Салима намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи и позволит накопить на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Salima is 41 years old, married, and she and her husband are raising two sons. She has a higher education. She works as a teacher in a local school, and she has been growing crops and rearing animals for many years to get income for her family. Thanks to her tenacity, dedication, and hard work, today Salima has four cows, 55 sheep, and two horses. She grows barley and clover on 0.8 hectares of her own land and 1.5 hectares of rented land. She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some bull-calves to increase the size of her herd. Salima intends to expand her business which will inevitably lead to an increase of her family's capital and will enable her to save up for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy some bull-calves in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hardware and software needed  to conduct services.

loans.name: Olmahon

texts.ru:
Олмахон очень жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 49 лет. Она замужем и имеет четырех детей. Сама она работает вот уже как 10 лет учительницей в средней школе. Она всегда мечтала дать своим детям достойное образование и старается делать всё возможное чтобы её дети этого достигли и стали образованными людьми. Муж и старший сын Олмахон работают строителями, от этого дела они получают хороший доход. 
Сейчас другой сын Олмахон поступил в университет, и они должны оплатить обучение за первый год его обучения там. Но у Олмахон на сегодня не имеется такой большой суммы, чтобы сразу заплатить. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд, где узнала что есть возможность получить кредит на образование. Олмахон желает получить кредит для оплаты обучения своего сына. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Olmahon is a very cheerful and hard-working 49-year-old woman. She is married and has four children. She has been working for some ten years as a secondary school teacher. She has always dreamed of giving her children a decent education and strives to do everything possible so that her children could achieve this and become well-educated people. Olmahon's husband and eldest son work in construction and they earn a good income from this work.

Now Olmahon's other son has gone to university, and they must pay tuition for the first year of his education there. But today Olmahon does not have a sufficiently large sum to pay for it immediately. She has therefore turned to Arvand where she learned of the possibility of receiving a loan for education. Olmahon desires to receive a loan to pay for her son's tuition. She very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for its financial support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Lisi

texts.en:
Lisi is a 64-year-old mother with four children. She has a small business selling vegetables (cabbages, eggplants and cucumbers) in her community to earn a living. 

Lisi has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, gloves and safety boots to assist her in running her business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, snad, and rods so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Davlatbek

texts.ru: Давлатбеку 58 лет. Он живет со своей семьей в районе Дж. Руми. Давлатбек простой и вежливый человек. Он занимается растениеводством. В его районе почти все жители занимаются этой деятельностью. Таким образом, они кормят свою семью. Давлатбек тоже уже много лет занимается этим ремеслом. Сейчас сезон посева и Давлатбек купил семена разных овощей.  Для урожая нужны минеральные удобрения, чтобы их купить ему не хватает средств. Он срочно нуждается в поддержке и в кредите.
texts.en: Davlatbek is 58 years old. He lives with his family in the J. Rumy region. Davlatbek is a simple and polite person. He grows crops. In his area almost all of the residents engage in this activity. They feed their families in this way. Davlatbek has also been engaged in this profession for many years now. Now it is planting season and Davlatbek has bought various vegetable seeds. He needs mineral fertilizer for his crop but he does not have enough funds to buy it. He urgently needs support and a loan.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
After graduating from UMass Amherst with a Bachelor's degree in Music and Music Education, Jackie began dancing in the Merrimack Valley and has now been doing so for the past 20 years. Her impressive career has included instructing, choreographing, and directing at dance studios for 10 years. Seven years of experience as a director of a dance center and another four years choreographing have made her extremely successful in the dancing business.

In 2011, she began working on her own business and is now the proud owner of Dancing Arts Academy. She offers a large variation of dance classes, including both classic dance and ballet lessons. Jackie also loves other contemporary and modern dance style sessions like Kidz Hip Hop and Teen Jazz. Dancing Arts Academy provides sessions for all levels and ages. Some of her special ones include a "Mommy and Me" class for young mothers and their infants, as well as a class for elderly individuals. In the next few years, she wants to transition to organizing shows, ballets, and some outdoor dancing activities during the summer.

Right now, Jackie rents a space in the back room of a gymnastics school and she feels that it is not well equipped for all of her classes. She wants to expand her space and upgrade equipment like the mirrors and floors.

loans.use: to update studio equipment for her dancing academy

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John was born in Bainbridge, GA and currently resides in Atlanta. He owns a Wastewater Treatment business and is passionate about converting waste into clean energy. He was inspired and motivated to pursue his business venture because he already owned the base assets required to operate a wastewater treatment facility.

Through his business, John was able to successfully convert a 10.5 acre and 4.5 million gallon capacity fuel oil terminal into a permitted industrial wastewater treatment operation. He is dedicated to designing the best waste-to-energy systems and has submitted multiple patents on systems he is currently in the process of building.

His business currently employs one full-time and one part-time employee. He is seeking a loan so that he can complete the systems he has designed and so that he can also scale operations. He would like to be in a position to hire more employees and pursue additional deals and contracts for his business.

loans.use: to scale operations and hire more employees

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, age 27, prepares and sells food to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for seven years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Both of her children are enrolled in school.

Monica has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Monica would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, age 45, engages in fishing to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for six years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She and her husband have 12 children, five of whom still attend school.

Gloria requested a loan in the amount of PhP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy netting and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her school-going children to college.

loans.use: to buy netting and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Aeshi

texts.en:
Aeshi is 22 years old and lives with her mother and her child in the Gairo district. She runs a retail shop of selling agrochemicals in her village. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by buying varieties of agrochemicals in her shop to influence farmers to speed up their harvests.  

She plans to use the profit she earns to support her family's daily needs. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby high school. She focuses on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence. Aeshi has a future plan of becoming a wholesaler of agrochemicals in her village.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying varieties of agrochemicals to sell in her shop

loans.name: Yulduzkhon

texts.ru: Юлдузхон, 39 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 10 лет в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается торговлей детской обувью. Благодаря упорному труду Юлдузхон, в обороте есть товар на сумму 150,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль - около 24,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку обуви для увеличения ассортимента. Юлдузхон планирует направлять доход от кредита в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Yulduzkhon is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. For ten years she has been selling children's shoes to get income for her family. Thanks to Yulduzkhon's hard work, she has goods in stock worth 150,000 som (KGS). Her monthly profit is about 24,500 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy shoes to increase her range. Yulduzkhon plans to direct the proceeds of the loan towards further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy children's shoes for resale in order to increase the range in her shop.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles decided to start his own scuba diving business because he has a great passion for the ocean. He will offer underwater inspections and cleaning services for vessels to both individuals and businesses. After assessing the condition of ships/boats, his business will repair any possible damages. Scuba diving is a hobby for Charles, so this business is perfect for him. Because it is new, he is currently operating by himself. He has already bought some of the equipment such as tools and scuba diving gear, but he will use this loan to finish purchases and jumpstart his business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his scuba diving business

loans.name: Majnun

texts.ru: Мачнуну 55 лет. Она живет  в городке Исфара. Она занимается продажей горючей смеси и топливо. Мачнун живет вместе с сыном. Ее сын изображен на фотографии. Ее сын болен, и ему необходимо медицинская помощь. Мачнун все что зарабатывает, тратит на лечение, но их не хватает. Она решилась обратиться за кредитом, так как сейчас ее сыну как никогда нужна помощь. У Мачнуна вся надежда остается только на Вас! Поддержите их.
texts.en: Majnun is 55 years old. She lives in the town of Isfara. She sells fuel mixture and fuel. Majnun lives with her son. Her son is depicted in the photograph. Her son is sick, and he needs medical care. Majnun spends everything she earns on treatment, but it is not enough. She has decided to apply for a loan since her son needs help now like never before. All of Majnun's hopes rest only on you! Please support them.

loans.use: to pay for medical care for her son.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai is a 59-year-old mother with six children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. Faafetai requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a frying pan to assist her to run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and frying pan.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 59 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages and home care products.

Editha has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and home care products

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 51 years old and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Flora has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mary Cris Joy

texts.en:
Mary Cris Joy, age 36, buys and sells traditional nipa roofing supplies to earn a living.She and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has been in this business for 20 years.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 16,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more nipa roofing materials to offer for sale.

Mary Cris Joy would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa roofing materials to offer for sale

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa, age 43, raises and sells pigs to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Milagrosa requested a loan in the amount of PhP 21,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her pigs.
 
She and her husband have three children, one of whom still attends school. Milagrosa would like to save enough to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Riza is 46 years old.

Riza has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish net and gasoline, as well as to pay for maintenance for aspects of her business.

Riza has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net and gasoline, and to pay for maintenance

loans.name: Nurzhan

texts.ru: Нуржан, 21 год, замужем, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование. Три года занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить свою деятельность, есть 10 коров, 60 овец, 2 лошади. Супруг активно помогает по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса Нуржан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Нуржан планирует направить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nurzhan is 21 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals and growing crops for three years. Today she has been able to develop her business and has ten cows, 60 sheep, and two horses. Her husband actively helps her on the farm. In order to develop her business further, Nurzhan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep for fattening and resale. Nurzhan plans to direct the proceeds of the loan towards the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Laulu

texts.en: Laulu is a 29-year-old mother with three children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Laulu requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausages and plastic bags to assist her to run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is a 35-year-old mother with five children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. Makerita requested a loan to buy chemicals, taro roots(seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pandan leaves, fertilizer, and dye.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children (all attend school). She takes care of additional family members. 

She has operated a retail shop in a rented shop for many years and works seven days a week. She has requested  500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy beans, flour, cooking oil, sweet potatoes, and green bananas. Her major challenge includes changing seasons and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to  provide out side catering services. 

She lives in her house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and paying school fees.

loans.use: to buy beans, flour, cooking oil, sweet potatoes, and green bananas.

loans.name: Puao

texts.en: Puao is 37 years old with four children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Puao requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2012, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Sav

texts.en:
Sav, age 51, is a farmer living in the district of Kandal Stoeng in the province of Kandal. She and her husband have seven children, four of whom are still dependents. Sav grows rice to earn her living, but she also earns an income as a musician. She also sometimes works as a paid worker to earn additional income. She has been in engaged in all three of these activities for 11 years.

Currently, Sav's rice farming business is facing the challenges of insect damage, lack of water supply, and price fluctuation at market. In order to earn more income so that she can combat these obstacles, she has decided request a loan in order to build a stage for supporting her band of musicians. Her ensemble will be able to make more money with this investment, and this increase in income will be used to support her rice farming. 

This is Sav's first loan through Kiva partner VisionFund. She hopes to earn a higher income than she has been able to earn before, thereby allowing her to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to build a stage for supporting her band of musicians

loans.name: Desederia

texts.en:
Desederia is 44 years old and has three children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Desederia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Desederia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Desederia has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Desederia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lot's Group

texts.en:
Lot is a 53-year-old woman with 7 children who lives in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. 

She grows rice on a one hectare area of farmland and sometimes works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 35 years. 

Her crop was destroyed by pests and insufficient of water and the yield is low. tThese are the challenges she faces.  She  leads a two-member group to get a new loan to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers with hopes to increase her yield. 

This will be her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); her previous loan really  improved her family’s living standards. Lot hopes to expand her business to earn more income and update her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay laborers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Yiekleng's Group

texts.en:
Yeak Leng lives in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 35-year-old woman of two  children who attend school. She has grown rice for 17 years.  She earns additional income as paid worker and makes traditional cakes  to support the family. 

The main challenge is that pests are severely destroying her crop and she cannot earn as much income as before. She lacks capital to support her business and requestsa new loan, which is the third time of her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan helped her to buyhousehold supplies. 

She will use this loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ulviyye

texts.en:
Ulviyye is a 44-year-old married woman with 1 child. Her husband is a driver. She is IDP (internally displaced person)and lives with family in the Bilasuvar region. She is a talented, honest, responsible, and professional dressmaker. She has  worked for 20 years and needs new equipment and new clothes. Her biggest dream is to expand her business and  increase her customer base. 

Sevinc needs Kiva Lenders support for her dreams.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Sari Indah Badung Group

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman is head of the Sari Indah Badung group which is responsible for the loan payment to MUK. Ni Nyoman sells pigs which have been fattened for six months. Ni Nyoman is very pleased with the benefits she gets. This is all because of MUK, Kiva and the lenders. She thanks them for the support that she has received. The profits, after deductions for payments to MUK, provides savings for future needs.

The Sari Indah Badung group has a new loan to support their efforts in breeding pigs. Now, Ni Nyoman has a sow. With the approaching Hindu holiday,, currently the price of piglets is very good, 500.000 IDR per piglet. She will use her loan to purchase superior piglets, fatten them and renovate the cages. She and the members of Sari Indah Badung hope this effort will help them become independent so they need not borrow again. 
One member is not in picture because of a religious ceremony at her temple.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets, feed and for renovating the cages

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a 26-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Donna has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is a 58-year-old widow with 5 children who lives in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. 

 She has grown rice on one hectare area of farmland for 40 years to support her family. She also works for others for a fee to earn additional income. She is now quite worried about her  business because of insufficient water to pump into the field and the lack of capital to support her business. 

Touch, the industrious farmer, is now leading a three-member group to take out a new loan, which is the second cycle of her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan has enabled her to refill the land surrounding her house and expand her house. As a representative, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pay  plowing fees to increase productivity. 

She firmly believes that the loan will enable her crop to produce a good yield and she can earn more income.  She will use the profits to buy household supplies and support her rice-farming business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pay plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Nan, who is farmer living in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, is a 32-year-old  married woman with two dependent children, one of attends school. She grows rice and works as a factory worker to earn income to support her family. She sometimes works as a paid worker in order to make more income. She has been in this business for 18 years. 

The rice cannot be sold at a good price in the market and she earns a lower income which is about 32,500 KHR per day. She  leads a group of three members to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This will be her fifth cycle; she has completely repaid her previous loans. 

She used prior loans to improve her living conditions. Nan will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She wants to earn more income to buy household supplies and  educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
Gelita is a 50-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has an auto repair shop business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional spare parts and maintenance for her business.

Gelita has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Nhor is 49 years old. She is a widowed mother of three children.  One of her children is dependent on her and one child works in a factory.
