Nhor struggles to make a living and grows rice on one hectare area of farmland. She sometimes works for others for a fee. She has been in this job for 29 years. This year, her income is less because there are lots of insects destroying her  crop. In order to save her business, she decided to form a group of two to apply for a loan (her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She is a good client and  has completely repaid her past loans. She will use her loan to buy rice seeds, pesticide, and fertilizer to improve the productivity and earn more income. She hopes to expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, pesticide, and fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, who are all still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business.

Lenie has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Nadi

texts.en:
Nadi’s business as a junk collector increases  because he has trusted customers and support from MUK.   Nadi has become a big junk collector. He buys junk from his customers, repackages it,  and sell its to the recycle factory. He will sort the junk according to plastic or metal. He and his wife work together.  His children help with the business after their school day.  He can sell 750.000 – 1.000.000 IDR each week. 

Nadi’s youngest child is in elementary school. Profits support the  children's education and pay for electricity. He is able to save money. 

Near this Muslim holiday, Nadi needs more capital to buy more junk because many people come to sell junk at this time of year. Nadi requests 6.000.000 IDR to sell all of his junk to the factory and  earn a profit. He will go home to Java over the holiday to visit his parents. 

He is grateful and thankful to Kiva and MUK lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more junk.

loans.name: Darma Sedana Group

texts.en:
During six months of maintaining her pigs, Ni Ketut has had no difficulties and problems. She sold her five fattened pigs and she earned 400,000 IDR profit per month.

This profit has increased over the previous period because the price for pork also increased this month. Because of her good results, her husband gave full support for her business. This effort has proven to fulfill her family's needs.

Now, Ni Ketut and the other members of Darma Sedana group have decided to have a new loan to continue the business. The group's main goal is to have enough capital by saving, stop borrowing the loan, and continue the business using their own capital. 

The needs of today's life are very expensive; this forces everyone to work hard to make ends meet. Ni Ketut cannot just rely on the income of her husband, she also has to work. Raising pigs is not the only solution. Now she will also use her loan to support her husband by purchasing various kinds of seeds and fertilizers for their garden.

She got a loan to use to buy superior piglets, with any remainder used for her garden. Her husband helps her to raise pigs. They feed and clean the cage every day. Being attentive to the cage and food hygiene, Ni Ketut hopes her pigs will be healthy and thrive. And both of the businesses will be successful.

loans.use: to buy superior piglets and use any remainder for her garden

loans.name: Sambi Ternak Group

texts.en:
The Sambi Ternak group has successfully paid off their previous loan. Ketut is a 49-year-old housewife, and she runs a pig business to improve the income of her family. With the last loan, she purchased 3 superior piglets and succeeded in selling them all to a big buyer. With the profit she earned, she can support her husband's income to fulfill their daily needs and also save for their future.

With 8 members, the Sambi Ternak group continues to borrow loans to increase their business. They were motivated by their friends that already succeeded in running the business.

Ketut uses her loans to purchase piglets and feed. With motivation from her friend, she manages the business better than before and hopes for a satisfactory profit. The goals for her is that she can have enough capital to run the business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Las Campanitas Group

texts.es:
Cerca de uno de uno de los ríos más importantes de Veracruz se ubica una comunidad de donde es originario el grupo Las Campanitas. La asociación de conforma de trece mujeres trabajadoras y orgullosas de su región, pues de la tierra obtienen el maíz, la caña, el coco y el limón productos que promueven la economía del lugar.
   Las Campanitas y sus actividades son: Laura quien vende ropa, bisutería y queso; Guadalupe, zapatos y recipientes de plástico; Delia, cosméticos; Tomasa y Elodia, abarrotes; María, antojitos típicos; Alicia, perfumes y cría de cerdos; Ana, zapatos y ropa; Mariela, comida y bisutería; Karla, ropa y recipientes; Benita, refresco; Amanda, ropa y comida y Carmela que maneja un centro nutricional. 
   Doña Carmela es reconocida por todos en la comunidad ya que es muy amigable, está casada con Melesio con quien tiene 4 hijos; todos mayores de edad. Desde hace dos años Carmela decidió abrir un club nutricional motivada por sus compañeras de ventas quienes la invitaron a formar parte de su equipo de trabajo. Adecuó la cochera de su casa con mesas, bancos y un mostrador en donde coloca todos los ingredientes y utensilios necesarios para preparar los suplementos alimenticios. El pequeño club ofrece sus servicios desde las 8:00 de la mañana y hasta las 8:00 de la noche y recibe clientes durante todo el día; sin embargo cuando Carmela encuentra un tiempo libre se dedica a realizar sus labores domésticos.
   Actualmente, Carmela tiene un rango preferencial en la empresa proveedora de los suplementos, “la motivación que recibimos es fundamental para el resultado que obtenemos; ahora estoy enfocada en mi club y espero sobrepasar el número de clientes para que mi hija abra su propio club” son las palabras de doña Carmela quien actualmente recibe apoyo de una de sus hijas. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado un préstamo con el cual podrá comprar polvo de distintos sabores para elaborar malteadas, con el fin de ofrecer un mejor surtido a su clientela.
   El grupo Las Campanitas agradece por los préstamos otorgados ya que con las ganancias obtenidas brindan una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Guadalupe, doña Carmela es quien viste blusa blanca, pantalón azul y porta unos lentes.
texts.en:
The community where the group Las Campanitas comes from, is located close to one of the most important rivers of Veracruz. The association is comprised by thirteen hardworking and proud local women, whose land brings corn, sugarcane, coconuts and lemons, products that promote the local economy. Las Campanitas and their activities are: Laura sells clothes, custom jewelry and cheese; Guadalupe, shoes and plastic containers; Delia, cosmetics; Tomasa and Elodia, grocery store items; Maria, local snacks; Alicia, perfumes and raises pigs; Ana, shoes and clothes; Mariela, food and custom jewelry; Karla, clothes and containers; Benita, soft drinks; Amanda, clothes and food, and Carmela manages a nutritional center.  
Carmela is known by everyone in the community because she is very friendly. She is married to Melesio with whom she has 4 children, all adults. Two years ago, Carmela decided to open a nutritional club motivated by her sales colleagues, who invited her to form part of their work team. She adapted her house's garage with tables, benches and a counter where she puts all the needed ingredients and utensils to prepare the food supplements. The small club offers their services from 8:00 in the morning to 8:00 in the evening and gets customers throughout the day. However, when Carmela finds some free time she works in domestic chores. Currently, Carmela has a preferential ranking in the company which provides the supplements. "The motivation we get is fundamental to the results we obtain. Right now, I am focused in my club and hope to exceed the number of customers so that my daughter can open her own club", are Carmela's words, who currently has the support of one of her daughters. In order to reach her objective, she has requested a loan with which she will be able to buy powder of different flavors to prepare shakes and offer a better assortment to her customers. Las Campanitas group is grateful for the given loans, because with the obtained earnings they give a better quality of life to their families. 
*The photograph was taken in Guadalupe's patio. Carmela is dressed in white blouse, blue pants and wears glasses.

loans.use: to buy shake powder in different flavors.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 29-year-old mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides local rural transportation services to the people in their area. For the last 12 years he has been running a rickshaw for rural transportation services. Now he wants to replace the worn out body of the auto vehicle. He hopes that by replacing the body he will be able to get more customers and income to financially support his family. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw body. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help him to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw. Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is widowed and works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling accessories in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more accessories to sell to her customers.

Marilyn has been in this business for 12 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories to sell to her customers

loans.name: Erlinda Atenaida

texts.es:
Erlinda vive con sus hijas en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, es divorciada y vive arrendando en una casa donde los dueños son muy amables con ella, cuenta con el apoyo de ellos ya que es una señora muy responsable.
Erlinda trabaja todos los días, cuenta con un comedor en el terminal terrestre de la ciudad, atiende de cuatro de la tarde a cuatro de la mañana, comenta que es muy duro porque trabaja hasta la madrugada, dice que hay mucho movimiento a esa hora y se vende muy bien. Ella prepara meriendas, caldos de gallina y demás.
Erlinda es clienta nueva para la institución, con este crédito va a comprar una nevera indispensable para su negocio y además va a elaborar un letrero donde identifique su local; está muy agradecida con KIVA por el apoyo ya que con esto mejorará la apariencia de su local y atraerá mayor clientela. Con estos ingresos ella podrá seguir manteniendo a su familia y seguir apoyando a sus hijas con los estudios.
texts.en:
Erlinda lives with her daughters in the city of Santo Domingo. She is divorced, and lives in a rented house. The owners of the house are very kind and supportive to her, because she is a very responsible woman. Erlinda works every day at the food stall that she runs in the city bus terminal. She works from four in the afternoon until four in the morning. She says that it is very hard because she works until the early morning, since there is a lot of travel at that time of day and sales are good. She prepares snacks, soups, chicken and other things. 

Erlinda is a new client of this organization. With this loan she will  buy a fridge which is essential for her business, and make a sign to identify her business. She is very grateful to KIVA for the support, because with it she will improve the appearance of her business and attract more customers. With this income she will be able to continue supporting her family and helping her daughters with their education.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge for her business, so that she can continue developing loyal customers and growing her business. With this income she will help her daughters to continue with their education.

loans.name: Milvia Ruth

texts.es:
Milvia es una pequeña productora de café en Jinotega, Nicaragua. Tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven, y a los cuales ha mantenido y provisto todo lo que han necesitado según su condición económica. Esta pequeña emprendedora, está integrada en los procesos de certificación de comercio justo, lo cual  muestra el buen trabajo que viene realizando en su finca. 

Actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para asegurar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permitan darle un manejo adecuado a sus plantaciones y obtener mejores rendimientos y calidad en el próximo ciclo de café.

Ella menciona, que el amor a sus hijos y al trabajo, le ha ayudado a ser más fuerte cada día y a enfrentar los desafíos que se le presentan. Confía que con la gestión de este préstamo, podrá mejorar los rendimientos de su café y por tanto sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Milvia is a small-scale producer of coffee in Jinotega, Nicaragua. She has three children studying in the community school where they live, who she has raised, and to whom she has provided everything they’ve needed given their economic condition. This small businesswoman has begun the process of fair trade certification, which shows the good work she has come to accomplish on her farm.

Currently, Milvia is requesting a loan to purchase supplies and fertilizers, which will enable her to adequately maintain her farm and achieve better performance and quality in the next cycle of coffee.

She says that her love for her children and her work has helped her to be stronger each day, and to face the challenges that confront her. She trusts that with the management of this loan, she will increase her coffee yields and therefore her income for the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products that her coffee plantation needs, and increase its production this cycle.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en: Ny is a 55-year-old mother of seven children, and she lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province's Cheung Prey district. She earns income to support her family’s living via rice cropping and by working for others for a fee for thirty-seven years. Low rice yields and drought are the main challenge for her business. For Ny, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four who want to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees for growing rice. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees to grow rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en:
This is the Sumbersari Permai group. They have repaid their previous loan from MUK on time, and they report that they have experienced an increase in profits over the six-month loan period. Their pigs grew fat and healthy, and this condition as well as high demand has meant higher selling prices and a better profit. The group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva, and themselves will continue smoothly into the future.

Kadek, as the head of the group, mentors the other members of her group. She herself was able to sell all of her pigs and to earn a satisfactory profit. She saved her profits for use as business capital. She will use the present loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. Her goal is to have enough money in savings to be able eventually to continue the business by herself.

This month is a holiday for Hindus in Bali, which stimulates the spirit of these group members to boost their businesses. The Sumbersari Permai group therefore requested a new loan. It will be used by the group members to buy piglets, renovate pens, and purchase superior feed. The group hopes to have access to loans until such time as they have sufficient capital to run their businesses independently. They are already saving their profits toward their capital and intend to continue to do so. In fact, two members have decided to leave the group and continue their businesses with the money they have set aside. One of them has now been replaced by a new member.

Kadek and her fellow group members are happy to be receiving training and assistance from MUK and support from their Kiva lenders. They send their gratitude and thanks.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Pisey's Group

texts.en: Pisey, 41, lives with family members in a remote area of the Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district. She is a mother of six children, five of whom are in school and one is too young. Nowadays, she sells Khmer noodles and grows tobacco. She has been in both businesses for twenty-three years. Sometimes, she has few customers who buy her Khmer noodles, and it is a problem for her business. This is Pisey's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed and a cage to support her new business. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and a cage to support her new business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Dorn's Group

texts.en:
A father of three dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Dorn is 54 years old. He can earn income to support his family via rice cropping and has done this for thirty-six years. He can earn income of about 60,000 KHR per day and he is able to save around 24,000 KHR each day after offsetting his family expenses. 

Drought is the main challenge for his business. For Dorn, this is his first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of two who want to get new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his loan portion to pay for plowing fee for growing rice. He hopes that he can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fee to grow rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Cristo Nos Guia Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL CRISTO NOS GUÍA  ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO MUJERES, MADRES SOLTERA CON DOCE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIAS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL,  LUCHAN PARA SACAR ADELANTE SUS NEGOCIOS Y SU FAMILIA. A  PESAR DE DATOS LOS OBSTÁCULO QUE TIENE QUE SUPERAR EN EL DÍA A DÍA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES MARTHA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES EN CANTIDADES PEQUEÑAS COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZÚCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, JABÓN, DETERGENTE, FÓSFOROS, ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, Y POR LA CARACTERÍSTICAS DEL MISMO SU RUTINA DE TRABAJO ES DE UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS PARA PODER SATISFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES. EL OBJETIVO ES SURTIR CON PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES QUE LES OFRECEN SUS ACREEDORES. Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. CRISTOS NOS GUÍA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Cristo nos guia" (Christ guides us) is made up of eight single women responsible for 12 children. They are originally from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the region. They are known for being hardworking, responsible and with an eagerness for personal success. They work hard to get ahead as a family and in their business. In spite of all of the obstacles, they overcome every day thanks to their desire to succeed. 

Martha is the leader and she has a grocery store. It is a small store where she sells goods in small quantities such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, soap, detergent, matches, etc. The business is located in her home and because of the needs of the business her work routine is about 12 hours a day in order to meet her customer's demands. Her goal is to stock groceries offered by her creditors and in the near future to obtain a better income. "Cristos nos guia" thanks Kiva lenders for the help they provide low income people in poor countries like Nicaragua that allows them to have a means for dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her grocery with products like rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, butter, matches, detergent, salt, juice, soda, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Narim's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Kampong Cham province, Narim is 54 years old and the mother of six children. Because of her family condition, she has grown rice as her single or main source of income for 36 years.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay a fee for plowing her farmland. She hopes that she can gain more yields than she could before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay a fee for plowing her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
This nice woman is 42 years old and lives with her son and her daughter in Yerevan city. Her name is Knarik, and she has higher education as an engineer. This woman was very young when she was divorced from her husband, and she has managed to bring up her children perfectly, alone and with great hardship, so that today, as she says, she is proud of every one of them. Both her son and her daughter have managed to have higher education. Now her son works at the private workshop, and her daughter works at the college. 

Knarik is also employed, at the Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute. She says she is very happy that her son decided to get married, and Knarik is pleased to see her son and future daughter-in-law so in love and shining with happiness. (You can see her son and daughter-in-law with Knarik in the profile picture). Now preparations for their wedding party need to be started, and Knarik very much wants to make that an unforgettable day for this young couple, who are nice, fantastic and cheerful. So Knarik will use this AMD700,000 loan to organize her son’s wedding party and to buy nice presents for her son and his bride.

loans.use: to organize her son’s wedding party and to buy nice presents for her son and his bride.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en: Aliya is a 40-year-old married woman and she is the mother of five children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a ready-made clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital so that he can buy another stock of garments to fulfill the daily rising needs of seven stomachs. Aliya is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to his customer's needs. He will put aside some savings from the profit to pay for the electricity and gas bill. Aliya hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy ready made garments for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business, such as flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil and eggs.

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila is happy that she already twice had a chance to borrow from Kiva and Nor Horizon, and she really found it very profitable. As previously, she is running the business that she established with her husband many years ago, when he was still alive. She has a small food market, where she also makes fast food and serves coffee and tea. Her customers are mainly students, since her market's location is conveniently near Yerevan State University (Ijevan Branch). Lyudmila is very kind and polite to her customers, and she always has tasty, fresh, food for each of them. 

Since she lives completely alone, her only interest is her business. She says she feels great happiness when her customers are thankful and satisfied with her food quality, her assortment of choices, and her service. This time also, with her Kiva loan, Lyudmila hopes to develop her business and enlarge the assortment offered at her market.

loans.use: to develop her business and enlarge the assortment of offerings at her market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials and wooden frames for her embroidery business

loans.name: Olivia Aimée Rachel

texts.fr:
Olivia Aimée Rachel est une mère de famille courageuse et bien vaillante âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et il  travaille en tant qu'Agent de sécurité. Ils ont ensemble trois enfants de 5 à 15 ans et qui sont tous actuellement scolarisés dans une école privée.
Elle exerce depuis 2008 une activité de commerce en détail des ustensiles de cuisine en inox et en plastique, pour aider son mari à soutenir sa famille. Son projet est de toujours améliorer et développer son commerce, C'est pourquoi, elle demande du crédit pour renforcer le capital et le fonds de roulement. Le but est de gagner davantage de revenu afin de pouvoir améliorer le niveau de vie familial et continuer à financer les études de ses enfants. Elle voudrait voir ces derniers réussir dans leurs études et dans leurs carrières.
texts.en:
Olivia Aimée Rachel, aged 38, is the mother of a family and she works hard and valiantly. She is married and her spouse works as a security guard. They have three children together, aged from 5 to 15, who are all presently attending a private school. 

Since 2008, Olivia Aimée Rachel has been engaged in a commercial venture, retailing kitchen utensils made of stainless and of plastic, in order to help her husband support the family. Her goal is always to improve and develop her business. That is why she is asking for  a loan to build her working capital. Her objective is to earn more income so as to improve the family's living standard and continue to pay for her children's school fees. She would like to see them succeed in their studies and in their careers.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen utensils

loans.name: Salvadora Del Transito

texts.es:
Salvadora, de 36 años de edad, se acompaño a  los 13 años de edad, su pareja se dedica  a la agricultura, tiene 7 hijos, pero solo 4 viven con ella.

Salvadora, vende tortillas desde hace 2 años, antes trabajaba sembrando granos básicos, ahora la necesidad de ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar la obligaron a buscar nuevas formas de obtener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para coser el maíz, luego a las 9:00 a.m. lo lleva al molino y a las 10:00 a.m. comienza a vender las tortillas hasta las 2:00 p.m. porque en la tarde le ayuda a su pareja a cortar pipíanes.

Salvadora, necesita el crédito para comprar maíz y leña para elaborar las tortillas y estar preparada para el invierno.

Ella, sueña con comprar un panel solar y poder construir su propia casa; además desea poder comprar una plancha industrial para no quemarse mucho.
texts.en:
Salvadora is 36. She entered into a relationship when she was 13 years old. Her partner works in agriculture. She has 7 children, but only 4 live with her. 

Salvadora has sold tortillas for the last 2 years. Before, she worked planting basic grains, but now the need to help her partner with household expenses forced her to look for new ways to earn income in order to provide for her family. 

She wakes up 5:00 AM to cook the corn. Later, at 9:00 AM she puts it through the grinder and at 10:00 AM, she starts selling the tortillas until 2:00 PM. In the afternoon, she helps her partner cut pipian squash.

Salvadora needs this loan to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas and be prepared for the winter.

She dreams of buying a solar panel and being able to build her own house. She also wants to buy an industrial grill so she doesn't burn as much.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood so she can make tortillas and be prepared for the winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed, chicks, and vitamins

loans.name: Las Primaveras Group

texts.es:
Cierta comunidad veracruzana es conocida por albergar un lienzo charro donde se lleva a cabo la feria ganadera cada año. En el evento se realizan diversas actividades relacionadas con la charrería que es un símbolo de identidad mexicana. 
   De dicha localidad es originario el grupo Las Primaveras cuyos integrantes decidieron nombrar así por el gusto que tienen a la estación del año. Los integrantes son: Nohemi, Eulalia e Isidora quienes venden comida típica; Yolanda y María, cosméticos; Guadalupe y Zuleyma, calzado; Rubí, Perla A. y Ventura, ropa y, por su parte, Perla B. quien se dedica a la cría de animales.
   Doña Perla B. es una mujer muy activa y amable, su familia es su motivación principal en la vida; tiene cuatro hijos a quienes siempre les ha inculcado el valor del trabajo. Para ella el ser comerciante es una tradición que ha perdurado durante varias generaciones. 
   Desde hace 20 años, Perla B. se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, asimismo vende el huevo que obtiene de sus gallinas. Para realizar esta actividad y proteger a los animales de cualquier peligro adecuó un corral en el patio de su casa, donde los alimenta y cuida con dedicación, “si no trabajas no tienes ingresos y no tienes la satisfacción de ser económicamente independiente” comenta.
 Con las ganancias obtenidas apoya con los gastos generales del hogar, cubre la educación de sus hijas y ha podido realizar remodelaciones a  su casa. De igual forma invierte en la compra de alimento, maíz y vacunas para sus animales. En esta ocasión el préstamo le será de utilidad para comprar una hembra cerdo y siete lechones para incrementar su producción.
   “Estoy contenta y agradecida por la confianza que nos han brindado pues no sólo somos un grupo, nosotros nos consideramos una familia” expresa alegremente Doña Perla B.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la cocina (fogón) de doña Perla B. quien viste blusa color verde.
texts.en:
This community in Veracruz is known for housing a "lienzo charro" (an arena) where the livestock fair is held each year. This event has various activities related to "charrería" which is a symbol of Mexican identity. The group "Las Primaveras" is from this area. The group's members are: Nohemi; Eulalia and Isidora who sell traditional food; Yolanda and Maria who sell cosmetics; Guadalupe and Zuleyma who sell shoes; Rubi, Perla A. and Ventura who sell clothing; and Perla B. who works in animal husbandry. 

Perla B. is a very active and friendly woman. Her family is her main motivation in life. She has four children to whom she has always instilled the value of work. For her, trade is a tradition that has endured for several generations. Perla B. has been breeding farm animals for 20 years. She also sells eggs she obtains from her chickens. To be in this business and to protect the animals from any harm, she built a pen in the patio of her home where she feeds them and cares for them with dedication. "If you don't work you don't have any income and don't have the satisfaction of being financially independent," she says. With the income she obtains she helps with the general household expenses, she covers her daughters' education costs and she has been able to make some home renovations. She also invests in buying feed, corn and vaccines for her animals. 

This loan will be used to buy a female pig and seven piglets to increase her production. "I am happy and thankful for the trust you have given us since we are not just a group, we consider ourselves a family," Perla B. says happily. 

* The photograph was taken in Perla B.'s kitchen, she is dressed in a green blouse.

loans.use: to buy a female pig and seven piglets.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial es un pequeño productor de café en una comunidad de Jinotega, departamento de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa en su finca de 4.2 hectáreas de las cuales 1.2 son de café. Sus 3 hijos han crecido viendo la producción de café en la finca de su padre, y ahora cada uno sueña con llegar a tener su propia parcela de café.

En los últimos años, este productor ha logrado aumentar su cosecha hasta en un 50% de producción, los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices.

Como parte de las mejoras que este productor viene implementando en su finca en materia de mejoramiento nutricional para sus cafetos, actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permitan mejorar la productividad de sus plantas. Esta acción contribuirá a un mejor rendimiento por parte de éstas y por ende a una mayor entrada de ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcial is a small coffee producer in the community of Jinotega in the department of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife in his farm of 4.2 hectares of which 1.2 are coffee. His three children have grown up watching the coffee production in their father's farm and now each one dreams of having their own plot of coffee. 

In recent years, this producer has managed to increase his harvest by up to 50%. His harvest is produced under the certification criteria of Fair Trade, UTZ, and C.A.F.E. Practices. As part of the improvements this producer has implemented in his farm with nutritional improvements for his coffee trees, he is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers that will allow him to improve the production of his plants. This will contribute to a better yield from his trees and thus a greater inflow of income.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province, Sopha is 30-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is in school and other two are too young. She earns income to support her family’s living via rice cropping, growing cassava and beans. Moreover, she makes more income via working for others for a fee for the last twelve years. Her business earns an income of approximately 40,000 KHR per day and she can save about 17,000 KHR each day after offsetting her family expenses. Her rice and cassava were destroyed by insects which decreased her income. This is the sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. With her past loans, she was able to update her living conditions better than before with decent household supplies. She leads a group of three members who wish to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds to gain more yields. She hopes that she can get more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to gain more yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
El Sr. Freddy es funcionario público, a la vez también estudia, es soltero vive con sus padres,   gracias a su trabajo él puede estudiar.
Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas y por medio de su carrera viene abriéndose camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera para poder estudiando.
texts.en:
Freddy is a government worker but he is also going to school. His job allows him to pay his way through school. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a very responsible person and is very dedicated to his studies and his family. He is getting a degree in Systems Analysis and is building a career for himself.

He is requesting this loan so that he can pay his school fees in order to finish studying.

loans.use: to cover university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a progressive small-holder farmer based in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is married and has 2 children. She practices both livestock and crop farming for a living. If you were to visit her 1 acre farm today, you would find 5 dairy cows, 7 chickens, 7 sheep and 10 trees.

Salome is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders, through Juhudi Kilimo, to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle that will be used for transporting goods to and from the market. With this asset, Salome will be able to have access to formal markets in new geographical and economical regions where prices are much better than the local markets.  

Increase in income from this intervention will help Salome to scale up her business and improve the quality of the life being led by her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a smallholder farmer practising dairy and tea farming to provide for her family. Her family is composed of her, her husband and three children. She enjoys farming for it is her means of securing the basic necessities for life.

In the Nandi Hills area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be.
Josphine is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. 

Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one sack of rice, some maize, dry vegetables, and Star brand beverages.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy, poultry, and horticultural farming to provide for her family. Besides being a farmer, she is also a seamstress who owns a tailor shop. Her family is comprised of herself, her husband, and five children. She enjoys farming because it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.

In the Kitale area of Kenya where Judith lives, the population depends on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms: Their biggest challenge is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be.

Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholder farmers around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers like Judith can now buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms. 

Judith is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help Judith fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: Mariana de 62 años de edad,  vive en casa propia con su  hija mayor de edad quien trabaja para pagar  sus propios gastos personales y ayudar a su madre con lo que puede dentro del hogar. Mariana desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de mariscos, lácteos y tamales gallina de forma ambulante en los alrededores de su comunidad lo cual le permite solventar los gastos de su vivienda, ella es una persona muy reconocida y por tal razón tiene una gran clientela fija que a diario consumen sus producto. Mariana solicita un crédito a FUSAI con el cual tiene pensando invertirlo en  compra de mayor cantidad de productos como: queso, crema, pescado, camarón y otros productos necesarios  para poder incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mariana is 62 years old and lives in her own home with her adult daughter, who works in order to cover her personal expenses as well as to help her mother at home as much as she can. For several years, Mariana has been selling seafood, dairy products, and chicken tamales as a street vendor within the surrounding areas. This allows her to cover her household expenses. She is very well known locally, which is why she has a large base of regular customers who buy her products daily. 

Mariana plans to use the loan she is requesting from FUSAI to invest in larger quantities of products like cheese, cream, fish, shrimp, and other items she needs in order to increase her sales and her income, so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, fish, shrimp, and other products.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is an industrious 47-year-old mother. Her family is made up of her partner and their three adorable, angelic looking children, who depend on her financially.

She raises cattle, an occupation that she started out of economic necessity and which is in the process of growth. She lives in the Chuka area of Kenya, renowned for its mixed farming. Rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Florida remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Florida is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Florida will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. 

An increase in income for her is timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. 

This loan will support Florida’s economic activity, and will change her family’s living standards indirectly. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon es de una familia humilde, vive en la ciudad de Caaguazú, está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, está en el 3er año. 
Comenta que espera culminar su carrera y así poder ser un profesional honesto y ayudar a su familia y la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ramon is from a humble family. He lives in the city of Caaguazú. He is studying for a degree in business administration. He is in his third year. He says he hopes to obtain his degree so that he can be an honest professional and help his family and society. 

He is asking for this loan to pay university fees so that he can continue studying, as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for university fees

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose and her family live and work on a seven acre farm in the Endebess division in Kenya. She keeps dairy and poultry animals which give her milk and eggs for sale. She also grows maize and fodder. 

Rose started farming 20 years ago. Through the years, she has had many successes as well as challenges. She has never had difficulty satisfying her customers’ needs with her products. However, the biggest growth constraint for her has been lack of access to capital since there are no banks where she comes from. 

Rose needs capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. With your lending, Rose will be able access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and family income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married mother of four children from the Chuka area of Kenya. She practises dairy, poultry, and horticultural farming on her one acre farm. 

To grow her income, Hellen also engages in the cereal business which involves arranging logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the 30 years that she has been a farmer, she has learnt a lot about the business: For instance, in order to make more income, a trader must take the risk of holding more stock.

Hellen is seeking a loan to buy cereals from local farmers. Given that she is in a position to arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, this investment will enable her move more produce to the market, which will free local farmers to focus more on production and uplift the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Humble and hard-working: that's Rose, a woman with a fighting spirit who has spent a great deal of her life trying to get ahead. She lives in the remote area of Chuka. 

She is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 15 years. Her primary sources of income are selling milk, and through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet. 

Rose passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Rose is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

Support this hardworking woman with a loan and make her dreams come true!

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 41 years old, is very clear about what she wants in life and determined to get ahead and have a good life.She is a 41-year-old smallholder farmer from Chuka in the Central region of Kenya. 

Mary owns a 5-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. The mother of one keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has 20 years of experience in farming. 

Mary is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Mary. 

Through a group of 15 members called Gachangoni, Mary has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled.

Mary is kindly seeking for a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of the favorable weather and road conditions she will have an easy time transporting her horticulture products to the market.  

In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Mary because the institution believe that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry. Her main dream is to buy a house and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Emil Leonel

texts.es: Emil, tiene 38 años de edad, está casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Las Flores, Lempira.  Tiene su propio negocio de servicio de transporte de personas con una moto taxi, ofrece el servicio de transportar a los pobladores de la comunidad y a sus alrededores. Anteriormente tenía una pulpería pero decidió cambiar de actividad y decidió dedicarse al transporte de personas. Lleva el cuarto  ciclo de préstamo con  la institución, este otro es por 5,000 lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos y accesorios para reparación y mantenimiento de la moto taxi y ofrecer mejor servicio al cliente. Su plan es poder comprar otra unidad de moto taxi para obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Emil is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his family in a village near Las Flores, in Lempira. He has his own business, which provides transportation services to local passengers and people in nearby areas on his mototaxi. He used to run a grocery store, but decided to make a change and work in transportation instead. 

This is his fourth loan cycle with this organization. He will borrow 5,000 lempiras, which he will invest in purchasing spare parts and accessories to repair and maintain his mototaxi so that he can provide his customers with better service. His plan is to buy a second mototaxi unit in order to make more income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair and maintain his mototaxi.

loans.name: Freddy Geovanny

texts.es:
En el recinto Bellavista, perteneciente a la ciudad de Santo Domingo, vive en finca de sus padres el sr Freddy, un señor muy trabajador. Tiene dos hijos quienes viven con su madre, él siempre les ha dado el apoyo y estudio que necesitan.
Fredy trabaja como jornalero, ya que donde vive es un sector muy productivo y existen varias fincas alrededor,  además cuenta con su propio negocio, cría chanchos y pollos ya varios años; le ha ido muy bien cuenta con puercas madres y chancheras propias. 
Fredy con este crédito podrá mejorar las chancheras y comprará más chanchitos y su alimento como es el balanceado, está seguro que podrá incrementar la producción y fortalecer su negocio.
Agradece al proyecto kiva por llegar a zonas rurales y apoyar a los microempresarios a seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in Bellavista, which belongs to the city of Santo Domingo. He lives with his parents and is a very hard worker. He has two children, who live with their mother. He has always provided them with support and helped them with school.

Freddy works as a laborer, since the area where he lives is highly productive and there are several ranches and farms nearby. He also runs his own business. He has been raising pigs and chickens for several years now. Things have gone well for him. He has several females and his own pig pens. 
 
This loan will allow Freddy to improve his pens. He will also buy more piglets and balanced feed. He is confident that he will manage to increase production and strengthen his business. He is thankful to Kiva for reaching out to rural areas and supporting microentrepreneurs so that they can continue to grow.

loans.use: to improve his pig pens and buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Everline, a practical woman. She has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Chepterit in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities.

Everline is happily married and the proud mother of one child, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk, and some side hustle business that she does to make ends meet. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good-quality seeds.

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Everline to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

Lenders! If there is someone that you should invest in, then that person is Everline. She will not let you down.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: María Orbelina

texts.es:
María, de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 21 y 19 años de edad.

María, se dedica a vender tortilla desde hace 25 años, aprendió debido a la necesidad de ingresos que tenia, ahora poco a poco a ido creciendo, también tiene un pequeño molino en el cual muele el maíz y el puesto de tortillas lo tiene en su casa.

María, necesita le crédito para compra 40 quintales de maíz y 4 camionadas de madera seca para el fuego y para colocar una pequeña tienda.

Ella, sueña con dejar a sus hijos una pequeña parcela para que construyan su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old and has a second-grade education. She is single and has two children, ages 21 and nineteen. She has been working selling tortillas for 25 years. She learned the business because she needed to make an income. Her business grew little by little and now she also has a small mill where she grinds her corn and a tortilla stall set up in her home. 

María needs this loan to buy 4,000 lbs of corn and four truckloads of dry firewood. She will also set up a small store. Her dream is to leave her children a plot of land where they could build their homes.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood and to set up a small store.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: AURORA: Es una señora miskita de 56 años de edad, originaria del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está Casada, tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Con el apoyo económico de su hija, desde hace 2 años estableció una pequeña pulpería, en un local que alquila en un punto estratégico, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 1000 (un mil córdobas netos), lo que le ha permitido tener su propia fuente de ingresos y aportar con los gastos del hogar. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar: leche en polvo, chiverías, granos básicos, detergentes, pasta dental y entre otros productos. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda de corte y confección.
texts.en:
Aurora, aged 56, is a Miskita woman who comes from the town of Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has five grown-up children, who are all now independent. 

Thanks to financial help from her daughter, she started a small grocery store two years ago, located in strategically located premises which she rents for a thousand Nicaraguan córdobas a month. The business has allowed her to earn her own money, and to provide for her household. She is requesting a loan to pay for dried milk, snacks, basic grains, detergents and toothpaste, among other products.

Aurora's dream is to have her own dressmaking business.

loans.use: to buy dried milk, snacks, basic grains, detergent, toothpaste and other products.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, creció con sus padres, está casada, su esposo es albañil y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 20 años de edad.

Magdalena, posee un cafetín desde hace tres años en donde vende bebidas, golosinas y comida típica como yuca, enchiladas y elotes locos, su cafetín está ubicada en el parque del municipio donde vive y lo atiende todos los días.   

Magdalena, necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar insumos para elaborar los alimentos que vende en su negocio, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos.

Magdalena, sueña con comprar vacas, para iniciar a elaborar productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Magdalena, aged 40, has a ninth-grade education and grew up with her parents. She is married to a construction-worker, and has two children, aged 15 and 20. 

Magdalena started her small café three years ago, and sells drinks, candy, and local foods such as yuca, enchiladas and crazy corn ('elotes locos'). Her café is located in the town park, and she works there every day.

Magdalena is requesting a loan to buy produce to make the foods she sells in her business, thereby increasing her earnings.

Her dream is to purchase cows and be able to make dairy products.

loans.use: to buy produce for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando está estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo, estudia la carrera de contabilidad pública y también es secretario en un aserradero.
Está poniendo su esfuerzo para poder ser un profesional útil no solo para sí, sino también para los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fernando studies and works at the same time. He is studying for a degree in Public Accounting, and works as a clerk for a sawmill. 

He is working hard to attain a useful professional career - not just for himself, but also for his family. 

He is requesting a loan to pay for his university costs, which will allow him to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university costs.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita has owned a general store for five years. She is married and blessed with three grown up children. She aims to have a better way of living and increase the grocery items she offers. Merlita wants to borrow financial assistance amounting to PHP 25,000. She will use this amount of loan in buying more stock of grocery items such as assorted biscuits, eggs, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and seasonings. She believes that someday she could further improve the growth of her general store through continuous access to financial assistance from lenders.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Ernest  J

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Ernest. He is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 4. In 2005, Ernest established his drug and medicine business. His business is located in the city centre and his main customers are the public. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 6,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Ernest requires a loan in order to buy different types of drugs and medicines. He hopes that this loan will support him to enhance his monthly profit and earnings. In the future, Ernest plans to educate his children up to university and to build a house in order to avoid renting in the future.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of drugs and medicines.

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
Los habitantes de cierta comunidad mexiquense tienen en común la amabilidad y la dedicación en todas sus actividades. La mayoría se dedica al cultivo de maíz y al comercio en distintas localidades de la República Mexicana.
   Dentro de esta comunidad se formó el grupo Rayito de Sol cuya afabilidad es digna de admiración. Está conformado sólo por mujeres que, además de ser amas de casa, realizan distintas actividades con el motivo de apoyar con los gastos del hogar. 
   Doña Eufemia sobresale por su gran jovialidad y excelente actitud emprendedora. Actualmente vive con su esposo Pedro ya que todos sus hijos se han independizado. Desde hace nueve años Eufemia vende calcetas de manera ambulante, dentro de plazas, tianguis o mercados. La principal motivación fue su esposo quien siempre ha sido comerciante y que a lo largo de su experiencia ha vendido distintos productos. El hecho de vender de forma ambulante, lejos de representarle una dificultad, le otorga mayores beneficios pues abarca otros mercados y esto da como resultado mejores ganancias. 
   El único inconveniente de doña Eufemia es la temporada de lluvias sin embargo, al tener la facilidad de movimiento, siempre busca los lugares en donde además de cubrirse del agua haya más afluencia de clientes.
   Con esta nueva oportunidad del préstamo podrá comprar más calcetas; "estoy muy agradecida con todos los beneficios de la institución porque poco a poco nuestro negocio crece, y con las ganancias puedo reinvertir y sacar mayor provecho" comentó Doña Eufemia.
   La meta que tiene en este momento es continuar laborando para solventar los gastos regulares de su casa. Por otro lado quiere conseguir los suficientes ahorros para cuando su retiro.
   Las otras integrantes del grupo son Guadalupe quien invertirá en bordados; Maricela, en vasos de licuadora; Elvira y Florentina, en tienda de abarrotes; Elena, en jarcieria y accesorios para celular; Juana, en mandiles y batas; Carolina, en controles y Paula, en vasos de licuadoras y mandiles.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quisco municipal, Eufemia es quien viste suéter rojo y mandil verde*
texts.en:
Rayito de Sol is a group founded in a community whose residents are kind and dedicated to their work. Most of them grow corn or work in retail. The members of this group are admirably congenial. They are all women who, aside from being homemakers, run different businesses in order to help with household expenses.  
 
Eufemia's cheerfulness and excellent enterprising attitude are remarkable. She currently lives only with Pedro, her husband, since all of her children now live on their own. For the past nine years, Eufemia has been selling socks as a street vendor at town squares and markets. Her main inspiration was always her husband, who is also a retailer and has sold different products over his career. Rather than a challenge, she sees working as a street vendor as an advantage, because she can cover more markets, which results in higher profits.
 
Eufemia's only problem is the rainy season. However, since she can move around easily, she always finds a place where there is not only cover from the rain, but also lots of foot-traffic and potential customers.

Eufemia will use this new loan to buy more socks. "I'm very grateful for all of the benefits offered by this organization because little by little our business grows and my earnings allow me to reinvest and make more profit," she says. Her current goal is to keep working so that she can cover her regular household expenses. In the long run, she wants to save up enough money for when she retires.

These are the names of the rest of the members of this group, as well as the items they will invest in: Guadalupe (embroidery), Maricela (blender containers), Elvira and Florentina (groceries), Elena (cleaning products and cell phone accessories), Juana (aprons and house dresses), Carolina (controls), and Paula (blender containers and aprons).

The picture was taken on the steps of the town square gazebo. Eufemia is the woman wearing a red sweater and a green apron.

loans.use: to buy socks.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: El Triunfo El Sauce Group

texts.es:
EL TRIUNFO EL SAUCE ESTA CONFORMADO POR DIES INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y TRES HOMBRES, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE VEINTE HIJOS. ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE SU FAMILIA. LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO ESTUDIAR  Y SE VIO EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR PARA AYUDAR  CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA SACAR ADELANTE SU NEGOCIO  LA COORDINADORA ES MARTHA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES EN CANTIDADES PEQUEÑAS COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZÚCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, CUAJADAS, MANTEQUILLAS, JUGOS, GASEOSAS, ETC.  EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN MATERIAL COMESTIBLES  PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EL TRIUNFO EL SAUCE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
“El Triunfo El Sauce” (The Triumph of El Sauce) is made up of ten members: seven women and three men, responsible mothers and fathers of twenty children.  They come from El Sauce and are characterized as being hardworking, responsible and with a desire for personal improvement.  In their free time they like to enjoy their families.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources they couldn’t study and they saw the need to work to help with the household expenses.  Currently, they struggle daily to get their businesses ahead.  

The coordinator is Martha and she has as her economic activity a “pulpería” which is a small store that sells food products in small quantities like: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cottage cheese, butter, juices, sodas, "tiste" (a traditional beverage made from corn and cocoa powder), etc.  She has the business located in her home.  The goal of the loan is to invest in provisions so that in the near future she can obtain better revenue.  

El Triunfo El Sauce is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have a way to work with dignity.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with products like: rice, sugar, milk, cheese, cottage cheese, "tiste", juices, cookies, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Milcah is a 35-year-old mum, simple, stylish and hardworking, who works on her mixed farm. She resides in the remote village of Kaptumo in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She has spent the past ten years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business to make ends meet.

Milcah is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close to her animals that she has nicknamed one of them “Lelmet”. Milcah wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000, which she will use to buy additional poultry.

With your loan, Milcah will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Milcah is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Milcah dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 25 años, vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en un recinto llamado El Salto Del Bimbe, perteneciente a la ciudad de Santo Domingo, un sector muy cálido y con mucha producción maderera. Miguel es humilde, vive en una casa de madera dada por su jefe, porque él trabaja en una finca como cuidador; es una familia ejemplo porque son muy unidos y todos colaboran, no importa la edad que tengan sus hijos, todos dan apoyo. 
Miguel es cliente de KIVA, gracias al primero pudo emprender en su negocio de pollos y chanchos, hizo su sueño realidad, construyó un pequeño galpón y dos chancheras. Gracias al apoyo de su esposa pudieron comenzar con el negocio, ya han vendido su producción en mercados cercanos al lugar; ahora desean hacer crecer en su producción y diversificarla para lo que solicitan un nuevo crédito para la compra de  dos vacas lecheras que las tienen en finca de familiares y además continuar apoyando a sus hijos con la educación. Miguel es un joven muy agradecido, está muy feliz porque pudo convertirse en microempresario y aunque ha sido duro comenzar pudo seguir adelante con el apoyo  de su familia. 
Miguel agradece a KIVA por apoyar a nuevos microempresarios con sueños.
texts.en:
Miguel is a young man of 25 years of age. He lives with his wife and 4 children in a precinct called El Salto Del Bimbe, a very warm area with a big logging industry, and which is part of the city of Santo Domingo. 

Miguel leads a humble life. He lives in a wooden house which was given to him by his boss, as he works as caretaker of an estate. Miguel's family is a role model family, as they are all very close and they all help each other regardless of their age; even the children help out.

Miguel has already been helped by Kiva lenders, and thanks to that he was able to start his own business raising chickens and pigs. He built a small chicken coop and two pigpens, and made his dream come true.

Thanks to his wife's support, they were able to start the business and have sold what they have produced at markets nearby. Now, they wish to increase their production, as well as to diversify it. To do this, Miguel requests a new loan so that they can purchase 2 dairy cows that are currently at a family member's farm, and so they can continue to provide for their children's education. 

Miguel is a very grateful young man and is very happy that he was able to become a microentrepreneur. Even though it has been hard to start his business, he was able to pull through with the help of his family.

Miguel thanks the Kiva community for supporting new microentrepreneurs with their dreams.

loans.use: to diversify his business by purchasing 2 dairy cows. With the extra income he will generate, he will be able to continue supporting his family and to provide an education for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cereals so as to expand her brokerage in this commodity.

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es: Amílcar de 28 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad quien este año comenzó sus estudios en una escuela cercana a su comunidad. Amílcar desde hace  ocho años se dedica a laborar como  colaborador del transporte colectivo, y gracias a sus ingresos y los de su compañera de vida la cual realiza oficios varios logra solventar los gastos cotidianos del hogar. Amílcar es una persona que siempre busca darle comodidad  a su familia y con ese propósito a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el mejoramiento de su casa, el cual consiste en  repellar las paredes y colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda, con el crédito otorgado comprara: cemento, grava, ladrillo para piso y arena.
texts.en:
Amílcar is 28 years old and lives in his own home with his girlfriend and their six-year-old little boy, who just started going to the nearby school this year. For the past eight years, Amílcar has been working in transportation, and thanks to the income he makes and his girlfriend's earnings from odd jobs, they manage to cover their daily household expenses. 

Amílcar is always looking for ways to make his family more comfortable, and in order to achieve this he decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in improving their home. He will plaster the walls and install tile floors throughout the house. He will use this loan to buy cement, gravel, tile, and sand.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, tile, and sand.

loans.name: Cesar Alex

texts.es:
Alex tiene 31 años, vive con su esposa en la ciudad de Santo Domingo.
Alex tiene un taller de mecánica para autos, adquirió experiencia desde joven porque trabajó en talleres donde aprendió mucho. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que es reconocido en el sector por el buen trabajo que realiza, comenta que fue duro empezar, pero poco a poco pudo ir creciendo, tiene un local bien adecuado para su trabajo. En el negocio le ayuda un joven y su esposa se encarga de la venta de lubricantes y repuestos, juntos trabajan apoyándose.
Gracias a este negocio pudo comprarse su casa y establecerse con el negocio en un local propio. Es cliente nuevo para la institución, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para autos ya que realiza reparaciones en su taller y se les es complicado salir por la cantidad de trabajos que tiene. Asegura que con esto podrá dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y seguir fortaleciéndose en su negocio.
Actualmente no tienen hijos y sus ganancias las ha podido invertir en su casa y taller, espera seguir mejorando porque tiene planificado luego comprarse una pequeña finca para dedicarse también a la producción. Agradece a KIVA por su apoyo y por creer en su sueño.
texts.en:
Alex is 31 years old and lives with his wife in the city of Santo Domingo. He owns an auto repair shop and has lots of experience, since he started working when he was young at different shops where he learned a lot. He has lots of customers because he is well known in the neighborhood for his good work. He says things were difficult when he first started out, but little by little he was able to grow and now he has an adequate shop where he can work. A young helper works for him and his wife is in charge of selling lubricant and spare parts. They work together and support each other.

Thanks to this business, Alex was able to buy his home and the commercial space where his shop is currently set up. He is new to Fundacion Alternativa, and will use his first loan to buy spare parts, since he does repairs at his shop and it is hard for him to go out because he has lots of work. He is confident that it will allow him to provide better service to his customers and to continue strengthening his business.

Alex and his wife don't have any children yet, so they have been able to invest their earnings in their house and their shop. He hopes to continue to improve because he plans to eventually buy a small farm and also work in agriculture. He is grateful to Kiva for their support and for believing in his dream.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
Artashes is 53 years old and he lives in Geghamavan, a village of the Gegharkunik region. Artashes is a farmer and at the same time in his own car, he provides a taxi service.  Artashes lives with his wife and his son. All the family is engaged in farming and on the farm they care for cows, calves, a bull, pigs and chickens. Artashes also is good in potato cultivation. 

So all his farm products (milk, meat, eggs and potatoes) he sells at the city’s wholesale market, with the help of his son. This family earns a good profit especially from potato cultivation and it will be great if Kiva lenders help Artashes to develop particularly this field.  With this loan amount, he will buy potato seedlings of a new and good sort, fertilizer and also diesel fuel.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, of a new and good sort, fertilizer and also diesel fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy quality seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Rosario De Fatima

texts.es:
FATIMA DE 60 AÑOS DE EDAD, ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA, CASADA CON DOS HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD, E INDEPENDIENTE ECONÓMICAMENTE, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL,  YA QUE CUMPLÍ CON SU METAS Y OBJETIVOS COMO FORMAR A SUS HIJOS, TERMINAR DE HACER MEJORES A SU CASA. TODA GRACIAS A SU ESFUERZO SU TRABAJO, DEDICACIÓN  A LA ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA QUE DESEMPEÑA COMO ES LA COSTURA.   A PESAR QUE POR MOTIVOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO ESTUDIAR Y DESDE MUY JOVEN APRENDIÓ EL OFICIO DE COSTURA EL CUAL SE LO ENSEÑO SU MADRE.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA EL SERVICIO DE COSTURA DESDE HACE QUINCE AÑOS, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN. Y CONSISTE EN ELABORAR PRENDAS DE VESTIR COMO: CAMISAS, FALDAS, PANTALONES, ROPA DE CAMA, ROPA DE NIÑO, FUNDAS DE BAÑO ETC. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA COMO: TELAS, CIPER, BOTONES, ENCAJES, CINTAS, HILOS, CEDINAS, AGUJAS, TIJERAS, FORROS, VELOS ETC. PARA SATISFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES, Y QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. FATIMA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Fatima is 60 years old and is from Managua. She is married and has two adult children who are financially independent. She is hard-working and responsible, with a desire to improve herself. She has now accomplished her goals of raising her children and making improvements to her house, thanks to her hard work at her job, which is sewing. For financial reasons, she was unable to go to school, and learned how to sew from a very young age from her mother.

Because of her desire to get ahead she has been providing sewing services for fifteen years, working from her home. She makes clothing such as shirts, skirts, pants, and children's clothes, as well as bed linens and toilet seat covers, etc. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and supply her business with materials such as fabric, buttons, lace, ribbon, thread, needles, scissors, lining, etc. She would like to meet the demands of her clients, and in the near future earn more income. Fatima is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with few resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent type of work.

loans.use: to buy basic sewing materials such as fabric, buttons, lace, ribbon, thread, needles, scissors, lining, etc.

loans.name: Gaston

texts.es:
Gaston esta estudiando la carrera de derecho, esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder seguir con sus estudios y ser un profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus gastos de titulación.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir la totalidad de sus gastos de titulacion, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Gaston is studying to get a law degree. He is putting in his best effort to continue with his studies and be a professional that can help other people.  He indicates that the previous loan was used to pay part of his certification expenses.  Today he requests a new loan to cover the total amount of his university certification expenses.

loans.use: To pay for university certification expenses related to his law degree.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 47 years old and she lives with her husband and two daughters in Spitak city of Lori region.
