Marine graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute and already for 23 years she has worked at the school, as a teacher of theArmenian Language and Literature. Marine also gives at her house paid private courses of her subject, in this way preparing a group of pupils for coming entrance exams. 

Marine loves her profession and her daily work with children. As she says her work is very responsible and interesting one, and she is happy in her choice of profession that once she made. 

This loan of 350.000 Armenian drams Marine asks for the purchase of a computer, since as she says it is good way of having information about the innovation is teaching methodology, being unable to take part in different training and informational courses that are organized mainly in Yerevan city.

loans.use: for the purchase of a computer and take part in different training and informational courses to keep her up to date in her subject

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Rafia’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years she has established a good clientele. 

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business. Now Rafia has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and lace for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and lace for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un hombre de treinta y nueve años de edad, casado y de ocupación obrero. Necesita urgentemente un implante de lente intraocular en el ojo derecho, tratamiento que había postergado por falta de recursos . El trabajo que realiza  es con maquinaria pesada por lo que teme ocasionar un accidente debido a su padecimiento.
texts.en: He is a 39 year old man.  He is married and he is a workman by occupation.  He urgently needs an intraocular lens implant in his right eye.  This is a treatment that has been delayed due to lack of resources.  The work that he does is with heavy machinery, and he fears having an accident due to his condition.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran, with his nice wife, lives in Gagarin village of Gegharkkunik region. He previously worked in different places as a locksmith, then as a welder, but now he is a farmer and his wife (she works as a nurse) greatly helps him on their farm. On the farm he has cows, calves, heifers and bulls. 

Tigran organizes the sale of farm products from his farm and he sells milk, meat, macun (the national dairy-product), cheese and curd from his farm. 

Tigran is not satisfied of his farm income and he wants to enlarge its cattle number. So with this loan Tigran wants to buy two more calves and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two more calves and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married mother of one child. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past nine years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes  to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new CNG rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un hombre de cincuenta y nueve años de edad es casado, trabaja como guardia de seguridad. El poco a poco ha perdido visión en ambos ojos esto a consecuencia de la miopía que desarrollo hace años. El necesita urgentemente una cirugía para poder recuperar su vista, que  debido a la falta de recursos no ha podido realizar, cada día que pasa ve mas lejano la hora de recuperar su vista para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en: He is a 59 year old man.  He is married, and he works as a security guard.  Little by little, he has lost vision in both eyes due to myopia that developed years ago.  He urgently needs surgery in order to be able to recover his vision.  Due to lack of resources, he has not been able to have the surgery.  Each day that passes makes the recovery of his vision, so that he is able to continue working, further in the future.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 34 years old, a married lady and has been handling a business selling grocery items in her community for many years.  By this time she has retained many customers and makes enough to provide for her family. 

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use  to buy rice, sugar, grains, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Robina wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers

loans.name: Noelina

texts.en:
Noelina, who is 44 years old, is married with one school-going child. Since 2002 she has been selling different types of clothes, including vitenge and Kanga, and owns a beautiful salon. She works from 8 am to 08 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Noeliana's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. 

She will use this loan to buy salon items and cosmetics. 

She dreams to grow more and open a barber shop. She will  be accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon items and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Working to better herself and her family is Ruth, who is 69 and the mother of eight children. Farming on a small bit of land is challenging for people in the Nandihills region of Kenya, but Ruth has mastered this problem in her fifty years of mixed farming. She sells tea and milk to earn an income and has a small side business to supplement her meager income.

Ruth, who is an ever-happy farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is only for men. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes every morning to go and milk her cows.

This humble woman's cows’ milk is known to be of the best quality, and so through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm and the local market for her milk. With this success, however, has come the challenge of an increased demand for her cows’ milk.

To meet this demand Ruth is seeking a loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a good-quality dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of nutritious milk a day. In this way she hopes to satisfy her customers’ requirements.

Ruth attended Juhudi Kilimo’s training sessions where she learned good financial management skills. These will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions. Ruth possesses the character of an honest farmer, and therefore she promises to repay the loan on time according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy a good-quality dairy cow

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Just the way Hellen carries herself, one could easily tell that she is a hard-working and honest dairy farmer. Traditionally, her primary source of income has been eggs, crops, and a personal business and she has been practicing farming for the past seven years. Having done farming for such a long time, she has gained so much experience that she is always ranked the best farmer in her village. 

Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture, particularly the Nandi tribe (Hellen’s tribe), where cows represent wealth. 

Demand for dairy milk has been high and Hellen wants to take advantage of the market. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Hellen has already identified the breed of dairy cow that she wants. She has planted so many trees on her farm that food for the cattle will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge because she will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. 

Through the loan, Hellen will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of her farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer. Hellen has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved, knowing that institutions, such as Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, are there to make her dream come true. 

Hellen chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Hellen underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and, during the training season, she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. 

Through accumulated profits, Hellen plans to permanently improve her living conditions and to secure the future of her school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. She plans that, through increased income, she will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester and, hence, save costs incurred in buying fuel.

Kindly help out this Kenyan enterprising woman farmer with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of cow.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 55-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. 

Parveen is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. 

Currently she needs a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits with this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors and earn substantial profits with this investment

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn, 43, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. To support his family’s living, he grows rice and cucumbers. Moreover, he can get more income from raising cows. 

This is Khoeurn's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and he has fully repaid back his past loan successfully. With his past loan, he made a better income than before so he could buy decent household supplies to use for his family. 

He will spend his entire loan portion to buy more cows, pesticide, fertilizer and seeds to support his farming. 

He hopes that he can get more income than before.

loans.use: To buy more cows, pesticide, fertilizer and seeds to support his farming.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Akhtar wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently and to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Her name is Mercy, 47 years old, from General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Happily married to Wilfredo, an electrician, she has one offspring who is already in college. Being a strong business-minded woman, she does her best to augment their income to provide for their daily needs and send her daughter to college.
 
Mercy is grateful that God has blessed her with a general store. She buys essential food items, toiletries, and beverages from wholesalers and sells them at retail price. With her charming personality she has gained quite a number of loyal customers. Although at times she finds it difficult to collect her receivables from customers who buy on credit she still maintains her positive outlook and faith that God will provide for their needs.

She trusts that she can avail of a 15,000 PHP loan to expand her store. She will use the funds to buy large quantities of grocery items like instant noodles, rice, biscuits, eggs, beverages, and oil to add to her store. It is important that she has most of the essential food items to attract and serve more customers in her community.

Mercy prays that God will bless her efforts with success and see her daughter finish college to allow her better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis, along with his wife, lives in the village of Geghi in the Syunik region. Their children (three sons and a daughter) are already married and they live with their families. 

Aramayis is a farmer and he is engaged in cattle, poultry, rabbit and bee breeding. He also has a nice vegetable garden with the harvest of potatoes, beans and cabbage. He sells all his farm products (milk, meat, eggs and honey, also potatoes, beans and cabbage) at the city’s wholesale market. 

Aramayis is a Jack-of-all-trades, and he also has a small woodworking workshop in his yard, where he takes orders of making different things of wood. So thanks to his farming and his craft skills he earns their living and he also helps his children with finances. 

Aramayis asks for this loan to buy a lot of hay and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of hay and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as cloth, nails, cotton, planks, etc. for her husband's sofa making business.

loans.name: Jagamaya Group

texts.en:
Jagamaya Group was started in the year 2015 at Patharalla village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are ten active, self-dependent women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of this group have their own profession and business.

Nirmala is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and their group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is standing in the second row, the third person from the left hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 24 years old and lives with her small family: her husband, one son, and a daughter.

Nirmala has been engaged with a tailoring shop beside her own home of Patharalla for the last eight years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the shop. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 9,000 INR. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible.

In the current market situation, the competition is also very high. Another big investment is necessary for the expansion of the business. Fund scarcity is the main concern. So, she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

She planned to purchase four tailoring machines, including a picot machine. She will also appoint two employees to make dresses, so as to meet the demand of customers. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for reconstruction of her house. She also wishes to enroll her children in a better school for better education.

The other nine members of the group are also smart at their professions and also are actively engaged with different professions like auto rider, vegetable cultivation, animal trading, tailoring, and a grocery shop. With this loan, they hope to boost up their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase four tailoring machines, including a picot machine.

loans.name: Héctor Ulises

texts.es:
Héctor es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 2.1 hectáreas de las cuales 1 es de café. En los últimos años ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 19 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales produce bajo procesos de certificación comercio justo. Este pequeño productor ha venido mejorando su finca año con año, esto gracias al apoyo que ha encontrado en la organización quien no solo le brinda financiamiento, sino también asistencia técnica permanente. 

Uno de los mayores retos que enfrenta este productor en su finca es el control de las plagas y enfermedades del café, tales como la antracnosis la cual provoca manchas en las hojas y frutos.

Para garantizar un plan de manejo integrado de plagas y enfermedades en sus plantaciones, este pequeño productor está solicitando para este ciclo, un financiamiento que le permita la adquisición de insumos y fertilizantes para el manejo agronómico del café, lo cual le permitirá además incrementar la producción en un 30%. Todo esto derivará en mejores ingresos para alcanzar la sostenibilidad y reinversión en su finca.
texts.en:
Héctor is a producer in the northern part of Nicaragua.  His farm is 2.1 hectares, on one of which is coffee.  In the past years he has managed a harvest of approximately 19 ‘quintales’ [a quintal is approximately 100 pounds] of parchment coffee.  It is produced under the processes of fair trade certification.

This small producer has been improving his farm year after year.  This is thanks to the support he has found in the organization that not only provides financing, but it also provides ongoing technical assistance.

One of the biggest challenges this producer faces on his farm is pest control and coffee diseases like ‘antracnosis’ [a fungus] that causes spots on the leaves and the beans.

In order to guarantee an integrated plan for managing pests and diseases on his plants, this small producer is requesting a loan for this cycle.  The loan will allow him to get the supplies and fertilizers for the agronomic management of the coffee.  This will also allow him to increase his production by 30%.  From all of this he will get better earnings in order to manage sustainability and reinvestment in his farm.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to use on his coffee farm in order to increase his production during this cycle.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is aged 31 years and he supports three children. He has been selling sodas for the last five years and the business earns him KES 15,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stocks of soda for sale to clients in the market. 

He plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sale to clients and to educate his children. His hope is to expand his business sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soda for sale to clients in the market.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 36-year-old widow. She is a mother of two children. She has been running a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. After raising animals for a year or two she sells them in the local market. She also sells the animals' milk to generate an extra amount of income.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for resale in the market. She desires of improving her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale in the market.

loans.name: Aurora Del Socorro

texts.es:
AURORA DE 48 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA CON UN HIJO MAYOR DE EDAD, E INDEPENDIENTE, ES ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA CENTRAL DE LA REGIÓN. SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDO ESTUDIAR Y SE VIO EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR DESDE TEMPRANA EDAD. PERO GRACIAS A SUS PERSEVERANCIA, HA LOGRADO MANTENER SU NEGOCIO Y  AYUDAR A SU HIJO  EN SUS ESTUDIO, EL CUAL SE SIENTE ORGULLOSA PORQUE SU HIJO HA CULMINADO SUS ESTUDIOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE MARISCOS, ROPA DE HOMBRE, ROPA DE MUJER, PERFUMES, BODY. TIENE SEIS AÑOS DE TENER EL NEGOCIO DE FORMA AMBULANTE, EL PESCADO LO VENDE EN SU CASA  DE HABITACIÓN. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES, Y COSMÉTICOS, PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES, Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. AURORA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Aurora is 48 years old, single with an adult independent son. She is a native of Managua, a city that is located in the central part of the country. She is hard-working, responsible and has the desire to excel. Unfortunately she could not study as she had to work from an early age. But thanks to her perseverance she has been able to run her business and help her son with his studies. She is proud as her son has completed his studies.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead her business is selling seafood, men and women's clothing, perfume and body lotion. She has run the business for six years and she works itinerantly. She sells the fish from her house.

The objective of her loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying food and cosmetic products to satisfy the demand of her clients and in the not-so-distant future obtain higher income. Aurora is grateful to the support that the Kiva lenders provide for people of low resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy fish, seafood and cosmetics like lipstick, rouge, eye shadow, eye liner, vanity cases, etc.

loans.name: Brundabati Group

texts.en:
Brundabati Self-Help Group was started in the year 2015 at Siluan village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are ten active, self-dependent women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the group members are from poor families. All the members of this group have their own profession and business.

Luchana is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and their group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is standing in the second row, the second person from the right hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 46 years old and lives with her small family: her husband and only one son.

Luchana has been engaged with a grocery shop beside her own home at Siluan village for the last five years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of about 6,400 INR, which is just $100. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So, she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

She planned to purchase a huge quantity of grocery items such as rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, toothpaste, washing powder, potatoes, onions, groundnuts, etc. and other related items from the wholesaler. She hopes it will definitely improve her sales, and she will get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of her own house. She also wishes to enroll her son in a public school for better education.

The other nine members of the group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different professions like a grocery shop, a daily needs and cosmetics shop, a rice business, tailoring, a hotel, a cloth store, and a carpentry business. With this loan, they also hope to make their livelihoods better.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of grocery items such as rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, toothpaste, washing powder, potatoes, onions, groundnuts, etc. and other related items.

loans.name: Sasilia

texts.en: Sasilia, 39, comes from a lush farming location known as Runyejes in Chuka, Kenya. Here, both crops and animals thrive in the hot wet weather. Sasilia owns a small parcel of land where she grows maize among other crops and keeps dairy animals. Today, she is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase an additional dairy cow. The newly-acquired cow will help utilize pasture and maize stalks in her farmland. The cow will also increase the quantity of milk that Sasilia sells to her neighbours and to the markets around her. Income from this investment will be a great booster in her personal and business life. Kindly help out this enterprising Kenyan woman!

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Niceta

texts.en:
Niceta is a woman who is eager to get ahead. She is a 36-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Chuka area of Kenya. She is blessed with a lovely family, which is her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them with a better future. Niceta was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living, and has space there to use for dairy farming.

She has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Chuka is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Niceta, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business. Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk. She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of two from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She owns a 0.5-acre farm that she uses to keep dairy cows and poultry. Due to the size of the land, she can hardly keep more animals despite the pressure she is under to generate more income.

To generate more income, Mary started a merchandise business. Her role is to arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She plans to make the best use of her 13 years of experience in farming and loan capital to make the business successful. She is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to aggregate produce from local farmers.

This way, Mary will be able to make a decent income for her family while freeing local farmers to focus on what they are good at - production, rather than sales.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a 29-year-old mother to three adorable children, who out of economic need, devoted herself to start mixed farming. Thanks to this, she has gotten out ahead. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Nandi Hills area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the high demand. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman and accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, change her living conditions, and secure the future of her children.

Be a part of her dream, lend today.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Mchanze

texts.en:
Mchanze is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been working to make hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment which will allow her to cater for more customers consistently. She is hopeful of increasing her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment which will allow her to cater for more customers consistently.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kandal province, Mach is 55 years old and a mother of ten children. Nowadays she grows rice on a half hectare area as the main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee and raises cows to supplement her income. She had some problems with her farming business because she has insufficient capital to support her farm. 

This will be her fifth cycle and she asks for loan support of 4,000,000 KHR from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is a good client and she has repaid her past loans completely. Her past loan really made her family’s living get better. She will spend her entire loan to buy more cows to support her business. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more cows to support her business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 38-year-old vigorous married woman. She has had a business of hand embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. 

Parveen’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of five children. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. She hopes to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber for making furniture for sale to clients and to meet client needs.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Edith, a 42-year-old, very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives in the Chuka area, in the central region of Kenya. Edith passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past seven years and has always managed to provide for her family.

Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. Edith has identified a free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Edith, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms.

Edith said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural-based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Edith hopes that through the accumulated profit, she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and secure her future. She awaits your kindness.

With your help this dream can be fulfilled.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 48-year-old separated woman and has been running a business of milk selling for many years. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales so she can earn a good amount of income and fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales so she can earn a good amount of income and fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: At 29 years old, Nancy has lots of energy and drive to work in her mixed farm. She lives in a humble house with her two children. Nancy is a resilient entrepreneur who is actively involved in many income-generating activities, the main one being agriculture. Nancy resides on a small plot of land in Cheboin village in the Litein area of Kenya. She started with next to nothing and five years later, she is keeping poultry, cows and growing different varieties of crops. She also owns a small business that brings in some extra profit. Nancy is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Dairy farming is bringing her good income but the only problem is that there is fluctuation of prices. She is seeking to expand her poultry farming because the product is doing great in the market and the income is regular. Poultry farming sustains her family as she waits for other produce to be ready for the market. With your funding, Nancy is going to use the income from your investment to repay the loan and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit from the frontier village of Vazashen of Tavush region sends his great thanks for his first deal with Kiva and has a request for the second time. Davit lives in this nice village with his wife, daughter and his parents. Davit is a farmer and he also works now as a warden. His farming he manages with the help of his wife and his mother. In his farm he has pigs, piglets and chickens. He also has now a nice orchard with trees of mulberry, fig and pear in it. So this harvest and his farm’s meat and eggs Davit sells locally already to his regular customers. 

Davit greatly wants to enlarge the assortment of her farm cattle and he will be happy if Kiva lenders help him in this case. With his Kiva loan, he wants to buy several bulls and also fodder for his pigs.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and also fodder for his pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a single mother of two children from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She does dairy, poultry and tree farming to provide for her children. Recently, she started a cereals trading business on the side to aggregate produce from farmers and sell at urban markets that offer better prices.

For her to make enough income off this business, she needs to invest in more inventory but she has little to no capital to make such a move. She is seeking a loan to build inventory. The income generated from this investment will be of a big help to her, especially with the increasing household expenses. Farmers will benefit too from her services as they will be free to focus on food production rather than sales.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the expansion of her horticultural farming.

loans.name: Philarice

texts.en:
Philarice is a woman eager to get ahead. She is a 25-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is blessed with a lovely family which is her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them a better future.

Philarice was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 5 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living, and has space there to use for dairy farming. She has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Kapsowar is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Philarice, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business.

Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk. She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her family and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Uttam Group

texts.en:
Uttam Group was formed in the year 2015 at Chingermunda village in Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are 11 active self-dependent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the group members are from poor families. All the members of the group have their own professions and businesses. Bina is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing in the second row, third person from the right hand side with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 23 years old and living with her husband only.

Her family has been engaged in a motor garage business at Chingermunda village for the last six years. All family members are promoting the business. The monthly income of the family from the business is about 6,600 INR. In Bina’s opinion, this income is not at all sufficient to maintain her family and hence, there are almost zero surpluses at the end of the month. She planned to improve her business with more investments but the availability of funds is the main concern. So as a result, Bina applied for a loan for her group and got approved by Mahashakti. From this loan, she will purchase some modern tools and machines for her garage. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the re-construction of her house.

The other 10 members of her group are also smart in their professions and actively engaged in different businesses like vegetable vending, milk business, rice business, furniture making and selling, tailoring, popped rice business, paddy business, general store and transport business and with this loan, hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase some modern tools and machines for her garage.

loans.name: Jerry Rose

texts.en:
Jerry Rose is 35 years old and comes from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Happily married to Sherwin, a tricycle driver, she has two children. One is in the elementary level in school and the youngest is not of school-age yet. The couple both work to provide for their daily needs and the school needs of their child.

Jerry Rose opened a small variety store a year ago. Her store sells essential food items, and toiletries as well. Most Filipinos buy by-the-piece or by-the-kilo since it is all they can afford with their minimum daily wage. Living in a third-world country does not deter her from improving their lives. Aside from her small store, she also has a tricycle unit which her husband drives. A tricycle carries around four passengers. In the Philippines, tricycle is a common means of transportation.  

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to add more grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages, etc. She wants to see that she offers most of the essential food items to attract more customers.  

She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, since it will greatly help sustain their needs, especially her children's educational needs.

Jerry Rose's simple dream is to expand her store. She prays to always have love and harmony in her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Americo Edelman

texts.es:
Americo, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a cuidar de sus hijos y el hogar tiene 3 hijos de 11, 8 y 1 año de edad.

Americo, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años de edad y aprendió gracias a sus padres porque ellos eran agricultores, ahora él solo se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería en pequeño, el lugar donde cultiva está a 25 minutos de su hogar y viaja en un coche halado por un caballo, él se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para empezar a trabajar en sus parcelas a las 6:00 a.m. y regresar hasta las 2:00 ó 4:00 p.m. 

Americo, necesita el dinero para comprar 16 quintales de fertilizantes foleares. 

E sueño de Americo, es poder darles la oportunidad a sus hijos para que estudien y además desea dejarles un pequeño terreno para poder construir sus viviendas.
texts.en:
Americo is 33 years old and has a 9th grade education. He is married, and his wife cares for their home and three children, who are 11, 8, and 1 year old.

Americo has worked in agriculture since he was 10 years old, and he learned it thanks to his parents, who were farmers. Now he alone works in farming and raising livestock at a small scale. The place where he farms is 25 minutes from his home and he travels in a horse-drawn carriage. He gets up at 5 A.M. to begin working on his plot at 6 A.M., and he returns between 2 P.M. and 4 P.M.

Americo needs money to buy 1600 kg of foliar fertilizer.

His dream is to be able to give his children the opportunity to go to school, and he also wishes to leave them a small plot of land on which to build their homes.

loans.use: to buy 1600 kg of foliar fertilizer.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma, 38 years old, is a very enthusiastic person. She is married and, with her husband (also shown in the photo), has been successfully running a small general store. She has a good client base and makes sufficient income to bear their household expenses.

In order to improve her husband's business Uzma has requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. It will allow them to consistently meet the increasing demand at the store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc

loans.name: Parbati Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, ten self-dependent women of Udepur village, Titlagarh of Bolangir district, Odisha, India formed a group named Parbati. All the group members are from poor families. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihoods by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Chandra is the most active and energetic lady of this village and has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. This incredible lady, aged about 32 years, is standing in the second row, second person from the right hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and one child.

For the last three years, Chandra has been engaged with vegetable cultivating and selling with the help and support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 6,500 from their occupation, but the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So, she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan.

She will purchase good-quality seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable cultivation. As it is the rainy season, it is a very suitable time to invest in vegetable cultivation. Through this, Chandra hopes that she will definitely get more production of vegetables and generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children.

The other nine members of the group also engage themselves with different small businesses like poultry, egg business, vegetable vending, breakfast centre, fancy item business, milk selling, fishery, etc.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is 47 years old, a married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchases and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. 

She is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Magalys Marilin

texts.es:
Magalys vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, cuenta con casa propia donde habita con una de sus hijas. Actualmente ella trabaja en dos casas realizando quehaceres domésticos, es muy conocida ya que es una señora muy responsable en su trabajo. 
Magalys desea emprender en el negocio de venta de comida, es una señora Manabita que tiene una muy buena sazón en sus comidas, incluso antes sabia distribuir almuerzos por el sector; ahora desea aprovechar un local que un familiar le esta cediendo en una vía principal de la ciudad, es pequeño pero le hace falta adecuaciones y activos para poder iniciar, porque ahora solo cuenta con una cocina industrial. Por ello Fundación Alternativa pudo apoyarla en su emprendimiento, con este crédito podrá comprar vajilla, un cilindro de gas, vitrina, mesas y la puerta del local. 
Está muy agradecida con KIVA porque podrán mejorar sus ingresos y convertirse en una microempresaria de éxito, así podrá mejorar su vivienda que no está en buen estado.
texts.en:
Magalys lives in the city of Santo Domingo. She has her own house, where she lives with one of her daughters. Currently, she works performing household chores in two homes. She is well-known, as she is a very responsible woman at work.

Magalys wishes to establish a food sale business. She is a woman from Manabi whose food has very good flavor. In fact, she used to distribute lunches in the area. Now, she wants to take advantage of a retail space that a family member is giving her, which is located on a main street in the city. It is small, and it needs adjustments and supplies before she can start, as it currently only has an industrial kitchen.

For this reason, Fundacion Alternativa is helping her establish her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy dishes, a tank of gas, a display case, tables, and a door for the store. She is very grateful to Kiva because she will be able to improve her income and to become a successful microentrepreneur. That way, she will be able to better her house, which is not in good condition.

loans.use: to establish a food sale business on a main street in the city. She is very excited to become a new microentrepreneur.

loans.name: Jostus

texts.en:
Jostus is 42 years old and married with 4 children all attending school in Kasese, Uganda. He has a general merchandise shop and earns extra income from farming. He works hard: 12 hours a day and 7 days a week. He is hardworking and honest, with a dream of expanding his business into wholesale despite facing a difficulty of limited capital. 

He requests credit to buy rice, soap, soda, spirits and beer for selling.

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, soda, spirits and beer for selling.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province, Vanny is 34 years old and a mother of two children. For 16 years, she has earned income to support her family's condition by rice cropping. She can earn an income of around 20,000 KHR per day, and she can save about 12,000 KHR each day from her business. Having a lot of competitive sellers is the main challenge for her business. 

This is Vanny's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. With her past loan, she bought decent clothes for her family. 

She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her farm. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to update her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: América Belem

texts.es: América tiene 44 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en Sinaloa. América es arquitecta y trabaja en un despacho arquitectónico, es una mujer perseverante que siempre alcanza lo que se propone, se siente orgullosa de ser una mujer cabal con sus principios y valores además tiene una gran fascinación por la decoración y el diseño de interiores, pasatiempo que se complementa perfectamente con su carrera, por esta razón ella inicio un negocio de decoración de interiores en el 2013, negocio que le ha sido sumamente gratificante, ella solicita un préstamo de  MXN 12,000  para poder formalizar su negocio e independizarlo de su casa, además de pagar adeudos con algunos proveedores de artículos. Su mayor sueño en la vida es ver realizados a sus hijos.
texts.en:
América is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Sinaloa. América is an architect who works at an architectural firm. She is a persevering woman who always achieves what she sets out to do. América is proud to be an outstanding woman with principles and values. In addition, she has a great fascination with decoration and interior design, a hobby that complements her degree perfectly. For this reason, she started an interior design business in 2013. América has found this to be extremely rewarding.

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 MXN so that she can formalize an independent business out of her home. In addition, she will pay a few outstanding debts to her suppliers. Her greatest wish in life is to see her children reach their potential.

loans.use: to formalize the interior design business that she operates out of her home.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
A senhora Virginia tem 34 anos de idade, casado e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 2  frequentam o ensino primario e 1 o ensino secundario e o ultimo ainda sem idade escolar, vive em casa propria.
É comerciante, nos empréstimos anteriores, comprou mercadoria para o seu negocio com este empréstimo , vai comprar ,mechas, biquines, discartaveis, lencos, capulanas, vaselina, topes,dark lovly(produto de cabelo) para apetreichar o seu salao que esta em casa.
Ela, sonha em ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, melhorar a sua casa para confortar os seus filhos. Apesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, tem o desafio de reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Virginia is 34 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are in primary school and one is in secondary school. The youngest child is still below school age. She lives in a house that she owns.
She's a business owner. With the previous loan she bought merchandise for her business. With this loan she'll purchase hair weaves, bikinis, scarves, traditional skirts, vaseline, tops, hair care products and other items to stock her salon which is located in her house.
Virginia's dream is to expand her business so she can meet her customers' needs. She also dreams of improving her home in order to provide comfort for her children. Despite her financial struggles, she has the challenge of repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves, bikinis, scarves, traditional skirts, vaseline, tops, hair care products and other items to stock her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, paint, and wood

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 31 years old, a married woman. She has two children. 

Tahira is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. Her husband, shown in the photo, also assists her in her work. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, thread and frames to meet the orders of her customers in time to earn a good amount of profit. 

This monetary help can take Tahira closer to her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, thread and frames to meet orders of her customers in time to earn a good amount of profit

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Residing in the Kandal province, Vannak is 51 years old and a mother of 4 children. She can earn income to improve her family condition via rice cropping. Her rice was destroyed by insects and she gets little yield from her farm. 

This is Vannak's sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has repaid back her past loans completely. With her past loan, she was able to update her living conditions. In fact, it enabled her to live in a decent house, as others do. 

She is now applying for a new loan, which is 2,000,000 KHR, to save her endangered business. She will use her entire loan to buy fertilizer to support her farmland so that she can get more crops. 

She hopes that she can earn more income than ever before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland so that she can get more crops

loans.name: Evelyn Milad

texts.es: Evelin de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la elaboración de flores artificiales y de papel, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 22 años, comercializa sus productos en el mes de noviembre y su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales (papel, alambre, pintura, etc.) para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su fuente de ingresos y así poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Evelin, who is 38 years old, lives in a house that she owns with her life partner. She works making artificial and paper flowers. She has had this occupation for 22 years. She sells her products in the month of November and her business is located in her place of residence. With the profits she makes, she manages to settle some of her household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase materials (paper, wire, paint, etc.) to continue with her work, as this is her source of income, and be able to make better profits

loans.use: to buy materials, such as paper, wire, paint, etc. to make flowers.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 48 años de edad desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra, por lo que se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, vive en casa propia con su nieta, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Antonio desea invertir en insumos para su cultivo ya que dentro de poco empieza la época de siembra, para ello solicita un crédito para invertir en: fertilizante, semillas, controles de plagas y abono para seguir con su cultivo con el que espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio is 48 years old. When he was very young man, he learned how to work the land. As a result, he has been cultivating corn and beans for several years. Antonio lives in his own home along with his granddaughter. He sells his products in the surrounding areas near his home.

Antonio wants to invest in supplies for his crops since the planting season is shortly approaching. He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in fertilizers, seeds, pest controls, and compost so that he can proceed with his crops. Antonio hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, pest controls, and compost.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old and supports two children. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him KES 15,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops in order to have a better harvest to sell to clients, to meet both client and family needs.

He plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients and to educate his child. His hope is to expand his agricultural sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops in order to have a better harvest to sell to clients, to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying long enough to repay goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his hotel business and equip it with modern furniture to attract more customers.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Battambang province, Thy is 48 years old and a mother of seven children. She engages in rice cropping and growing sesame to earn money to improve her family’s living. Moreover, she can earn more income via raising buffalos and working for others for a fee. 

Her farming is not doing well because of drought. This is her eighth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans. She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her farming business. She hopes that she can get more income than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her farming business.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 28-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady. She deals in business selling stitched or stitch cloth. She also stitches cloth as per the demands of her customers. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors, along with stitching material such as spools of threads and needles, to expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Nusrat expects a boost in her earnings with the loan. She plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors along with stitching material such as spools of threads and needles.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 45 years old and a married woman. She has been doing a business of bangle sales for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family's needs. Therefore she started her own business to contribute to the family income.  

Razia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate a healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. 

She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate a healthier source of income

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 31 years old, married, and a vigorous lady. She is a mother of three children.  She has been manufacturing carpets for many years with her husband, who is shown in the photo with her. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain dental care

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, rocks and iron so that he can start building his house.

loans.name: Eva Antonia

texts.es: Eva de 44 años de edad es viuda vive en casa propia con su hijo,  ella posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 6 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eva, who is 44 years old, is a widow. She lives in her own house with her son. She has had a bakery located in her place of residence for 6 years. She has many customers because of the quality with which she prepares the bread. With the earnings that she obtains, she manages to get ahead with the household expenses. 

She is applying for a loan for the purchase of flour, sugar, flavored jellies, baking pans, etc., in order to be able to continue with her work and thus have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, baking pans, etc.

loans.name: Tabora Group

texts.en:
Mariamu is a businesswoman and a mother of three school-aged kids. She is in her late thirties. She has been running a food shop business for four years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 11:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Mariamu’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use this loan to buy food items for her shop, such as 100 kg of rice, 50 kg of bean flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business and opening another shop. She will share this loan with her loan group, Tabora, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food items in her shop, such as 100 kg of rice, 50 kg of bean flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 62 years old and from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. To earn a living, she has operated a tricycle for four years. This has been her source of income since she started her service four years ago. Being a single parent has not been easy for her, but with her positive and joyful disposition, she was able to overcome her trials in life.

In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Cavite, the tricycle is a common means of transportation which carries about four passengers. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The townspeople usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even go from one town to the other.

She is now humbly asking for the financial assistance of a 25,000 PHP loan to buy another tricycle. Tricycle transportation is really a need in their community. Adding one more tricycle for service will help improve her income and serve more passengers. She is thanking God and you in advance for your support, and it will surely help meet her family's needs.

Virginia's simple dream is to sustain her business and God's traveling mercies for her tricycle service. She prays for abundance in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy another tricycle unit for her transportation service.

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es:
Bartolo es un hombre de 57 años de edad, vive junto a su amada familia en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá, él cuenta que afortunadamente con el crédito él pudo comprar sus insumos y darle el mantenimiento a su cultivo de papa, y gracias a Dios esta cosecha le dejo una buena ganancia, con el que logro cubrir algunas necesidades de su familia, también cuenta que ahora su vida se avisto muy beneficiado por este apoyo porque su cultivo ha incrementado, pero Bartolo con el afán de mejorar su calidad de vida sigue luchando todos los días, él cuenta con el gran privilegio de vivir en una zona muy fértil por lo tanto es necesario aprovechar esta oportunidad de la vida por tal razón solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de papa.
Bartolo tiene en anhelo de conseguir este nuevo crédito para que su familia prospere económicamente.
texts.en:
Bartolo, 57, lives with his beloved family in a community in the department of Solola.  He tells us that that fortunately, with his previous loan, he was able to buy supplies and maintain his potato crops, and thanks to God his harvest left him with good earnings, which he used to cover some expenses for his family.  In addition, he states that now he has seen his life improve due to this loan, because his crops have increased.  

However, Bartolo, with the desire to improve his quality of life, continues to struggle each day.  He has the great privilege of living in a very fertile area, and so he wants to take advantage of this opportunity that life is presenting him. This is why he is requesting a loan to invest in fertilizers and potato seeds.

Bartolo really hopes to get this new loan so that his family can prosper financially.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and potato seeds

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36 years old and a resident of Zziwa in Rakai district. He is married with seven children who all attend school. Stephen trades in secondhand clothes, and he began doing this in 2010. He is also a farmer who grows coffee. He works 7 days a week, 10 hours per day and started this business with the aim of improving his daily income.

Stephen wants a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more clothes as stock for his business. This will boost his sales and income. His customers are people from different areas of the town.  However, his challenges are competition and lack of enough capital to expand the business. Stephen is a hardworking man who wants to see his family have a good standard of living. He appreciates the UGAFODE and Kiva support and partnership.

loans.use: To boost his clothes business by buying more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik is 68 years old and he lives with his wife and his son in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Rubik has a higher education and now he works at the village school as a teacher of skills of modern technologies. 

Despite of his not young age, Rubik is a very active and intelligent person, ready to get acquainted with any innovation in the field of technology. Rubik is also a farmer, and since he is the only bread-winner in his family, he does his best to earn a good living for his family. 

Rubik is described as a very clever and interesting person, and all his pupils say that his lessons are very informative and each gives a lot of useful knowledge to every pupil.  

Rubik will use this loan of 250,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of a new computer, which is the most important equipment for his work.

loans.use: to purchase of new computer, which is the most important equipment for his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at her home to improve access to sanitation and water sources.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted mats to sell.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.pt:
Jovem de 28 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, ainda sem filhos, é policia de nível básico e trabalha como vigilante onde ganha salário mínimo e, para maximizar os seu rendimento, tem feito policiamento particular numa empresa dentro do Distrito nos dias em que não estiver de serviço. Actualmente vive numa casa cedida pelo serviço, esta a tomar o credito pela 1ªvez.
Com o mesmo pretende comprar: areia, pedra, cimento, para dar inicio a construção de sua casa, de maneiras a realizar o seu sonho de ter casa própria.
Sua maior dificuldade é o facto de ter rendimento muito baixo para satisfazer seus planos, tendo ainda o seu pai na sua responsabilidade
texts.en:
Silvio is a young man who's 28 years old. He's in a common law married and doesn't have children yet. He's a police officer and a security guard, and he earns minimum wage. In order to improve his income, he's been providing private security services for a local company on his days off from work. He currently lives in company housing. This is his first loan.
With the loan he intends to purchase sand, rocks and cement so that he can start building his house. That way he'll fulfill his dream to become a home owner.
His biggest difficulty is the fact that his earnings are too low for him to achieve his plans. Also, he has his father under his responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase sand, rocks and cement so that he can start building his house.

loans.name: Stanslaus

texts.en:
Stanslaus is 57 years old, married to Lined, and he supports eight children. He has been a farmer for the last year and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more food such as onions, tomatoes and vegetables for sale to clients in the market.  

He plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients and to educate his child. His hope is to expand his business sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more foods such as onions, tomatoes and vegetables for sale to clients in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops

loans.name: Zhasmena

texts.en:
Zhasmena lives with her big family in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She works at the school buffet now and her husband works a private workshop as an engineer. 

Zhasmena has a great request and she greatly hopes not to be rejected. Her father died a year ago and now she wants to buy a tombstone for him, but having big family and numerous needs connected with it; she is short of money to realize her plan. So she asks for a loan to buy a tombstone for her father, whom she greatly misses. A year has passed, but she cannot get used of this kind of loss.

loans.use: to pay for a tombstone for her father, who she greatly misses

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with three children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. She cites school fees and food as her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the marketplace. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Channy is 28 years old. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are too young for school and one who is in school. She has earned income to support her family’s living via rice cropping for ten years. She can earn income of about 28,000KHR per day and she can save around 10,000KHR each day from her business. The problem in her business is her rice can sell at a low price.

For Channy, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully paid back her past loans completely. With her past loans, she can update her family's condition as well. She now leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide to support her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Yoeung's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Kampong Cham province, Yoeung is 62 years old and a mother of two dependent children. For her living, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she has earned more income working for others for a fee for 44 years. She can earn about 37,000 KHR per day and she is able to save around 18,000 KHR each day after offsetting her business expenses. Her rice can sell at a low price. 

This is the third cycle for Yoeung with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. With her past loan, she can improve her living standards better than before with decent household supplies to use for her family. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticide to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticide to support her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a Babban Gona farmer from Pegi Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Adamu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to provide healthcare for his family. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Adamu has ambitious plans to harvest 45 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Adamu now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Durdana

texts.en:
